loans.name: Dionicio

texts.en:
Dionicio G. is from the village of Esperanza West, Aurora, Isabela. He is 35 years old. Dionicio is married and has 1 young child. To make a living, Dionicio owns & operates a business, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. Dionicio has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP every harvest season.

In 2010, Dionicio joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Dionicio is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Dionicio from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure.

loans.name: Antony Mwaura

texts.en:
Antony Mwaura N. is a 35-year-old man, married to Margaret Njoki. Together they have three children. Margaret supports the family by adding income, while Antony works as a mechanic in Eldoret town. He has been in this business for 15 years now and gets a monthly income of 15,000 shillings.

This will be Antony's fifth loan from KADET LTD. He has repaid all other loans successfully, and with this loan he plans to use it entirely to buy spare parts for his mechanic job. His dream is to become richer and have a happy family.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for the business

loans.name: Chin's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of four members. They are located in Thmei village, in Kandal province. Mrs. Chin C. is 41 years old and she has been selected as the group leader by its members. The members of this group will use their portions of the loan to support their different purposes. 

Mrs. Chin C. stays at home and takes care of her two children who all are attending the local school. Her husband, Mr. Mao Hieng, is 45 years old and he works as a soldier. With the soldier's salary, they still earn too little of an income to support and improve the family's living conditions. In order to increase their income to improve the family living’s conditions, Mrs. Chin C. would like to ask for a loan to buy groceries for selling in the local village.

loans.use: To buy grocery items for selling in the local village.

loans.name: Dinara's Group

texts.en:
Dinara A. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Toktogul. Dinara is 49 years old and married to a driver. Together, they bring up two sons and two daughters; all four children are students.  

Five years ago, with the initial investment of 10000 soms, Dinara started to breed cattle. Reselling cattle after fattening, she earns 1500 soms per month. With money received from the loan, she wants to increase the number of cattle. In the future she wants to expand her business to be able to support her children financially.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Kuy

texts.en:
Kuy S. presently weaves bamboo baskets for sale. He sells his finished products in and around his community. He makes over 50 sets of baskets before selling out. He also orders baskets from the other villagers and sells them, to make additional income. His wife helps him to buy the raw materials and in weaving the baskets. 

Kuy S. and his wife use his old motor bike to pick up the finished products. Unfortunately, this existing motorcycle had broken down during use. Because does not have enough savings to buy a new motorbike, Kuy S. has decided to look for lenders on Kiva. Kuy S. is a 25-year-old married man blessed with two school-aged children.

loans.use: To buy a motor bike to replace the broken one.

loans.name: Twinomugisa Kisindizi Group

texts.en: Margret is a thirty five year old married woman with three children living in her own house in Karuguuza Uganda with a dream of educating her children up to university. She sells beans and maize and she has been in business for five years amidst the challenges of seasonal changes ,nevertheless  her business plan is to own a truck for transporting her goods . Margret needs the credit facility to buy beans and maize to sell.She is a member of Twinomugisa Kisindizi group where each member guarantees the other.

loans.use: Purchasing maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Khawla

texts.en:
Khawla is a young woman from Safout village next to Jenin. Khawla has four daughters. As her daughters are old enough, she decided to go back to school and receive a BA degree and start working. Khawla took a loan from FATEN to pay for the last year left to earn her degree. Khalwa's husband is a National Palestinian Authority employee.

Since Khawla is a religious woman, her husband Khaled appears in the picture here instead of her.

loans.use: To pay for school tuition fees

loans.name: Habib

texts.en:
M. Habib is a diligent and tenacious farmer, who strives to meet his family’s needs. His wife does not work and thus, he carries the financial burden alone, through his farming income, to meet his family’s needs. Habib works on a 1-hectare farm owned by his parents. His harvests are sometimes not maximized because his cultivation method and seeds are not the best. Better farming supplies, seeds and fertilizer require a larger capital, which he lacks. 

Habib is now relieved that IMON International is helping him to get the loan that he needs to improve his farming. This loan will be used to buy superior seeds, organic fertilizers and pesticides. Habib is waiting for his next harvest, which he hopes will yield better results than his previous harvests. He will use his farming income to support his children’s educational needs. If there is still some money left, he really hopes to fix his unfinished house.      
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seed and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Mey

texts.en:
Mey P. has been in the farming business for years. She plants various crops to earn a living and typically generates an income of $6 per day. She and her husband and appear in the photo. She has a life partner in her husband, who works as a horse cart driver, earning a profit of approximately $2.5 per day. 

This couple, having been married for years, has only one lovely child. Mey P. says that the horse and cart that her husband uses for providing his service daily was purchased on credit, and it is the time for paying back.  So, Mey P. is applying for a loan to pay for the horse and cart cost.

loans.use: To pay for costs of a horse and cart.

loans.name: Zakirjon

texts.en:
S. Zakirjon is a 37 year old farmer. He is married and has 5 children. His wife is a housewife and this leaves him the sole breadwinner. He has been farming wheat, onions, potatoes for the past 16 years on his piece of land. Zakirjon would like to adopt new farming technology to boost his agricultural yield. He needs to be able to meet the financial responsibility educating of his children and of maintaining his family's living costs, but he lacks the capital. Zakirjon requests a loan of $3000 USD to be used towards purchasing seeds and fertilizer for growing his crop. He is very responsible and promises to repay the loan on time.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seed and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Matthew Okemwa

texts.en:
Matthew Okemwa M. is 42 years old, married and a father of three children, he lives in Mitume, in Kitale town. He operates a motorcycle transport as his primary business and also runs a shop where he sells things like sugar, flour, and rice. 

He has been in this business for one year now and he gets a monthly income of 12,000 shillings. Matthew has never borrowed from any other MFI. This will be his second loan from KADET LTD, which he plans to use to buy petroleum for his motor bike for 1,800 KES, five bags of sugar for 15,400 KES, two bundles of flour for 2,800 KES, and two bags of rice for 5,000 KES.

With the income he is going to get he plans to add more stock to his shop. In the future, Matthew would like to own a wholesale shop, educate his children and also create employment for the jobless.

loans.use: To buy petroleum for his motorcycle

loans.name: Saidburkhon

texts.en:
T. Saidburkhon is 28 years old, married and lives with his wife and three little children. He is a very hard-worker and works cultivating different kinds of vegetables, an activity which he has practiced for 3 years. He enjoys his work for the contact with nature and also because vegetables sell very well in the markets and are valued within his community. Currently, Saidburkhon needs a loan of $1500 USD for his business. With this loan, he will buy seeds and fertilizers to improve the farming and get a better production.

loans.use: Purchasing seed and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Mpara Hiv/aids Prevention And Support Group-Kyenjojo

texts.en: 45 year old B. Umaru has been involved in a timber sales business for the past 3 years in Kijwiga-Kyenjojo. He says he began this business out of personal interest. This fledgling business has been making progressive strides over the past few years. He has been running the business on the basis of his tenacity, hardwork and enterprising spirit. Umaru, who is happily married and has 8 kids, also has a cattle sales business on the side. Weekly this business generates him shillings 20,000. Most of the timber he sells is bought by individuals constructing family homes and carpenters from Kyenjojo town, some even come from as far away as Kampala. With this loan, Umaru says he is going to buy more young eucalyptus trees to plant. The plan is to be able to get more timber to resell once the trees mature.

loans.use: The purchase of young eucalyptus trees to plant.

loans.name: Afzal

texts.en:
Since he was very young, K. Afzal has dedicated himself to the raising of cattle and sheep. He is married and a father, with the necessity of supporting his children to complete their studies. His wife also helps him with the business. Afzal is faced with the need to purchase calves and young sheep. In order to then commercialize the derivative products, the raised animals are sold to farmers who resupply the small farmers with calves. To acquire the animals, Afzal comes to IMON International. He will obtain the necessary credit to purchase calves and young sheep in order to continue to maintain his dear home. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. loans.use: Purchasing of calves and young sheep.

loans.name: Chhay

texts.en: Chhay H., age 40, is a married woman who earns her living by buying rice in bulk at a reasonable cost. She sells her rice to people to earn her income. Usually, Chhay H. generates an income, on average, of $8 per day to ensure that her family has a comfortable standard of living. She has been married for many years to Boeum Chal, 40, a horse cart driver. They have four children: three are single, one is married, and lives separately. Chhay H. is concerned in that she has one son who doesn’t have an occupation yet. To encourage her son, Chhay H. would like to request a loan for her son to buy a horse and cart for running a new career.

loans.use: To buy a horse and cart for running a new career.

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.en:
Jamshed is a hard-working entrepreneur from Penjikent, Tajikistan. He has operated his own car repair business for the past 5 years. Jamshed has extensive experience in this field and his skills are very much in demand. Car ownership is increasing rapidly in Tajikistan, which means more business for repair technicians like Jamshed. He works hard to earn a good income and to support his family. He and his wife have two children. Jamshed has requested a loan of $1000 USD to buy spare parts and other tools to expand his workshop. He is very thankful to everyone who has decided to support him.

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. loans.use: Expanding workshop.

loans.name: Adham

texts.en:
Adham, who is the married father of three children, uses his personal car to provide taxi services within his city and between cities, a business he has operated for four years. Adham's goal is to pay off his car loan and be able to use the business profits to improve his family's living conditions. Adham would like to receive a loan of $1500 to pay for minor car repairs.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for minor car repairs

loans.name: Khudoikul

texts.en:
Khudoikul T. is 54 years old, married and has four children of school age. Khudoikul crafts Tajikistan’s traditional cradles. The cradles in Tajikistan are very colorful and made of wood. As a rule, this traditional cradle is presented by the grandparents when the baby is forty days old, and this event is celebrated in the family circle.

Khudoikul has been in this business for thirty years. His wife and children help him. He sells the cradles out of his home. The business stability ensures a steady income and the family’s possibility to improve their living conditions.

Khudoikul has been working with IMON for two years. For the entire period of time he has shown himself as a successful client, managing his loans with accuracy and precision. Today Khudoikul requests a loan in the amount of 7500 TJS in order to purchase the planks and paint for producing the cradles. Since Khudoikul has gained a reputation for responsibility with his financial obligations and for keeping his word, we are happy to have another opportunity to assist him with the operation of his business.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich place in history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the farthest reach of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged its already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous, and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve their agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients have access to reasonable financial services. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase planks and paint

loans.name: Sevda

texts.ru:
Sevda N. 44 qoda. Ona ne zamujem i jivet v qorode Baku vmeste so svoyey sestroy. Sevda uje 10 let kak rabotayet v konsultacionnim biznese.
Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit noviy kompyuter dlya raboti. Etomu biznessu Sevda nauchilas u svoyey sestri. Sevda ochen  trudolubiviy chelovek.
texts.en: Sevda N. is forty-four years old. She's not married and lives with her sister in the city of Baku. Sevda is a hardworking person. For the past ten years she has worked as a consultant, a trade she learned from her sister. She's requesting a loan of 2000 AZN to acquire a new computer for work.

loans.use: To buy a computer

loans.name: Mohbigul

texts.ru: Давлатова Мохбигул проживает в районе Вахдат. Ей 43 года. Замужем, имеет четверых детей. Образование среднее. Уже три года как занимается торговлей. Рядом с домом у нее имеет продуктовый магазин. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: D. Mohbigul lives in the Vahdat region. She's forty-three years old, married and has four children. She has a high school level of education and has worked in sales for the past three years. She owns a grocery store near her home. She's requesting a loan to increase her goods turnover.

loans.use: To increase goods turnover

loans.name: Burulbu Tashkokulova's Group

texts.en:
Burulbu T., 46 and married, is the leader of this group. Her husband works as an employee of the Social Fund Department. Together they have five children. The youngest is a daughter of sixteen who studies at school.

Three years ago with an initial investment of 15,000 KGS Burulbu started to breed cattle. By reselling cattle after fattening them, she earns 1500 KGS per month. With money she will receive from this loan she will buy more cattle. In the future, Burulbu wants to expand her business and improve the family’s living conditions.

About Mol Bulak Finance

This loan is being presented by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious, socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of its “3-Ps” concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow larger) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year.

To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team—Supporters of Kyrgyzstan—at: http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Babak

texts.ru:
Babak A. 22 qoda. On ne jenat. Babak yavlyayetsya IDP personom, on pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas jivet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoimi roditelyami i sestroy. 
Babak uje 2 qoda kak zanimayetsya etim biznessom skotovodstva. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyeqo otca  kotoriy i pomoq yemu nachat etoto bizness.
texts.en: Babak A. is twenty-two years, not married. He's an internally displaced person from the city of Fuzuli, currently residing in the Fuzuli region with his family. For two years he has bred and raised cattle. Babak learned this trade from his father, who helped him start the business. He's asking for a loan of 2000 AZN in order to buy some cows.

loans.use: To buy cows.

loans.name: Buunisa

texts.en:
Buunisa K. is an attentive mother of a tightly-knit family. She has two sons. Her husband works as a salesman at the local car market and does everything he can to cover his family’s expenses.

In 1992, in order to find an additional means of subsistence for her family, Buunisa with her husband started their cattle-breeding business. They worked hard and managed to enlarge the number of milch cows at their farm and raise milk sales. Buunisa is a very exacting stockkeeper who follows all medical procedures with her cattle to avoid animal diseases.

Now, Buunisa is applying for a loan of 120,000 KGS to broaden her business and develop her farm. The loan will allow her to buy milch cows and increase her milk sales. In the future, Buunisa dreams of maintaining a big farm with a large number of cattle.

About Bai-Tushum and Partners:

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable segment of Kyrgyzstan’s population. It is one of the leading microfinance institutions in the country. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services to rural and urban areas that leads to increased employment and meets the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase milch cows

loans.name: Nepthalie

texts.en:
Nepthalie S., a 43-year-old married mother of three school-aged children, is from the village of Bagacay, Sibutad. To make a living, Nepthalie runs a grocery store selling basic household items in the local community. Engaged in her business for four years, she earns a monthly net income of 3000.00.

In 2010, Nepthalie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC that was used to purchase additional stocks to sell, she is requesting her third loan of 14,000 PHP to be used as additional working capital.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 40-year-old member of Faulu Kenya.  He runs a butchery so as to earn a living.  In addition, he does dairy farming and operates a motorbike transport business.  He is a hardworking man who hopes to be a successful businessman in the future.  

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been motivated to work hard in his business.  He has also developed a saving culture with his group members in Faulu Kenya.   He has requested a loan for 80,000 KES to buy two cows to slaughter for sale.

loans.use: To buy two cows for slaughter for sale.

loans.name: Lizzy Atieno

texts.en:
Lizzy Atieno O. is 28 years old and a single mother of two children aged between four and six years old. She lives with her children and the Corner Legio area of Kisumu county.

Lizzy has a business of telephone money transfer locally known as "MPESA." She is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD to enable her buy credit cards and sim cards to add to her stock. Lizzy earns a profit of 13,000 KES per month. Her family depends entirely on her for upkeep and this means that the profits made are utilized to cater for the family's needs.

Her desire is to have another telephone service outlet in the town center.

loans.use: To buy scratch cards and sim cards to add to her stock

loans.name: Arif

texts.ru:
Arif T. 49 let. On jenat i imeyet 3 detey , dva iz kotorix uchatsya v kolledje. Arif yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli i seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey lubimoy semyoy.
 
Arif uje pochti 14 let kak rabotayet v etom biznesse prodaji medicinskix priporatov. Eto uje vtoraya ssuda Arifa v perviy raz on bral 1200$ i za eto on blagodarek Kive i lenderam za kredit. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit kupit medicinskiye lekarstva dlya pereprodaji.

http://partners.kiva.org/lend/4520
texts.en:
Arif T. is forty-nine years old. He's married and has three children, two of whom attend college. Arif is an internally displaced person from the city of Fuzuli, currently residing in the Fuzuli region with his family. For the past fourteen years, Arif has bought and resold medical supplies. He's requesting a loan of 2000 AZN in order to acquire some healthcare products to resell for profit. 
This is Arif's second loan here at Kiva. His first loan was of $1200 and he would like to thank Kiva and its lenders for the support they offer. 

http://partners.kiva.org/lend/4520

loans.use: To buy healthcare supplies for resale

loans.name: Alijon

texts.en:
Alijon is a businessman from the small town of Penjikent, Northern Tajikistan.  He offers transportation services in his home town and its vicinity.  His usual route is Penjikent-Dushanbe and Penjikent-Khujand.  Alijon's business is the main source of income for his family.  He started this business 3 years ago. 

Alijon is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD to buy a new car.  He believes this will help him attract more clients.  We believe Alijon's focused approach to business and his diligent hard work will help him repay this loan on time and expand his business as a result. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule.  It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi.  The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need.  To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing a new car for taxi service.

loans.name: Ruya

texts.en:
Ruya Kanaan is an employee of the Palestine Business Men Forum. Ruya is an ambitious woman who is studying at the American University of Jenin to earn a Master's degree.

Ruya came to FATEN and took a loan to pay the last semester's tuitions fees. Ruya will finish her degree this year and this will reflect on her academic and financial situation. 

Ruya appears in the picture here in FATEN's branch in Jenin.

loans.use: To pay for graduate school tuition fees

loans.name: Maripet Ole

texts.en:
Maripet Ole K. is a 24-year-old single man. He supports three brothers and his mother. Maripet is a farmer, and he has been doing the farming on his own piece of land for the last five years. 
  
He learned about KADET from a member of a group that is registered with KADET. This will be his second loan. He is planning to buy maize seeds and fertilizer. Maize has proved to be doing well in his area due to good climatic conditions.

With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to enlarge his farming. His hope and dream is to export maize overseas. Maripet is a conscientious man who focuses on his set objectives.

loans.use: To buy maize seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is married to Samuel, and together they have two children, ages six and 11. Her business is in a place called Corner Dagorretti, which is on the outskirts of Nairobi town.

She runs a hardware shop where she sells construction materials to the residents of Dagorretti and other neighbouring trading centers. She has been in this business for a period of two years now. 

With this loan, she plans to buy more cement and nails to add to her stock. This is her third loan from KADET LTD. She has paid off her previous loans well and on time.

loans.use: To buy more cement and nails

loans.name: Kholbibi

texts.en:
Problems and money shortages never defeated Kholbibi, who has always looked for a way to get past obstacles and continue to improve her situation. Kholbibi is an extremely hard-working and energetic woman.  She is 49 years old, married and the loving mother of 4 children. 

Kholbibi started her own business because her husband’s salary was not enough for their family expenses.  For more than 7 years, she has operated a store where she sells men’s shoes and clothing.  Her store is well known and people love to visit because it's clean, tidy, and run by someone who is very kind and thoughtful.  

Kholbibi hopes that her store will keep growing so that she can maintain a comfortable life for her family, especially for her children. To make that possible, she has applied for a new loan that she will use to buy more clothing to sell.  For this purpose, Kholbibi requests $1,500.  She promises to repay the loan in time and thanks everyone for supporting her.      
 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of the new clothing in order to increase the range of goods for selling.

loans.name: Komiljon

texts.en:
Komiljon has been dedicated to cattle farming for 7 years.  He is married and the father of 3 children.  He makes a great effort to meet the needs of his children and to bring sustenance to his humble home.  His greatest need now is to buy young cattle to expand his business.  For this reason, Komiljon turned to IMON International, in order to obtain loans that will allow him to purchase these animals and make his business grow.     

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of cattle in order to expand the his business.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is married to Joshua and together they have one child aged four years old. They live in a place called Mukuyuni in Makueni town.This is a rural town set up. 

Mercy operates a beauty hair salon. She has been in this business for five years now. With this loan, she plans to buy some hair and beauty products so as to stock her salon. 

With the profits she will get from this loan, Mercy plans to expand her services by opening another hair saloon in a nearby center.

loans.use: to stock her beauty salon with seats for Kshs 15,000, hair products for Ksh 15,000, and other accessories for Kshs 20,000

loans.name: Charity Kulola

texts.en:
Charity Kulola M. is 52 years old, married to Amos and they have four children. She owns a retail shop and has been in this business for the last thirty years. 

She has good credit history with KADET LTD and this marks her third loan from KADET, which she plans to buy flour, sugar, rice, bread and cooking oil to add on the stock for sale. 

The anticipated profits will be directed into the expansion of her business. Her dream is to succeed through KADET loans.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, rice, bread and cooking oil

loans.name: Conslater Akinyi

texts.en:
Conslater Akinyi O. is a 23 year old lady. She is married to Michael and they have one child. Conslater has been a water vendor for the last five years and the business is doing well. 

This marks her second loan from KADET LTD, and she plans to purchase water pipes to improve on the services she offers and meet the demand of her customers.

The anticipated profits will be directed into the expansion of the business. Conslater’s hopes and dreams are to grow the business and uplift the living standards of her family in the future.

loans.use: purchase water pipes to improve the services she offers her customers

loans.name: Dorene

texts.en:
Dorene A. is 42 years old, married to Dominic and they have three children. Dominic is a jua kali person and he helps cater for the family needs.

Dorene has a grocery store that she has been running for the last 15 years. She is applying for her third loan from KADET LTD and plans to use the money to buy bananas, vegetables, onions and tomatoes to add to her stock. Her mothly income is KES 20,000. She will use the profits made to pay school fees for her children.

Her desire is to own a house and stop paying rent.

loans.use: To buy bananas, vegetables, onions and tomatoes to add to her stock

loans.name: Mpara Hiv/aids Prevention And Support Group-Kyenjojo

texts.en: Fifty-six-year-old M. Joyce has been in a food sales business for the past 10 years in Mpara Trading center-Kyenjojo. She has mostly been selling fresh foods such as beans, peas and cabbages at her stall. The story of how she started bearing a hand in this business is similar to many of her contemporaries doing the same business. She says the need to support herself and her kids financially is what spawned her interest in this business. Joyce is happily married with 1 child and she says this business generates profits to the tune of 30,000 shillings per week. Joyce says with this loan, she is going to purchase more fresh foods to resell. Joyce belongs to Mpara HIV/AIDS prevention and support group-Kyenjojo.

loans.use: To purchase more fresh foods to resell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose M. is 55 years old from Kakamega, married to George and they have two children who are all over 18 years old. Her husband George is a businessman and his income helps support the family.

Rose has a dairy business that she has been running for the past nine years. She currently owns one dairy cow which she has been using to milk and supply milk to the neighbouring shops and schools. She is applying for her third loan from KADET LTD and has a good credit history with us. Rose intends to use the money to buy another diary cow to add to her business so that she can be able to meet the demands of her clients by supplying them with milk.

Her dream and desire is to venture into poultry business in the future.

loans.use: Buy a dairy cow to add to her stock

loans.name: Margaret Kahindi

texts.en:
Margaret Kahindi Z. is 52 years old lady. She is married and they have two children. Margaret owns a retail shop and has been in this business for the last one year. 

This being her first loan from KADET LTD, she plans to sugar, maize meal, cooking oil, cereals and soda. Margaret plans to re-invest the anticipated profits into her business. Her hopes and dreams is to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase sugar, maize meal, cooking oil, cereals and soda

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
Sofía  es soltera y no tiene hijos, vive en casa de sus padres ya hace mucho tiempo, la casa esta ubicada en la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosí de la ciudad de La Paz.
La cliente trabaja realizando llenado de formularios de impuestos y tramites en derechos reales, tiene un puesto en la C. con una maquina de escribir frente al juzgado. El crédito lo utilizara para la compra de una computadora portátil, la cual le facilitará su trabajo. Es así como obtiene sus ingresos para su hogar.
Es su primer crédito y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Sofía is single and doesn't have any children.  She has lived in her parents' home for a long time.  Their home is located in Villa Nuevo Potosí district, in the city of La Paz.

Sofía works filling in tax forms and dealing with legal ownership forms.  She has a stall in the street, with a typewriter, opposite the courts.  She will use her loan to buy a laptop which will make her work easier.  This is how she makes income for her household.  This is her first loan and the socio-economic analysis we have carried out qualifies her favorably to access a loan.

loans.use: To buy a laptop to make her work easier

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food , school fees and rent.

She has operated a vegetable stall business for the past three years, selling in a shop to her neighbors’ and passersby.  Rehema faces a major challenge of competition from other vegetable stall operators in her area of operation. She hopes to establish a motorbike transport business in the future.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase stocks of vegetables, fruits, potatoes and tomatoes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of vegetables, fruits, potatoes and tomatoes.

loans.name: Benard Ole

texts.en:
Benard Ole Y. is 26-years-old. He is married and is a father of two children. Benard is a farmer and he does the farming activity on his own piece of land which he has been doing for the last five years. 
  
He learnt about KADET from a member of a group that is registered with KADET. This will be his second loan and he is planning to buy maize seeds and also buy fertilizer. Maize has proved to be doing well in his area due to good climatic conditions. 

With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to re-invest in the farm and plant more acres of maize. He hopes to export maize overseas and practice large scale farming.

Benard is an industrious man who focuses on his set objectives.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and also buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Goma

texts.en:
Gadzo is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, rent, and clothing and electricity bills. 

She has operated a food stall business for the past five years, selling from home to her neighbors’ and passersby. Gadzo faces a major challenge of competition from other food stall operators in the area. She hopes to establish a fish selling business in the future.

With the Kshs 60,000 she wants to purchase sacks of Irish potatoes, bananas and a freezer to store fish to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business and her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of Irish potatoes, bananas and a freezer to store fish to sell.

loans.name: Julia Jalango

texts.en:
Julia Jalango O. is 54 years old from Awendo area in Migori county. She is married, a widow with five children who are all above 18 years old.

Julia has a business of selling fish and vegetables. She comes from a community where fish is a delicacy and has quiet a number of clients who buy from her. Julia is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being told about the benefits of getting a loan to boost one's business by her friend who is a client of KADET. The money received will be used to buy more fish and vegetables to add to her stock. 

The profits made from this business will be used to expand the business by buying stock.  Her desire is to see her family's living standards improved as her business expands.

loans.use: Buy fish and vegetables to add to her stock.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es:
Wilfredo vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Pasankeri, de la ciudad de La Paz, es casado y tiene un hijo, el señor es empleado cajero y su esposa trabaja en la administración publica, con los ingresos que obtienen se mantienen; con un anterior crédito pudo aumentar el anticretico de dos habitaciones.

El crédito que ahora solicita será utilizado para comenzar la construcción de una vivienda propia. Wilfredo se encuentra satisfecho con los créditos que le otorgamos.

Por su antecedente histórico califica para obtener un nuevo crédito, se considera buen cliente.
texts.en:
Wilfredo lives in his parents' home in Pasankeri neighborhood, in the city of La Paz.  He is married and has one child.  Wilfredo works as a checkout operator and his wife works in public administration.  They support themselves with their joint income.

WIth a previous loan, Wilfredo was able to extend the 'anticretico' rental agreement he has on two rooms ('anticretico' is a rental system whereby tenants pay a fixed sum upon renting a property, rather than paying monthly rent, and the sum is returned to them when the rental period is over).  The loan he is now requesting will be used to begin work building his own home.

Wilfredo is satisfied with the loans that he receives.  His record qualifies him favorably to receive a new loan.  He is considered a good client.

loans.use: To start building his own home

loans.name: Kahunda

texts.en:
Kahunda is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a food selling business for the past three years, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Kahunda faces a major challenge of seasonality, especially during rainy season when it becomes hard to sell at an open air market. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of cooking flour and cooking oil. She decided to work with Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of cooking flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Phoebe Awour

texts.en:
Phoebe Awour O. is a lady of twenty seven years married to Joseph Juma and together they have two children, her husband Joseph Juma is a mechanic, he helps to raise the family's income.

Phoebe sells used clothes, shoes and materials for making clothes in Mitume in Kitale Town, she has been in this business for four years now and gets a monthly income of six thousand shillings.  This will be Phoebe's second loan with KADET and she wants to buy used clothes worth KES 10,000, used shoes worth KES. 5,000, materials worth KES 4,000, and also pay transport worth KES. 1,000. 

With the interest she is going to get she plans to hire a plot and diversify and start maize farming. In future she wants to educate her children and also she desires to own a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To add stock like buy more clothes for the business

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro vive en casa propia en la zona de Villa Exaltación, de la ciudad de  El Alto, es casado y tiene tres hijos. Pedro es jubilado rentista y a la vez trabaja en una pensión  y su esposa es ama de casa, con los ingresos que obtiene se mantienen; con un anterior crédito realizó la refacción del baño de su casa. Ahora requiere un nuevo crédito para la construcción de un garage en su casa. El señor se encuentra satisfecho con los créditos que le otorgamos.

Por su antecedente histórico califica para obtener un nuevo crédito, se considera buen cliente.
texts.en:
Pedro lives in his own home in the district of Villa Exaltacion within the city of El Alto. He is married and he has three children. Pedro is retired and he lives from his investments and his pension. His wife is a housewife. They support themselves through these two incomes.  With a past loan he carried out renovations to a bathroom in his home.  He requests a new loan to build a garage for his house. He is very happy with the loans he has received. 

His previous history qualifies him to access a new loan and he is considered to be a good client.

loans.use: To build a garage for his home.

loans.name: Bintihari

texts.en:
Bintiheri is a married woman with six children. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated an open air food selling business for over ten years, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Bintiheri faces a major challenge of seasonality. During rainy season it becomes a challenge to sell when there is a low turn out of clients. She hopes to open a cafe in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Mapenzi

texts.en:
Mapenzi is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a local brew selling business for the past seven years, selling from home to her neighbors. Mapenzi hopes to establish more businesses in the future. 

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for making local brews. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of coconuts for making local brews.

loans.name: Sera

texts.en:
Sera C. is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past three years Sera has operated a food selling business out of her home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge in seasonality in her business. During the rainy season it becomes hard to sell in an open market, which lowers the number of her customers.

With a 40,000 KES loan Sera wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, sacks of beans, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access its loans in hopes of improving her business. She wishes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, sacks of beans, and cooking oil

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita T. is 62 years old, married and has four adult-aged children. She is from the village of Caluya, Sapang Dalaga. To make a living, Julita weaves and sells the fronds of the nipa, a palm native to the Philippines (these weavings are used to thatch roofs, for example). She has been in business for twenty years and earns a monthly net income of 3000 PHP.

In 2007, Julita joined PMPC to gain access to its financial services. Julita has successfully repaid a previous loan, her seventh from PMPC, of 2,000 PHP. This previous loan was used for personal purposes. Julita is requesting a loan of 14,000 PHP that will be used as additional working capital.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional working capital for her nipa weaving business

loans.name: Mebakari

texts.en:
Mebakari is a married woman with one child, who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.
Mebakari has operated an open-air food market stall for the past two years, selling from home to her neighbors and passers-by. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. During the rainy season, it becomes a challenge to operate in the open air. She hopes to establish a cafe in the future.
With this loan of 20,000 KES, Mebakari wants to purchase bundles of cooking flour and cooking oil. She decided to join Kiva partner, Yehu, to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase cooking flour and cooking oil in bulk

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher is a 40-year-old married man living in his own semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is an ambitious man who longs to educate his children and build a permanent house. He has worked in lumbering for six months now and the business is almost breaking even. His business dream is to plant trees. Christopher is requesting a loan to buy a piece of land to plant trees.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land to plant trees

loans.name: Gozelle Mae

texts.en:
Gozelle Mae C. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 19 years old and married. To make a living, Gozelle Mae owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in her local community. Gozelle Mae has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2008, Gozelle Mae joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This loan was used to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. Gozelle Mae is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her third from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ysidora

texts.es: Ysidora, D. 53 años, vive al lado D. su esposo y sus dos  jóvenes hijas, en su casa que es propia; juntas se esfuerzan cada día para salir adelante.Después D. haberse dedicado varios años a la venta D. comida y cosméticos en su casa, que era una choza, quiso empezar a mejorar. Con mucho esfuerzo esta emprendedora mujer fue construyendo su casa,  y  hace  ocho años empezó a desarrollar su  negocio en el lugar, poco a poco fue incrementado sus productos comestibles, y le va muy bien por lo que se siente muy contenta. Pero afirma que no le gusta dar fiado sus productos, ya que dice que pierD. muchas amistades y además no cuenta con capital suficiente para abastecer con mayor cantidad D.  mercadería su negocio. Por su buen trato y amabilidad, en la actualidad cuenta con muchos clientes que recurren a su negocio, y ella esta muy satisfecha porque su negocio es muy rentable. Para dinamizar su tienda esta pensado en comprar varias cajas D. cerveza, y para más  adelante quiere implementar con útiles escolares su negocio para habilitar en el lugar una pequeña librería.Es el 16avo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y como socia antigua se compromete pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente como hasta hoy, además en su banco comunal es muy respetada por su responsabilidad.Ysidora, piensa invertir el dinero solicitado en el incremento D. mayor cantidad D.  productos perecibles y también en la compra D. 15 cajas D. cervezas, ya que con esta  bebida gana bien, D. esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Ysidora is 53 years old.  She lives with her husband and two young daughters in her own home.  Together they work hard every day to get ahead in life.

After having worked for several years selling meals and cosmetics from her home, which was a shack, Ysidora wanted to start improving herself.  With a lot of hard work, this enterprising woman built her own home and, eight years ago, she started to develop her business there.  She gradually increased her stock of food products and her business is doing very well which makes her very happy.  However, she says that she doesn't like to proviD. goods on credit because that way you lose a lot of friendships and don't have enough capital to stock your business with a large quantity of merchandise.  Owing to her good customer service and kindness, Ysidora currently has many customers who use her business and she is very satisfied because the business is very profitable.

In order to energize her store, Ysidora is thinking of buying several crates of beer and, in the future, she would like to stock her business with school supplies and set up an area as a small stationery store.

This is Ysidora's 16th loan with MFP and, as a long-standing member, she pledges to make her repayments on time as she has up until now.  Owing to her responsibility, she is a  very well-respected member of her community bank.  Ysidora plans to invest her loan money in increasing her stock of perishables and also buying 15 crates of beer since this drink makes good money.  In this way, she hopes to improve her profits.

loans.use: To buy beer to stock her business

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a married woman with 12 children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.
Mwanaisha has operated a retail shop business for the past year. Her customers are neighbors and passers-by. The major challenge she faces in her business is high transport costs. She hopes to open another business in the future.
With this loan of 40,000 KES, Mwanaisha wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking oil and detergent for resale. She decided to join Kiva partner, Yehu, to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking oil and detergent for resale

loans.name: Bright

texts.en: Bright is 31 years old, married and has three children. He lives in his own permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He aspires to educate his children up to university level. For the last ten years he has been selling poultry feed and also rearing chickens. His main business challenge is having enough capital to purchase the feed. Bright's ambition is to own at least 2,000 birds. He is requesting a loan to buy chicken feed.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed

loans.name: Joicy

texts.en:
Joicy T. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 31 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Joicy owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting rice for sale. Joicy has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2008, Joicy joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This loan was used to to pay for services to increase crop yield. Joicy is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be her fifth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure

loans.name: Chrisitne

texts.en:
Christine is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.
Christine has operated a business selling clothes for the past two years. She sells from home to her neighbors and passers-by. The major challenge she faces in her business is delayed payment by creditors. She hopes to establish a boutique in the future.
With this loan of 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase bundles of clothes for resale. She decided to join Kiva partner, Yehu, to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothes for resale

loans.name: Anecita Villamor's Group

texts.en:
Anecita V. is the leader of this three-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.
Anecita is 62 years old, married and has five adult-aged children. She is from the village of Birayan, Rizal. Anecita sells fruit as her source of income. She has been in this business for 15 years and earns a monthly net income of 3,200 PHP. In 2007, Anecita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Anecita is requesting her seventh loan, of 8,000 PHP, which will be used as additional working capital.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As additional working capital

loans.name: Herbert

texts.en: Herbert is a 36-year-old hardworking man who lives in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His goal is to build his own house in the next four years. Herbert transports stones for a living and has been in this kind of business, from which he reaps tangible benefits, for three years. He is requesting a loan to purchase fuel and more stones.

loans.use: To purchase fuel and more stones

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es: Juana tiene 59 años D. edad cuenta con domicilio propio ubicado en Comatrana actualmente vive solo con su esposo debido a que sus dos hijos ya son casados y tienen su propio hogar,Juana y su esposo se iniciarón en el negocio D. la venta D. pescado aproximadamente treinta años en la actualidad cuentan con un puesto propio ubicado en el mercado La Palma se le otorga el financiamiento por contar con buenas referencias,voluntad y capacidad D. pago el dinero sera destinado para la remodelación D. su vivienda.
texts.en: Juana is 59 years old and owns her own home in Comatrana.  She currently lives with just her husband as her two children are already married and have their own homes.  Juana and her husband started out in their fish selling business approximately 30 years ago.  They currently have their own stall in La Palma market.  They are receiving a loan because they have good references and both the will and means to pay back their loan.  They will use the money to remodel their home.

loans.use: To remodel her home

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe B. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 43 years old, married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Fe owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in her local community. Fe has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2000, Fe joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This loan was used to purchase additional fish to sell. Fe is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her eighth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.
Jane has operated a business selling kangas for the past nine months. She sells from home to her neighbors. Her main business challenge is high transport costs. She hopes to expand her business in the future.
With this loan of 20,000 KES, Jane wants to purchase bundles of kangas for resale. She decided to join Kiva partner, Yehu, to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of kangas for resale

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita Y. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 55 years old. Carmelita is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Carmelita owns and operates a business venture raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. Carmelita has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Carmelita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Carmelita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 12th loan taken out by Carmelita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying salt, soap and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She has operated a food selling business for the past one year, selling as retail to her neighbors and passersby. Beatrice faces the major challenge of delayed payments by those who purchase on credit. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes and vegetables to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of tomatoes and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman who owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

She has operated a tailoring business from home for the past six months, with neighbors being her potential customers. Esther faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. During the holiday season (August and December), the demand for clothing is high compared to the months of January and February, when demand is low. She hopes to establish another business in the future.

With the 30,000 KES, she wants to purchase bundles of cloth materials. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of cloth materials

loans.name: Nezikokolima Mpirigwa Group A-Mityana

texts.en: 35-year-old Joyce N. is an industrious and tenacious businesswoman who has been giving a worthy account of herself in the face of financial hardships in her alcohol brewing and sales business in Mpiriggwa-Mityana. It is not such a lucrative business, as manifested by the 10,000 Kenyan shillings she gets weekly, but nonetheless, Joyce remains upbeat about her future prospects. With earnings from this business she has been able to provide meals and other necessities, though minimally, to her family. She reckons this loan will give her business a new lease of growth. This happily married mother of five has been overseeing this business for 19 years, which was started with savings from her farming business. With this loan, Joyce says she is going to buy more drums to expand her alcohol brewing business. Joyce belongs to Nezikokolima Mpirigwa group-Mityana.

loans.use: To purchase more drums to expand her alcohol brewing business

loans.name: Fatima Del Carmen

texts.es: Fátima es una mujer que tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación León 2000. Esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos, pues es una persona muy emprendedora que disfruta de su actividad. La venta de mercadería en general es su principal fuente de ingresos necesarios para su hogar. Desde hace mas de 11 años, que tiene este negocio, la buena administración que tiene han hecho que salga adelante. Es por este motivo que realiza este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima como ropa interior, ropa en general, calzado, cosmético y ropa escolar pues se acerca la temporada de clases.
texts.en: Fatima has worked with Fundacion Leon 2000 (Kiva Field Partner) for a long time. This is not the first time she has accessed a loan. She is a very enterprising individual who enjoys her work. The sale of general merchandise is her primary source of income for her home. She has had the business for more than 11 years and it is through sound administration that has made this business a success. She requests a new loan to purchase merchandise such as under garments, clothing in general, shoes, cosmetics, and school uniforms to prepare for the back-to-school season.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana, de 34 años, vive  con su esposo Charly (42), y tienen dos pequeños hijos con los que habitan  su casa que es propia.Después de  trabajar  por muchos años en sociedad con una amiga, decidió alquilarse su local e instalar su taller. Y desde hace dos años  su principal actividad es la confección de polos y blusas, los cuales ella misma realiza;  traza, corta y cose  con mucho esmero, pues sus diseños son muy originales y de buen acabado. Pero no  solo a ello se dedica esta emprendedora mujer, además  comercializa las prendas en su taller y  también lleva a las casas de sus amistades y vecinos, para vender todo. Con el tiempo ha logrado ser más conocida por  la calidad de prendas que fabrica, y para el futuro  piensa ampliar su tienda para  llegar a ser propietaria de una gran  tienda dedicada a este rubro.Es el 16avo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y se compromete una vez más de pagar puntualmente, y además manifiesta sentirse contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, porque todos los integrantes son muy solidarios.Ana tiene planeado invertir el dinero del  préstamo en la compra de  telas delgadas y frescas, para confeccionar  polos para la época veraniega, de esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Ana, 34 years old, lives with her husband, Charly, and after working for many years in partnership with her friend she decided to rent a location to open her own workshop. For the last two years she has focused her work on manufacturing t-shirts, and blouses, which she personally makes. She transfers the patterns to fabric, cuts and sews while paying attention to detail. Her designs are very original and well-made. Ana is very enterprising. Not only does she make the clothing, but she also sells it out of her workshop and door-to-door, in order to sell all of it. Over time she has gradually become more well-known for the quality of the clothing she produces. 

Ana has expressed that she is glad to belong to her comunal bank because all of the members are very supportive. Looking to the future, she plans to expand her store and become owner of a large clothing store. This will be Ana's 16th loan with MFP. Once again she is committed to paying back the loan on time. Ana is requesting the loan so she can invest in new, think fabrics to make t-shirts for the summer season. In this way she hopes to increase her earnings.

loans.use: To purchase fabric for clothing.

loans.name: Dolivet

texts.es: Dolivet, de 38 años, vive con su esposo Pedro y sus dos pequeños hijos en su casa que es propia.Durante el día trabaja en casa de su vecina cuidando niños,  y por la tarde se dedica a la venta de salchipollos que son platillos preparados al instante (compuestos de papas y trozos de pollos fritos), también comercializa  gaseosas para acompañar las comidas y obtiene buenas ganancias, ya que trabaja hasta altas horas de la noche. Mientras  Dolivet  cuida a los niños durante el día  su hermana la apoya en el negocio de venta de comida, pues el negocio esta ubicado en la puerta del domicilio de su madre, y es un espacio muy apropiado para este fin, donde  circula cantidad de  personas. Es así que por las tardes atiende en la venta de comidas hasta las doce de la noche, durante  todos los días y para mejorar su negocio esta  pensando en instalar una juguería, para captar mayores ganancias.Es el 18avo préstamo que tiene con MFP, por lo que se ha comprometido nuevamente en ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, pues considera que este  crédito le será muy útil para el progreso de su negocio.Dolivet tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la  compra de cantidad de  maderas  y calaminas para cercar su negocio y cambiar el toldo que cubre la puerta, de esta manera espera ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus comensales.
texts.en:
Dolivet, 38 years old, lives with her husband, Pedro, and her two young children in her own home.  During the day, she works in her neighbor's house taking care of their children,a dn in the afternoon, she works selling "salchipollos," which are pre-prepared instant meals made of potatoes and pieces of fried chicken.  She also sells soft drinks to go with the food, and as she often works in the shop until midnight, she manages to earn a decent wage from this work. While Dolivet takes care of the children during the day, her sister helps her with her business, as it is located in the doorway of their mother's home.  It is a perfect space for this type of establishment, where many people can mingle together. 

In order to improve her business, Dolivet is thinking of installing a juicer to gain more profit.  This is her 18th loan with MFP, for which she is agan committed to being punctual with her repayment schedule.  She believes that this loan will be very useful in the progress of her business. Dolivet has plans to invest the capital requested in the purchase of different types of wood and roofing materials to enclose the business property; she also wishes to change the awning that covers the door, and in this way, she hopes to offer better service to her customers.

loans.use: Purchase of materials to improve small business facilities

loans.name: Esperanza Y Progreso 2 Group

texts.en:
Cristina is a mother of four children, she runs a clothings sales business from her home and walking by different communities. This group comes from an extremely poor area in San Pedro de Macoris, Dominican Republic; a city famous for baseball players and sugar cane industries, the main economic activity is a free trading zone, a cement factory, and others. Those living in the Dominican Republic have no access to running potable water, and electricity and healthcare are unreliable at best. Cristina is having her ninth loan with Esperanza International, in hopes to continue improving her life and the lives of her family.  She live with her 4 children and her long term partner.

Cristina will be using this loan to purchase a variety of cloths, for kids, men and women especially; also she will buy shoes and other products like accessories.
