Her customers are the students and the teachers, and she tends to about 100 customers. Her business is popular because of her good customer service. The challenges she faces is that during the rainy season her sales drop, and there is competition in front of the school where other businesses sell food. She uses the profits to provide for her children and cover her expenses. Her daughter Sheila helps with the business in the afternoons, tending to customers and preparing meals at home for another day. Amilcingo is a small but pretty town where they produce candies, peanut butter, tamarind and other items as well as harvest peanuts, corn and amaranth. Angélica's business has helped her family financially, providing food and covering all their school fees. She would like to make improvements to her home, installing new doors and glass windows, and adding a water tank. Her hope for the future is for her children to continue their studies and earn degrees. She plans to use the loan so her business earns more revenue. Angélica is very pleased with this loan and is going to use it to keep working selling food. She wants to tell Kiva and partner Fundación Realidad, "Thank you for the confidence you have in me and keep helping more people with your loans."

loans.use: Purchase refreshments, candies, grocery items, vegetables and some parts to make repairs on her car

loans.name: Irineo

texts.es:
Irineo G. P., es un joven de 24 años de edad, su estado civil es soltero, su actividad principal es atender un taller mecanico que desde hace algunos años inicio por cuenta propia, el terminó la educacion media superior (bachillerato), ya no continuo con sus estudios por su dedicacion completa al trabajo.
Él solicitó un préstamo para la compra de herramientas y accesorios de trabajo, con este dinero comprará: llaves de cruz, pinzas, grasa para motores, lubricantes, filtros, anticongelante, liquido para frenos, pistones, bujias. A Irineo le va bien en su taller aunque el establecimiento no sea de su propiedad, hasta hoy le ha alcanzado para pagar a tiempo sus rentas, asi como el pago oportuno de su ayudante, nos cometa que el oficio de mecanico automotriz es un poco dificil, y en ocaciones escasea el trabajo.
Para él no es dificil liquidar su credito, porque es una persona honesta y responsable, su reto es la competencia que hay entre los demás que se dedican a este oficio pero cuando se hace un buen trabajo no hay cliente que no lo reconozca.
La esperanza de Irineo es el tener algun dia su establecimiento propio, y ya no pagar renta, hacer crecer su equipo y herramientas de trabajo asi como el ampliar mas sus servicios, el nos dice que por el momento no tiene planes de casarse o comprometerce, ya que primero espera construir una base solida de trabajo para que el dia de mañana no sea tan dificil sostener una familia.
A Fundacion Realidad le da las gracias, al igual que a KIVA, esto por abrirle las puertas ya que para los hombres es un poco dificil encontrar un fianciamiento economico por parte de otras financieras.
texts.en:
Irineo G. P. is a young man of 24 years of age. He is single, and he works in a mechanics shop that he founded some years ago. He finished his high school education, but did not continue his studies due to his complete dedication to his work.
He is requesting a loan to buy tools and accessories for his work. With this loan, he will buy: four way wrenches, tongs, motor grease, lubricants, filters, antifreeze, brake fluid, pistons, and spark plugs. Things are going well for Irineo and his shop, but he does not own the premises. So far, he has been able to pay the rent on time and also pays his assistant on time. He tells us that the auto mechanic trade is a little difficult and sometimes work is scarce. 
It will not be hard for him to pay back his loan because he is an honest and responsible person. His challenge is competition from other auto mechanics, but when he does good work, everyone recognizes it. 
Irineo hopes to have his own business premises some day, to not have to pay rent, and to increase his staff and equipment so that he can offer more services. He tells us that, for the moment, he does not have plans to get married or engaged because he wants to build a solid business first so that in the future it won't be so difficult to support a family. 
He gives thanks to Fundacion Realidad and to Kiva for opening this door to him as it is a little difficult for men to find other investors.

loans.use: To buy tools and materials used in a mechanics shop: four way wrenches, tongs, patches, motor grease, oil filters, and  vehicle parts

loans.name: Carmen Cristina

texts.es:
La señora Carmen Cristina P. G. tiene 46 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos, 2 estan casados y los otros 2 son solteros, que tienen 24 y 20 años de edad, ellos le ayudan a su pdre en eun taller de vulcanizadora y llantas, su esposo de Crsitina se llama Irineo el tien 50 años de edad.
Carmen tiene la finalidad de obtener un credito economico, para invertir en la coompra de mas mercancia en su negocio de ropa, con el cual lleva poco mas de 3 años, iniciandolo por necesidad y para aportar recurso al gasto familiar, ella nos comenta que el negocio de la ropa es buena opcion de trabajo sabiendolo manejar, ya que actualmente hay mucha competencia y cada dia se renueva los modelos y diseños de ropa, a ella no se le es dificil solventar su credito, porque todos los dias tiene trabajo que realizar, su venta la hace de manera ambulante, lo que a veces le hace un poco dificil su recorrido, ella no cuenta con establecimiento propio donde pueda ofrecer de manera fija sus productos, es por eso que tiene que ambular de un lugar a otro.
A los retos que se ha tenido que enfrentar Carmen es a su problema visual pero su padecimiento no le impide trabajar y salir adelante con sus proyectos.
El proyecto mas grande que tiene la señora Carmen es etablecer de manera permanete y solida su venta de ropa en un lugar adecuado donde ella no tenga que caminar o trazladar su ,mercancia de un lugar a otro, espera gozar de buena salud, que no le falten las ganas y el animo para seguir trabajando.
agradece bastante a los que oaporten un granito de arena en el financiamiento de su credito,a fundacion relidad gracias y a kiva por ser la organizacion que apoya los proyectos de los que lo necesitan.
texts.en:
Carmen Cristina P. G. is 46 years old. She is married and has 4 children. Two of them are married. The other two are single and they are 24 and 20 years old. They help their father in his tire repair shop. Her husband’s name is Irineo and he is 50 years old. 

Carmen’s goal is to obtain a loan to buy more merchandise for her business selling clothing. She has had this business for a little over 3 years. She started it out of necessity and to contribute for the family expenses. She has commented to us that the clothing business is a good option if one knows how to run it. There is a lot of competition and she updates styles and clothing designs every day. For her it is not difficult to repay her loan because she has work every day. She makes her sales as a street vendor, and sometimes her route is a little difficult. She doesn’t have a fixed place of her own where she can offer her products, and that is why she has to move from one place to another.

Among the challenges that Carmen faces is her vision, however her problem doesn’t keep her from working and making progress in her projects.

Carmen’s  biggest project is to establish her clothing business permanently in an adequate space where she won’t have to walk or carry around her merchandise. She hopes for good health—she doesn’t lack for desire and motivation to continue working. 

She is grateful to those who can provide even a grain of sand to help finance her loan, and to the Foundation, and to Kiva for supporting the projects of those who are in need.

loans.use: To buy women’s, men’s, children’s, and infant’s pants, shirts, T-shirts, shorts, blouses, socks, and underwear

loans.name: Mariana Marina

texts.es:
La señora Mariana es de 45 añlos de edad, actualmente su estado civil es divorciada, tuvo 4 hijos de los cuales uno esta estudiando la escuela de nivel medio superior, ella tien una tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio, en el cual comercializa productos de primera necesidad, inicio esta actividad a partir de la separacion con su esposo y esto le ha permitido sacar adelante a sus 4 hijos.
Mariana solicito unprestamo de dinero para la compra de mas productos para su tienda, con ese dinero que le prestaron pudo comprar arroz, frijol, chiles enlatados, azucar, sardina enlatada, sal, pasta para preparar sopa, huevos, jabon, leche, galletas entre otros productos de primera necesidad, con la adquisicion de mas mercancia ella garantiza tener mas ventas, mas ganacias y poder cubrir su credito en tiempo y forma.
Ella nos comparte de su vivencia , nos comenta que la principio fue muy dificil superar su separacion, principalmente por sus hijos, ademas los gastos de cada uno de ellos tendrian que ser suplidos or alguien, su pequeño negocio le ha permitido tener el, recurso necesario para comer y cubrir las necesidads prioritarias.
Uno de sus sueños y esperanzas que tenia Mariana es el de sacar a sus hijos adelante y esa esperanza ya la pudo cubrir, y demuestra una vez mas la gran virtud de las mujeres que son muy entregadas a sus sueños y anhelos.
Ella ahora desea mirar triunfar a sus hijos que puedan salir adelante y puedan ser personas dignas de si mismos, ella quisiera mejorar mas su negocio, hacer que sus ventas crescan y que nunca le falte mercancia para su tiendita.
Mariana al igual que muchos cree en los sueños, en la bondad y genorosidad de muchos, desd aqui quiere hacer llegar un mensaje para la mujeres, que luchen por sus sueños y que trabajen en sus ilusiones, agradece a fundaion relidad y a kiva por ser los medios para cumplir los sueños y esperanza de muchsa mujeres necesitadas.
texts.en:
Mariana is 45 years old. She is divorced and has 4 children, of whom one is studying in high school. She has a small grocery store in her house, where she sells items of basic necessity. She began this business when she separated from her husband and this has allowed her to provide for her 4 children.

Mariana requested a loan to buy more products for her store. With the money she was lent she was able to buy rice, beans, canned chiles, sugar, canned sardines, salt, pastas for soups, eggs, soap, milk, and cookies, among others. By getting more merchandise, she is sure to have more sales and more earnings and be able to pay back her loan on time.

She explained to us that the experience of separating from her husband was very difficult to overcome at first, especially for her children. Additionally, the expenses for each of them had to be paid by someone. Her small business has allowed her to have the necessary resources to eat and cover other priority expenses.

One of Mariana’s dreams and hopes was to help her children get ahead, and she is already able to meet this goal. She exemplifies that great virtue of women who work hard for their dreams and hopes.

She now hopes to see her children be successful, get ahead in life, and lead dignified lives. She would like to improve her business, grow her sales, and always have merchandise in her store. 

Mariana, like many who believe in dreams and in the goodness and generosity of people, would like to send a message to women—that they should fight for their dreams and work hard toward their goals. She is grateful to the Fundación Realidad and to Kiva for being the ways in which many women in need can achieve their dreams and hopes.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, canned chiles, sugar, canned sardines, salt, pastas for soups, eggs, etc.

loans.name: María Mercedes

texts.es:
La Señora. María S. es socia del banco comunal Las Cumplidas, vive por la parroquia de San Joaquín siendo este sector el mayor productor de hortalizas ya que su gente se dedica a la agricultura y cría de animales.
 
La Señora. María tiene 38 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 15 y 11 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en el colegio y su segundo hijo esta en una escuela de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora en una camioneta que es de su propiedad y realiza fletes, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

Doña María labora hace 10 años en una asociación de venta de verduras, se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de verduras, trabaja desde las 3 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde de domingo a domingo.
 
Se encuentra en el banco comunal hace 8 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en su negocio comprando más verduras. Su sueño es  no tener deudas.
texts.en:
María S. is a member of the Las Cumplidas communal bank. She lives in the parish of San Joaquín, which is a major producer of vegetables with a population that farms and raises animals.
María is 38 years old, married and has 2 children aged 15 and 11. Her eldest daughter attends secondary school and her younger son attends one of the schools in the city. Her husband works as a driver, operating his own small truck, and provides a transportation service. With both of them working, they have been able to build their own house.
María has worked for 10 years with an association that sells vegetables. She runs a business buying and selling vegetables, working from 3 in the morning until 6 in the evening Sunday to Sunday.
She has been with this communal bank for 8 years and she will invest her new loan in her business, buying more vegetables. Her dream is to be debt-free.

loans.use: Purchase of vegetables

loans.name: Juana Cristina

texts.es:
Juana Cristina es una joven de 19 años de edad , termino el tercer año de seundaria y decidio no estudiar mas, esto para dedicarse de tiempo completo en la actividad de venta de calzados por catalogo y en un pequeño establecimiento, este negocio ha significado mucho para Juana. Actualmente esta soltera y no tiene planes de tener una relacion sentimental con alguien, ella vive con su mama que desde ya hace algunos años se separo de sus esposo, haciendo del negocio una de sus mas grandes prioridades para seguir adelante.
Juana solicito un credito para invertirlo en la compra de mas calzado, con este dinero pudo comprar tenis deportivos, sandalias, zapato para caballero de vestir y escolares, zapatillas, huaraches y algunos calzados para niños y bebes.
Con esto espera tener mas ventas y ofrecerles mas productos a sus clientes, obteniendo mas ganacias para invertir, para el pago de su credito y para el crecimiento del mismo. Una de sus esperanzas es tener su propio local independiente, mas espacio, mas mercancia, le gustaria tenr su propia casa y apoyar mas a sus hermano en su preparacion escolar.Su esperanza es que sus metas se cumplan y que algun dia pueda mejorara mas sus calidad de vida, para no repetir la misma historia de su madre.
Juan le esta muy agradecida a fundacion realidad y a los que apoyan a kiva por ayudar a realiazar el sueño de muchos en todas partes del mundo, para todos ellos les manda un  abrazo.
texts.en:
Juana Cristina is a young woman of 19 years of age. She finished the 3rd grade of secondary school and decided not to study any more so that she could dedicate herself full-time to her work selling shoes from a catalog and in a small store. This business has meant a lot to Juana. She is currently single and has no plans to have a relationship with anyone. She lives with her mother who has been separated from her husband for some years. The business is one of her greatest priorities in moving forward in her life. 
Juana is requesting a loan to buy more shoes. With this money, she could buy tennis shoes, sandals, men's dress shoes and school shoes, slippers, loafers, and some shoes for children and babies. 
She hopes that this will result in increased sales as she will be able to offer more products to her customers and this will give her more profits to invest to repay her loan and to grow her business. One of her hopes is that she will have her own independent business, more space, and more merchandise. She would like to have her own house and help her brother more in his studies. She hopes to reach her goals and that some day she can improve her quality of life so that she does not repeat the same mistakes as her mother. 
Juana is very grateful to Fundacion Realidad and to those who are supporting her through Kiva and helping people around the world to realize their dreams. She sends a hug to all of them.

loans.use: To buy shoes for sale: shoes, tennis shoes, sandals, loafers, slippers, and shoes for children and babies.

loans.name: Juan Diego

texts.es:
Juan Diego G. P., es un chico de 20 años de edad, es soltero y se dedica a la reparacion de automoviles(mecanica en general),el trabaja junto con su hermano en el mismo taller, estudio hasta el tercer año de secundaria y decidio dedicarse de lleno altrabajo,en el cual lleva mas de 5 años.
Juan Diego es un joven muy sano y lleno de vida, nos comparte que le gusta su trabajo y que no dia que no se levante con animos, por que el arreglar autos le apasiona, en cuanto a las ganancias no se puede quejar, el y su hermano hermano comparten los gastos del mantenimiento y la renta del lugra donde se ubica su taller.
El tiene la necesidad de invertir en su negocio y comprar algunas hherramientas que les hacen falta asi como algunos materiales extras, el dinero obtenido en este prestamo lo invirtio en lla compra de algunas pinzas, llaves, diferntes lubricante para el motor, filtros, bujias, pistones, liquido de frenos, anticongelante y otros, en especifico el invirtio todo su capital para el mejoramiento del servicio en su negocio, en su taller hacen muy buen trabajo y es por esoq ue los clientes lo buscan y los conocen muy bien a el y su hermano, y ni hablar del padre que tambien se dedica la negocio d las llantas para todo tipo de autos y camiones.
Lo que nos puede decir Juan Diego, es que el mayor reto al que se ha enfrentado es con el mismo, en ser cada dia mejor, ir aprendiendo mas y reter a sus clientes, asi tambien para el es un reto el vivir cada dia, sabiendo que es una oportunidad mas para mejorar y darse a conocer.
Nunca ha esta carente de trabajo y es por eso que el ha estado en un proceso de salir adelante, anhela tener su propio taller mecanico, con el equipo adecuado y aproíado para facilitar su trabajo, el quiere que otros jovenes como el aprendan este oficio y no se vallan por el camino facil del alcohol, del robo o delas drogas, esta dispuesto a ayudar y enseñar a otro chicos mas para que ellos puedan valerce por si mismos y ayudar a sus familias a mejorar sus vidas.
Una de sus esperanzas es que DIOS le otorgue mas vida y salud para que algun dia el pueda tener su propio taller de manera independiente, don de aparte de arreglar autos pueda ofrecer empleo a mas personas, le gustaria tambien tener su casa propia y pues mas adelante formar su propia familia, pero no sin antes tener algo que ofrecerles.
El esta agradecido con los que son instrumentos del financiamiento de su credito, gracias a todos por su apoyo y confianza, y que  sigan apoyando mas a quienes lo necesitan.
texts.en:
Juan is 20 years old, single and works in automotive repair and general mechanics. He and his brother work in the same shop. He left high school after his second year, choosing to work full time, which he has done for 5 years.  Juan is a very upstanding young man who is full of life. He enjoys his work and he approaches each day enthusiastically. He is passionate about fixing cars.

As far as income, he feels like he can't complain given that he and his brother share expenses associated with the rent and maintenance of their shop.   Juan sees the need to improve in his business by purchasing tools he lacks as well as other additional materials. The money from this loan will be put towards buying pliers, wrenches, various kinds of motor oil, filters, spark plugs, pistons, brake fluid, and antifreeze, among other items. Juan invested all of his capital specifically in improving the service provided in his business. At the shop, they do very good work which is why their clients come to them and know him and his brother very well, not to mention their father who also works in the automotive business, selling tires for all kinds of cars and trucks.   

Juan tells us is that the greatest challenge he faces is himself, in striving to improve each day, continuing to learn and retaining his customers. He sees each day as another opportunity to improve and promote his business.   He has never lacked for work and for that reason he has recently been in the process of growing his business. Juan wishes to have his own garage, with the necessary and appropriate equipment to facilitate their work. He wants for other young people, like him, to learn this trade, instead of taking the easy rode of alcohol, thefts and drugs. He is willing to help other young people by teaching them so that they can become self-sufficient and offer assistance to their families to improve their lives.   

One of his hopes is that God will grant him health and more life so that he can one day own his own garage. With that gift, aside from just fixing cars, he could offer employment to other people. He would also like to have his own house and in the future have his own family, but not without having something to offer them.   He is grateful to those who are instrumental in providing his loan. Thanks to all for your support and trust and may you continue supporting those who need it most.

loans.use: To purchase tools and parts for repairing cars, specifically, tires, tire patches, motor oil, brake fluid, antifreeze and some used parts.

loans.name: Justina Azucena

texts.es:
Justina Azucena S. H. es una señora de 25 años de edad, casada con eduardo de 25 años tambien, ella tiene un hijo llamado Yosgart de año y 9 meses,su esposo es mecanico y trabaja en un taller a las orillas de la poblacion, mientras que ella vende diferentes articulos de lenceria para dama, ademas elabora ropa típica bordada a mano.
El crédito que solicitó Justina es para la compra de lenceria que son: brasier, pijama para dama, panti, bata de dormir,bikini, boxer de dama, ropa interior, faja, short, tambien compro manta, listones, hilos para la elaboracion de ropa típica, ella no tuvo problemas para liquidar su primer credito y es por eso que se le dio la oportunidad de uno credito mas, ella es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora. No cuenta con casa propia es por eso que le esta achando muchas ganas en su pequeño negocio, para hacerse de su patrimonio propio.
Justina dejo la escuela a temprana edad, ella solo concluyo la educacion secundaria, y despues tuvo que dejar la escuela por u problema de salud de su padre, es por eso que ella ya no siguio su preparacion escolar aunque queria seguir estudiando.
Una de sus principales esperanzas de Justina es seguir estudiando y terminar una carrera corta, ella cuenta con el respaldo y comprencion de su esposo, al igual que los sueños de su esposom es tener su propio taller mecanico en el cual el pueda trabajar y forjar su propio negocio, dese que su hijo se perepare y que el tenga un mejor futuro, le gustaria establecer bien su negocio, tener muchas venta y aumentar el número de clientes.
Lo que les quiere decir a kiva y fundación realidad es que qigan a poyando a mujeres y personas emprendedoras, que continuen con este proyecto de realizacion de sueños que no se cansen de trabajr para los que menos tienen y a nombre de su pequeño les manda un abrazo.
texts.en:
Justina Azucena S. H. is 25 years old; is married to 25 year old Eduardo and has a one year and nine month son named Yosgart.  Her husband works as a mechanic in a shop located on the outskirts of town, while she sells various lingerie items.  She also makes typical hand embroidered clothing.

Justina requested this loan to buy lingerie items, such as bras, ladies’ pajamas, panties, sleeping robes, bikinis, ladies’ boxer shorts, undergarments, slips, and shorts.  She also bought fabric, ribbons, and thread that she uses to make clothing.  She didn’t have any trouble repaying her first loan, and this is the reason that he received the opportunity for another loan.  She is a very responsible and hard working person.  [Justina] does not have her own home, and she is putting so much effort into her small business so that she can make her own inheritance.

Justina left school at an early age and only finished junior high school.  She had to leave school because of her father’s health problems, and was not able to complete her education, even though she wanted to.

One of her greatest hopes is to be able to continue her education and complete a short career, and she has her husband’s backing and understanding.  Her husband’s dreams are to have his own auto shop, where he can work and forge his own business.  They also want their son to prepare himself and to have a good future.  She would like to become well established in her business, make many sales, and increase her number of customers.

She would like to ask Kiva and Fundación Realidad to continue helping women and entrepreneurs, to continue with this project of helping dreams come true, not to tire of helping those who have little, and sends a hug from her son.

loans.use: Supplies and inventory

loans.name: Lizet

texts.es:
Lizet M. B. es una mujer de 30 años de edad, ella no tine hijos, pero su situacion actual es un poco triste ya que hace apenas 5 meses fallecio su esposo, dejandola desprotegida, y con una tristeza enorme, ella se dedica a la venta de articulos variados de uso personal para damas mejor conocido como chacharas, este es el unico medio por el cual Lizet se mantiene, vive actualmente con sus padres en la comunidad de Lo de Soto, a 45 minutos de Pinotepa Nacional.
Su gran necesidad la obligo a solicitar un prestamo para la compra de mas mercancia, ella con ese capital pudo adquirir, labiales, barnis para uñas, diademas para el cabello, moños, pinzas para el cabello, articulos de fantasia, que son: aretes, pulceras, collares, añillos, lapiceras, y algunos boligrafos decorados.
En su actual actividad le va bien, y por lo menos le alcanza para sobrevivir con lo necesario, ya que su unica dependencia es su trabajo diario, ella nos comenta que es una situacion muy dificil por la que esta atravesando hoy en dia, y el ánimo que le queda es que la vida le ofrece la oportunidad de seguir adelante, luchando contra las adversidades y el unico enemigo a vencer el la triztesa, que poco a poco ella va superando.
Su reto mas grande es superar su pena, llevara tiempo pero ella ha dado elm primer paso que es la resignacion.
La esperanza mas grande es saber que la vida le ofrece muchas pruebas, asi como mucha oportunidades de salir adelante, demostrarce a si misma que se puede cuando se lucha con amor,a ella le gustaria tener algun dia su patrimonio propio y por el momento no si son muchos los planes que tiene, lo unico que hoy espera es superar pronto su pena y su dolor.
Lizet agradece a los que apoyaron en el fianciamiento de su credito, quienes quiera que sean solo le resta darles las gracias y un abrazo.
texts.en:
Lizet M. B. is 30 years old and does not have any children.  Her situation is a bit sad, because her husband passed away barely five months ago, leaving her unprotected and with an enormous amount of sorrow.  She sells various types of ladies’ articles, also known as “chacharas.”  This is her only means of support and she currently lives with her parents in the town of “Lo de Soto,” located 45 minutes from Pinotepa Nacional.

It was her great need that prompted her to request a loan to buy more merchandise, such as lipsticks, nail polish, hair accessories, ribbons, hair clips, and jewelry such as bracelets, necklaces, rings, and decorated pens.

She is doing well in her business and at least earns enough to survive, as her daily work is her only obligation.  She tells us that she faces a very difficult situation but still has some enthusiasm, knowing that life offers her the opportunity to get ahead.  She struggles against the challenges and sadness, but little by little she is winning.  Her biggest challenge is to beat her grief.  It will take time, but she has taken the first step, which is determination.

Her biggest source of hope is knowing that life offers many tests, as well as many opportunities to get ahead.  She wants to prove to herself that one can achieve when one works with love.  She would like to create her own legacy, but at the moment her only desire is to beat her grief and sorrow.

Lizet is grateful to those who have helped her get this loan, whoever they are.  She wants to say thank you and sends a big hug.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Maria Estela

texts.es:
La señora Maria Estela P. G., es casada y tiene 43 años de edad, su esposo tien 45 años y se fue a los estados unidos de manera ilegal, esto con la finalidad de mejorar la condicion de vida de su esposa y sus tres hijos, que son Oscar, Fatima y  Daniel, a quienes desde hace poco mas de tres años dejo al cuidado de su su esposa, Mari como la conocen todos se dedica desde hace mas de 6 años al negocio de abarrotes, ella tiene una pequeña tiendita, que dia a dia trata de manter con lo necesario de productos basicos y de mayor demanda. 
Al paso del tiempo sus hijos han ido creciendo y junto con ellos la necesidad de estudiar, vestir, calzar, etc. es por eso que las ganacias obtenidas en la tiendita ya no alcanzaba optando su esposo por emigrar a otro pais.
La necesidad de Mari, la vio obligada a solicitar un prestamo para utilizarlo en la inversion de su negocio, ella con este capital, pudo comprar,arroz, azucar, pasta de trigo para preparar sopa,frijoles, huevos, aceite, leche, chiles enlatados, sal, galletas, algunos refrescos y jugos envasados, ella nos platica que con este recurso esta mejorando su negocio y puede ofrecer mas productos a sus clientes, y las ganancias obtenidas son para el pago del credito, para reinvertir y para comprar lo necesario.
El reto al que se enfrenta Maria es la competencia y es que se vueve complicado a veces para ella mantener su negocio, por la alza de algunos productos basicos, asi como el incremento de establecimiemtos a su alrededor, la ventaja que tiene Mari es que ella no paga renta, porque su negocio esta ubicado en su domicilio, pero lo que no le ayuda es el espacio para sus productos ya que el el local es muy pequeño.
Maria Magdalena, comenta que a pesar de todo le va vien en su negocio y que espera hacerlo crecer mas, le gustaria a ella agrandar mas el espacio deonde esta ubicada su tienda, para poder surtir mas variedad de productos, le encantaria mejorar su vivienda y que sus hijos estudien un carrera profesional.
Le agradece a fundacion realidad por su credito ya que es de gran ayuda y lo ha sabido invertir, ella les desea lo mejor a todos los que hacen posible esta ayuda.
texts.en:
Maria Estela is married and is 43 years old. Her husband, who is 45 years old, went to the United States, three years ago, without documentation. He left in order to improve the quality of life of his wife and children, Oscar, Fatima and Daniel. Mari has run a small grocery store for six years, which has become well-known to many.  Each day, Mari strives to keep her store stocked with basic goods as well as products that are in high demand. 

Over time, not only have their children grown, but so has their need for an education, clothing, shoes etc.  Her husband decided to go to the United States when the income from the store no longer was sufficient to meet their family's needs.   Mari's needs prompted her to request a loan to be put towards her business. With the loan, she was able to buy rice, beans, eggs, oil, milk, canned chili peppers, salt, cookies, some soft drinks and bottled juice. She has related to us that with this assistance her business is improving and she is able to offer more products to her clients. The money she earns goes toward loan payments, reinvestments and purchasing necessary items. 

The challenge Maria is facing is with competing stores.  It can be difficult at times to maintain her business due to the raise in the price of commodities as well as the increasing number of near by businesses.  The advantage Maria has is that she does not have to pay rent because her business is located in her home.  However, what is not in her favor is the limited space she has for her products because of the small size of the room where the store is located.  

Maria indicates that in spite of everything her business is doing well and she hopes to make it grow more. She would like to increase the size of the space where her store is located in order to stock it with more products. She would also like to improve her housing and see her children study in a career track. Maria is grateful to Fundación Realidad for the loan. Receiving it and learning how to invest it have been a great help. Maria wishes the best to all those who have made the assistance possible.

loans.use: The loan request described below is to purchase food products and staple goods such as; rice, beans, soup ingredients, milk, sugar, canned chili peppers, canned beans, canned sardines and tuna, salt, eggs, laundry detergent, body soap etc.

loans.name: Laura Georgina

texts.es:
La Señora Laura P. es socia del banco comunal Las Cumplidas, vive por la parroquia de San Joaquín siendo este sector el mayor productor de hortalizas ya que su gente se dedica a la agricultura y cría de animales. 

Nuestra socia tiene 46 años, es viuda hace 12 años y tiene 5 hijos de 27, 25, 23, 16 y 15 años de edad, su segunda hija es casada y vive independiente, su primera hija  estudia en la universidad, su tercera hija a egresado de la universidad, sus dos últimos hijos estudian en un colegio de la ciudad. Con su trabajo ha logrado construir su casa propia.

Doña Laura es comerciante de legumbres actividad que la desempeña hace 25 años, trabaja de domingo a domingo desde las 4 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde y tiene un puesto propio. También tiene un puesto en una cooperativa de transportes pesados, esta actividad la realiza hace12 años y su camión es conducido por un chofer.
 
Se encuentra reingresando al banco comunal y el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en su negocio comprando más legumbres. Su meta es pagar todas sus deudas.
texts.en: Laura P. is a member of Las Cumplidas [The Reliable Women] communal bank. She lives in San Joaquín parish, which is the largest producer of vegetables and produce, since its people farm and raise animals. Our associate is 46 years old, has been a widow for 12 years, and has 5 children, ages 27, 25, 23, 16 and 15. Her second daughter is married and independent. Her oldest daughter studies at the university and her third daughter has graduated from the university. Her two youngest children study at a school in the city. Through her work she has managed to build her own house. Doña Laura is a businesswoman selling legumes, which she has done for 25 years. She works 7 days a week, from 4 in the morning to 5 in the afternoon and has her own stand. For the last 12 years she has also had a heavy truck which she operates within a transportation cooperative.  She does not drive the truck herself but hires a driver to do that job. She is returning as a member of the communal bank, and the money from her loan will be invested in purchasing more legumes for her business. Her goal is to pay off all of her debts.

loans.use: Purchase legumes.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
La señora Guadalupe tiena 50 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Fernando de 51 años, quien se dedica al servivio electrico de automoviles y camiones, ella tien 2 hijos que son: Alexis de 14 años y Alfredo de 11, sus dos niños estudian la secundaria y uno de ellos le ayuda a su padre en el pequeño taller que tiene. 
Guadalupe dedica parte de su tiempo en la venta de articulos para camas de dormir,y los vende de manera ambulante o por catalogo. Esta es una actividad un poca cansada para ella ya que para poder vender sus productos ella tiene que recorrer caminado varias viviendas ofreciendo sus productos o incluso tiene que caminar largas distancias a otras colonias, lleva poco mas de 4 años en esta actividad y le gusta su trabajo,porque con su pequeño negocio ella puede aportar un poco de recurso para los gastos de la casa.
Guadalupe solicito un credito para hacer la compra de algunos productos que le hacen falta ya que ella tiene varios pedidos acumulados por parte de algunos clientes asi como algunos pedidos pendientes por entregar. Ella compro: sabanas, fundas para almohadas, colchas, edredones, cobertores, sabanas de cajon, almohadas y algunos accesorios mas para el mantenimiento de las camas de dormir. 
Una de las metas que tiene fijada Guadalupe es tener un establecimiento fijo donde de manera permanente pueda vander sus productos, asi tambien tener una mas grande cantidad y variedad de mercancia, aunque en algunas ocaciones las ventas bajen ella no se desanima, ya que tiene la opcion de almacenar mas mercancia para poder ofrecer despues.Con esta actividad ella ha podido apoyar a sus hijos en algunos gasto escolares asi tambien suplir algunas necesidades propias, ella nos dice que la ventaja que tiene es que su actividad le permite organizar su tiempo a su conveniencia, si tener que descuidar sus deberes de familia y sin dejar de atender a su esposo y sus hijos.
Su esperanza ews que algun dia sus hijos terminen una carrera comoes la esperaza de todas las madres del mundo, que no tenga que padecer alguna enfermedad y que sus hijos sean personas de bien, ella desea que su negocio cresca mas cada dia y que sus ganancias le permitan el progreso de su negocio.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is 50 years old; she is married with Fernando, 51, a mechanic who specializes in the servicing of electrical systems in cars and trucks. She has 2 children: Alexis is 14 years old and Alfredo is 11. Her two children are in high school and one of them helps her husband in the small shop they have. 

Guadalupe spends a part of her time selling bedding and linen, selling them itinerantly or through a catalogue. This business is physically tiring for her because in order to sell her products she needs to walk to the various houses to offer her products, or she might have to walk long distances to other colonies. She has a little more than 4 years in the business but she enjoys her work. It is with her small business that she is able to earn some income for the household expenses. 

Guadalupe requests a loan to purchase some products that she has sold out and she has various orders that have been placed by clients and there are some orders that need to be filled.  She purchased: sheets, pillow cases, blankets, bedspreads, duvets, fitted sheets, pillows, and some additional accessories for beds. 

Guadalupe's goal it to have a store from where to sell her products. She would be able to have a larger quantity and variety of merchandise. Although sometimes her sales are low she doesn't get discouraged because she can just store her merchandise for future resale.  This business has enabled her to support her children and paid for some of their school fees. It has also allowed her to cover some personal expenses. She said that the advantage is that her business allows her to manage her time as convenient to her, without having to ignore her family responsibilities. She is able to take are of her husband and children. 

Her hope is that one day her children will have a career, as is the hope of all the mothers in the world. She hopes that she will not suffer from any illness and that her children will grow up to be upstanding citizens. She wishes to see her business grow more every day and to have her profits help in the development of her business.

loans.use: To purchase bedding articles.

loans.name: Soeng's Group

texts.en:
There are four people are making up a group loan; they are living in Reang Dek village in Kandal province. This group loan selected, Mrs. Soeng C., 44 years old, as the group leader. With the loans, they hope to increase their income to improve the family of their living.

Mrs. Soeng C. and her husband are farmers who own a plot of land which they use to grow rice for living. With this farming, Mrs. Soeng C. would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for growing rice. Aside from farmers, they are also fishermen where they can earn a little income to support their family. 

This spouse is working very hard with their carriers to support their two children; one is a fisherman and another is student.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seeds for growing rice.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen G. G. tiene 74 años de edad y su esposo tiene la misma edad que ella, tuvo 9 hijos de los cuales viven 8 y uno ya fellecio, a pesar de su edad ella se didca a la venta de frutas y verduras, en su domicilo esta ubicado su pequeno puesto de venta, con lo poco que saca de las ventas ella vuelve a comprar mas mercancia y suplir algunas necesidades de ella y su esposo, doña Carmen es una mujer muy trabajadora porque a pesar de tener tan avanzada edad y la enfermedad de la diabetes ella no esta sin hacer algo para lam obtencion de recursos. A doña Carmen le ha gustado ser independiente de sus hijos y tener su propio dinero por cualquier emergencia que se l epueda presentar, ella no depende del todo de sus hijos ya cada quien tiene su propia obligacion con sus familias y dependientes.
Doña Carmen solicito un credito de dinero, primero porque necesita un poco mas de capital para invertir en su pequeño negocio y segundo porque ella tiene la capacidad y la confianza en poder liquidarlo, con este dinero ella pudo comprar; platanos, naranjas,mandarinas, manzanas, duraznos, piña, sandia, melones,tambien compro,jitomates, chiles, cebollas, ajos, lechuga romana, papas, zanahorias, chayotes y calabacitas.
Carmen lo que puede desear es primero que su salud no se complique, ya que la diabetes ees un padecimiento que necesita mucho cuidado y un tratamiento un poco complicado, ella espera no caer en una crisis, pero tambien quiere ver prosperar un poco mas su negocio que sus ventas no caigan y que ese entusiasmo y ganas de trabajar no le falte cada dia.
Su esperanza que la conserva y la mantien de pie es mirar a sus bisnietos, y que su espodos esta bien de salud si el padecimiento que sufre ella, ella espera un dia partir sin tanto sufrimiento. Ella nos dice que esta tranquila para la hora de su partida.
Les agradece a todos los que puedan leer un poco de su vida alrededor del mundo y para quienes se sienten tristes o desanimados, que puedan mirar en ella un ejemplo de vida y lo hermosos que es llegar a esa edad, la viad es una cajita de sorpresas, pero hay que estar preparados para cada detalle que tiene para nosostros, gracias a kiva y a fundacion realidad, que DIOS los llene de vida y salud.
texts.en:
Carmen G. G. is 74 years old and her husband is the same age as her. They had 9 children, of whom 8 are living and 1 has passed away. Despite her age she still sells fruits and vegetables. She has installed a small stand in her home and whatever profits she makes in her  business she reinvests them in the purchase of more merchandise and to provide for some of her  husband's needs. Carmen is a very hardworking person and despite her advanced age and her diabetes she's never without an occupation to earn an income. Carmen has enjoyed being independent of her children by having her own money for whatever emergency comes up. She does not depend at all on her children. They each have their own obligations, family, and dependents to take care of. 

Carmen requested a loan to supplement her working capital, to invest in her small business. She is confident she will be able to repay the loan. This loan was used to purchase: bananas, oranges, mandarin oranges, apples, peaches, pineapples, watermelons, cantaloupes, tomatoes, chilli peppers, onions, garlic, romaine lettuce, potatoes, carrots, chayotes, and zucchini. 

Carmen's wish is to have no further complications in her health. Diabetes is a disease that requires much attention and a somewhat complicated treatment. She hopes not to have a health crisis, but she also wants to prosper with her business. She wants to see steady sales and to never fail to have enthusiasm and wish to work.

Her hope is kept up when she is able to see her great grand children. Her husband is in good health. She hopes to not have to suffer and to one day pass away without pain. She says that she is not upset about the hour of her passing. 

She is grateful to all of those around the world who have taken the time to read about her life.  To all those individuals who feel sad or depressed, she wishes them to look up on her life as an example of how beautiful it is to reach her age. Life is a little box full of surprises, but one has to be ready for all those things that are in store for us. Thanks to Kiva and Fundacion Realidad (Kiva Field Partner). May God bless you and fill you with the joy of life and good health.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Flor De Primavera Group

texts.es:
El siguente grupo se llama "Flor de Primavera" el grupo se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad de Calvario del Carmen, San felipe del Progreso, esta integrado por 9 mujeres, todas ellas Mazahuas, las nueve integrantes son mujeres que saben bordar, tejer y coser, hacen servilletas, manteles, chalecos etc. Por lo regular algunas de las mujeres venden sus bordados para ganar un poco de dinero extra, pero todas ellas son ganaderas y quieren comprar con el prestamo pollos, guajolotes y borregas para cria, la comunidad en general es de pocos recursos, toda la gente se dedica al campo y a cuidar animales, los señores son albañiles que tienen que salir de su pueblo para viajar a la ciudad para un trabajo de una construcción y terminando el trabajo se regresan al pueblo y se vuelven a dedicar a cuidar sus animales y al campo.

Los nombres de la mujeres son los siguientes:

1.-Maria Felipa R. V., tiene 67 años de edad, sabe bordar y se dedica a criar borregas
2.-Angelina Gonzalez M.. tiene 33 años, tiene una tienda de abarrotes y cria animales
3.-Zeferina C. L., tiene 37 años de edad, cria animales, pollo y guajolotes
4.-Amalia M. C., tiene 25 años, cria borregos y atiende en su casa una tienda general
5.-Catalina C. S., tiene 32 años, cria pollos y puercos 
6.-Ma Justa L. M., tiene 50 años, cria animales, pollos, guajolotes y borregos
7.-Maricela M. M., tiene 27 años cria pollos y tiene una tienda general
8.-Maria del Carmen L. R., tiene 35 años y cria borregos
9.-Margarita L. M., tiene 38 años cria pollos y es la lider del Grupo.

Doña Margarita comenta que se animaron hacer el grupo porqué las nueve integrantes se conocen desde niñas y han sido vecinas de toda la vida, por eso confian en que pueden salir adelante con el grupo y existe esa confianza entre ellas, es un grupo que se lleva muy bien y son cumplidoras, el grupo se llama "Flor de Primavera" porqué cuando formaron el grupo estaban en la estación de la primavera y les parecio buena idea llamarse así. 

Doña Margarita va iniciar la actividad de criar pollos y guajolotes, porqué estos animales son bien vendidos todo el año, ya tiene experiencia cuidandolos solo que se quedo sin dinero para volver a comprar, ahora con el prestamo los piensa comprar de nuevo para criarlos, lo dificil empieza cuando estos pollos y guajolotes se enferman, inmediantamente hay que comprarles la vacuna para que no se mueran y si uno ya esta enfermo es probable que todos lo esten porqué se contagian, entonces la vacuna se teien que comprar a todos, los pollos y los guajolotes se enferman de la gripa.
Doña Margarita comenta que el prestamo va a beneficiar a su familia porqué tiene hijos en la escuela es uno que esta en la primaria tiene 10 años y uno que inicia el preescolar, los otros dos ya estan grandes y trabajan, en total fueron 4 hombres los que tubo doña Margarita, y quiere para ellos poderlos comprar ropa y los utiles que piden en la escuela, doña Mago vive en union libre no es casada y viven con su esposo en casa propia, el señor trabaja como albañil y lo poco que tambien gana en el campo con eso con lo que viven, las metas de doña Mago son poder seguir adelante con sus animales y no solo quiere que sean pollos si no tener mas como borregos y reces que pueda estar comprando con el prestamo que le otorgan y algunas de las ganancias. quiere que al final del prestamo pueda ya tener por lo menos una pareja de borregos y para el siguiente prestamo unas reces.
texts.en:
This group is called “Flor de Primavera” (Flower of Spring), which is located in the community of Calvario del Carmen, San Felipe del Progreso. Its membership consists of nine women, all of whom are Mazahuas. These nine women know how to embroider, sew, and knit. They make napkins, tablecloths, vests, and other items. Some of the women sell their embroideries to earn some extra money, but they all raise livestock and want to use this loan to buy chickens, turkeys, and sheep to raise. This is generally a poor community. All of the residents work in the fields and take care of animals. The men work as masons and must leave town and travel to the city to work on construction jobs. After finishing their work, they return to town so that they can care for their animals and their crops.

The names of the women are as follows: 1. Maria Felipa R. V., age 67, knows embroidery and raises sheep. 2. Angelina Gonzalez M., age 33, has a grocery store and raises animals. 3. Zeferina C. Lopes, age 37, raises animals, chickens, and turkeys. 4. Amalia M. C., age 25, raises sheep and manages a general store in her home. 5. Catalina C. S., age 32, raises chickens and pigs. 6. Ma Justa L. Marín, age 50, raises animals, chickens, turkeys, and sheep. 7. Maricela M. M., age 27, raises chickens and has a general store. 8. Maria del Carmen L. R., age 35, raises sheep. 9. Margarita L. M., age 38, raises chickens and is the group leader.

Doña Margarita says the nine members were excited to form a group because they have known each other since childhood and have been neighbors all of their lives. For this reason, they are confident that they can move forward as a group and trust one another. The group members conduct themselves well and get along with each other. This group is called “Flor de Primavera” because it was formed during the spring and the name seemed to be a good idea.

Doña Margarita will start raising chickens and turkeys because these animals sell well throughout the year. She has experience raising these animals, but she lacks the money to buy them. With this loan, she now plans to buy new animals to raise because at first she had difficulty raising chickens and turkeys because they got sick. She will immediately buy vaccines to prevent them from dying because if one animal gets sick they all become infected.

Doña Margarita says the loan will benefit her family because she has children in school. She has one child who is 10 years old and attends elementary school while another one started preschool. Her other two children are older and work, for a total of four children. Doña Margarita wants to buy her children clothes and school supplies. She and her husband are not formally married, but they live in their own home. Doña Margarita’s husband works as a mason and they must live off of what little he earns. Her goals include moving forward with her animal business. Not only does she want to raise chickens, but she also will use her loan and some of her profits to buy sheep and cows. These funds will help her acquire a pair of sheep, so she will her next loan to buy a few cows.

loans.use: Purchase chickens & sheep

loans.name: Amarsanaa

texts.en: Amarsanaa D. is 38 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Suhbaatar province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His older two children attend a school while his wife is currently unemployed and takes care of their infant son. Amarsanaa operates a machinery part repair service specialized in increasing height of truck and trailer bodies. He started his business in 2000 and has since built a stable operation. Over the many years of business, he has experienced in his repair service and has gained a lot of permanent customers. For the future, he plans to expand his business by purchasing necessary tools and equipments. Amarsanaa says, "My oldest son is a good at his school, he attended many mathematics Olympics with high achievements but I can not fully support my son with his education due to financial problem" He is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase supplies and materials for his machinery part repair service as well as use for household's consumption.

loans.use: To purchase supplies and materials

loans.name: Aom's Group

texts.en:
There are twenty-two members fare forming a village bank loan, and they are living in Preaek Traeng village in Kandal province. This village loan selected, Mrs. Aom K., 39 years old, as the village bank president. The members of this village hope to increase their income to improve the family of their living by using these loans. 

Mrs. Aom K. is widow with three children; one of whom is laborer and the others two are students in the local school. 

Mrs. Aom K. is a farmer who owns a plot of land which she uses to grow rice and vegetables for a living. With this farming, she is able to earn a little income to support her family. But now her house has a broken roof, so she would like to ask for a loan to add her saving to buy zincs to fix her house up.

loans.use: To add her saving to buy zincs to fix her house up.

loans.name: El Carmen Group

texts.es:
El siguiente grupo se llama "El Carmen", esta ubicado en la comunidad de Carmen Ocotepec, la comunidad es muy religiosa, y hay que destacar que viven casi puras mujeres porqué los hombres se van a los E.U  en busca de una mejor calidad de vida para su familia, los señores lo que hacen es mandar dinero para empezar a construir su casa y teniendo ya lo sufiente para empezar una vida en su pueblo es cuando se regresan de E.U. Las señoras crian animales y con el dinero que mandan sus esposos llevan a sus hijos a la escuela, van construyendo la casa para cuando regresen los señores. 
Las integrantes son mujeres muy trabajadoras que les gusta salir adelante y trabajar para ayudar a su esposo con su familia, para que sus hijos tengan mejores oportunidades que los padres, los nombres de los integrantes son los siguientes:
1.-Argelia Ivonne C. M., cria pollos y guajolotes
2.-Nancy B. G., tiene una tienda de abarrotes
3.-Joaquina C. F., cria borregos para vender
4.-Rosa Sanchez C., cria borregos
5.-Rafaela R. S., cria pollos
6.-Marcelina C. F., tiene una tienda de abarrotes
7.-Gregorio Sanchez C., tiene el servicio de taxista
8.-Natividad Esmeralda O. E., cria pollos y guajolotes

Este grupo desidio llamarse asi porqué la comunidad se llama El Carmen Ocotepec, para destacar que son de la comunidad se pusieron ese nombre, comenta la representante del grupo que todas se conocen pero no se llevaban hasta ahora que organizaron el grupo, algunas son vecinas y otras viven dentro de la comunidad pero lejos, entonces fue un poco extraño como se invitaron para estar en el grupo.

La representante se llama Maria Joaquina C. F., doña Joaquina vive en union libre con su esposo, tienen 4 hijos, 3 niñas y 1 niño, su esposo es taxista, trabaja desde temprano hasta que anochese, los niños vana a la escuela, dos estudian la primaria y 1 la secundaria, el otro niño todavia no tiene edad para entrar a la escuela, doña Joaquina y si familia viven en una casa prestada es casa de su suegra y sueña con ir haciendo su casa, pero la situación no es nada sencilla, y para eso ella tambien tiene que trabajar y ayudar a su esposo, como tiene hijos los tiene que estar cuidando y no hay tiempo para trabajar, doña Joaquina decidio criar borregos para criarlos y venderlos con el fin de sacar dinero extra para su familia, ya tiene borregos pero desea incrementarlos para tener mas y tengan crias, para doña Joaquina no es dificil criarlos, desde niña cria borregos y sabe bien como hacerlo.
Doña Joaquina tiene un hijo con capacidades diferentes y va a una escuela especial, por eso parte de las ganancias son para el niño y los algunos gastos que tengan que cubirse, el mejoramiento va ser cuando doña Joaquina venda sus borregos por ahora solo desea imcrmentar y tener mas animales lo cual significa que hay mas dinero invertido y que en cualquier momento puede hacer eso de el.
texts.en:
The following group is called "El Carmen" and it is located in the community of Carmen Ocotepec.  The community is very religious and it should be mentioned that the town is mostly made up of women. The men of the community go to the United States to work for the sake of their family’s quality of life. The men who send money will come back to their village when they have enough to build a house and to start a life back home.  The women raise livestock animals and with the funds that their husbands send them, they are able to keep the children in school and they can start building a house for when the men return.

The members of the group are hardworking women who enjoy success and work hard to help their husbands with the family, striving to give better opportunities to the children. The names of the members are the following: 

1. Argelia Ivonne C. M. raises chickens and turkeys. 
2. Nancy B. G. has a convenience store. 
3. Joaquina C. F. raises sheep. 
4. Rosa Sanchez C. raises sheep. 
5. Rafaela R. S. raises chickens. 
6. Marcelina C. F. has a convenience store.
7. Gregorio Sanchez C. is a taxi driver. 
8. Natividad Esmeralda O. E. raises chickens and turkeys.

This group decided on that name because the name of the community is El Carmen Ocotopec, to  underline that they are from that community. The representative for the group comments that the members know each other now but they didn't prior to the organization of the group. Some are neighbours and others come from far, even though they are from the same community. It was a bit unusual how they all come together as a group.

The representative of the group is Maria Joaquina C. F.. Joaquina lives with her common-law husband and they have four children together, 3 girls and 1 boy. Her husband is a taxi driver, working from the very early morning until sunset. The kids go to school. Two are in primary school and 1 is in high school. The other child has not reached school age yet. Joaquina and her family live in a house that has been lent out to them by her mother-in-law. She dreams of building her own home, but their situation is not easy. She also needs to work to help her husband, and as she has children in her care she doesn't have time to work. Joaquina decided to raise sheep for later resale, with the goal of earning an extra income for the family. She has some sheep already but she wants to increase her flock. Joaquina doesn't find it difficult to raise them. She has been raising sheep since she was a girl and she knows how to do it. 

Joaquina has a son with special needs and he goes to a special school. A part of the profits will be for him and some other related expenses. Joaquina will see an improvement once she sells her sheep, but for now she just wants to add to her flock and to have more animals.  This means that there is more money invested and at whatever time she is able to use some of her investment.

loans.use: To purchase sheep.

loans.name: Nov

texts.en: Nov T. has been in the farming business for years. She plants various crops to earn a living and typically generates an income of $3 per day. Her husband helps her in farming business as well. They have given birth to one kid, and still living under her care. They had planted rice crop for over three but their crop is not grows well because it needs more fertilizers. To deal with this situation, Nov T. would like to request a loan from Kiva to buy gasoline, and some fertilizers for her crops to grow well. With the rest of fund she will use to buy a horse for picking up rice.

loans.use: To buy gasoline, and some fertilizers for crops to grow well.

loans.name: Jose Augusto

texts.es:
José tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero y reside junto a su madre y hermana en  uno de los caseríos que conforman el distrito de Las Lomas, una zona agrícola que pertenece a la región Piura y que se encuentra situada a más de tres horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar en actividades agrícolas: por un lado cuanta con algunas cabezas de ganado vacuno y ovino, las cuales cría en diversos corrales situados cerca a su domicilio. El usualmente comercializa sus ovejas a los negociantes de la zona y al público en general y también vende la leche que producen sus vacas. Adicionalmente trabaja como peón agrícola en los campos de cultivo de la zona. Los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades los utiliza para ayudar a su familia a salir adelante.

José desea adquirir más animales y alimento para realizar algunas mejoras en su negocio. De modo que pueda percibir mayores ingresos y pueda seguir ayudando a su familia. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
José is 22 years old, single, and lives with her husband and sister in one of the villages that make up the District of Las Lomas, an agricultural district that is part of the region of Piura. This community is located more than three and a half hours away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

He works in different farming activities. José raises a few heads of cattle and sheep that he keeps in different pens located near his home. He usually sells the sheep to local merchants and to the general public as well as the milk produced by his cows. In addition, he works as a laborer on farms in the area. The income he earns from these activities is used to help move his family forward.

José wants to acquire more animals and feed so that he can make some improvements to his business. This will allow him to earn more income and continue helping his family. To accomplish this goal, he is requesting from Edpyme Alternativa a loan in the amount of 1000 PEN.

loans.use: Purchase animals and feed

loans.name: Bujintuul

texts.en: Bujintuul is 27 years old and lives with her parents and two children in a house and fence in the Suhbaatar district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her daughter, age 4, is in a kindergarten and her husband currently lives and works in Korea. Bujintuul operates a leather paintings and goods manufacturing business. She makes a variety of leather paintings and souvenir products such as slipper, key chain and bag etc, to sell at the local markets. She started her business in 2006 after working as a painter for the "Mon-Tulga" company since 2003. She is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase leather cutting machine to make her souvenir products.

loans.use: To purchase leather cutting machine

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
María Teresa tiene 52 años D. edad, es casada y resiD. junto a su esposo en uno D. los caseríos que conforma el distrito D. Las Lomas, una zona agrícola que pertenece a la región Piura y que se encuentra situada a más D. tres horas y media D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la comercialización D. combustible entre los pobladores D. la zona, asimismo cuenta con un grupo D. animales menores, los cuales cría en algunos corrales situados cerca a su domicilio para luego venderlos al público en general y a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donD. residen. Estas actividades son bastante importantes para la economía D. su familia ya que depenD. D. ellas para ayudar a su esposo a sustentarlos.

María desea ampliar su negocio D. crianza y venta D. animales con la compra D. más animales y alimento, con ello espera aumentar sus ventas y percibir un mayor número D. ganancias. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
María Teresa is 52 years old, married, and lives with her husband in one of the villages that make up the District of Las Lomas, an agricultural area tha is part of the region of Piura. This community is located more than three and a half hours away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

María Teresa sells fuel to the local villagers. She also has a herd of small animals that she raises in pens located near her home. María sells the animals to the general public and to merchants who frequently visit the area where she lives. These activities are important for her family’s finances since she depends on them to help her husband support themselves.

María wants to expand her business of raising and selling animals by purchasing more of them as well as feed. She hopes to increase her sales and generate more income. To accomplish this goal, she is requesting a loan of 1000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: Purchase animals and feed

loans.name: Suon

texts.en:
Mr. Suon R. is a villager who lives in Reang Dek village in Kandal province. He and his wife, Mrs. Doeuk Vann, are farmers who own a plot of land which they use to cultivate rice for family living. With this farming, they don’t have enough money for growing crop. So Mr. Suon R. would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, and gasoline for cultivating rice. Aside from farmer, Mr. Suon R. is also earns his living through fishing in the local village.
This couple has four children; two of whom are attending in the local school and the others are too young to study or work. His wife is in the picture with him.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, and gasoline for cultivating rice.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en: "Margie is a married woman who lives in Toledo City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating one business venture: tailoring .Her husband Eric, who is 44 years old, works as a Government employee to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have two children who are 19 and 20 years old. The children are currently going to school and also help in the business. Margie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 14 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Margie has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 21,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,500, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 15th loan, she is borrowing PHP 22,000, which she intends to buy tailoring materials so that she could continue to save up for future home repairs and education of her children. Margie is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase tailoring materials

loans.name: Hildebrando

texts.es:
Hildebrando es un padre de familia de 36 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus tres hijos en el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona semitropical que produce principalmente frutas como el mango, el limón y la maracuyá. La localidad pertenece a la región Piura y se encuentra situada a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Usualmente trabaja como albañil, pero como esta actividad no le provee de suficientes ingresos, el ha instalado un pequeño bar picantería en su vivienda. Allí no sólo ofrece bebidas sino que también vende diversos platos hechos a base de pescado. Los días que suele atender son los días domingos y lunes y gracias a su buena atención actualmente su clientela se encuentra creciendo.

Hildebrando desea adquirir más bebidas para ampliar su stock, asimismo desea adquirir insumos para seguir preparando alimentos. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Hildebrando is a 36 year old father who lives with his wife and three children in the farming district of Tambogrande, a semitropical area known for producing mainly fruits such as mangos, lemons, and passion fruit. This community is part of the region of Piura and is located more than two hours away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

Hildebrando usually works as a mason, but this job does not generate enough income. He opened a small bar inside of his home. There he not only offers drinks, but he also sells different dishes consisting of fish. He manages his bar on Sundays and Mondays. Thanks to the good service he provides, Hildebrando currently has a growing customer base.

He wants to acquire more beverages to increase his inventory as well as purchase supplies for the dishes he prepares. In order to accomplish this goal, he is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN.

loans.use: Purchase more beverages to increase his inventory and ingredients for preparing dishes to sell

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Mrs. Ly C. is 38 years old, and she is a villager who lives in Ta Skor village in Kandal province. She earns her living by selling baby shells and banana in the local market. With both this businesses, she still earns less income to support her family. So in order to increase income and to improve the family’s condition, Mrs. Ly C. decided to ask for a loan to buy more bananas to enlarge her business currently. The rest of the loan she would use to purchase a bike cycle for transportation.  
Mrs. Ly C. is widow with three children; one is baby seller, one is attending in a local school and the last one is five years old and not in school yet.

loans.use: To buy more bananas to enlarge her business currently.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Khuon

texts.en: Khuon K. I is a 51 year-old who currently lives in the province of Kompong Cham. Khuon K. I was married, but she divorced from her husband for many years ago. She is blessed with five kids, two of whom are single and the three are married. She has one kid who works in the garment factory as a sewing worker, and has a proper salary every month. Khuon K. I could earn her daily income by selling a few products in front of her house. The items which she sells are food, soft drink, sweet, and other goods. She usually generates her income from her selling about $7 per day to support her family with daily expense. Presently, Khuon K. I wants to invest more fund as capital to buy more product for additional profit. So that, Khuon K. I has decided to ask for a loan to buy more food, soft drink, and other necessary items for sale.

loans.use: To buy more food, soft drink, and other necessary items for sale.

loans.name: Luz Angelica

texts.es:
Luz Angélica es una madre de familia de 18 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a su menor hijo en uno de los caseríos que conforman el distrito agrícola de Olmos, una zona conocida a nivel regional por producir principalmente limón y maracuyá. La localidad pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra situada a más de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en la comercialización de prendas de vestir para todo público. Ella cuenta con mercadería que adquiere en la ciudad de Chiclayo y la suele ofrecer en base a pedidos. El negocio le brinda algunos ingresos que utiliza para ayudar a su esposo a sacar adelante a su familia. Ella se esfuerza continuamente por mantener su negocio y buscar nuevos clientes.

Luz desea adquirir más prendas de vestir para poder aumentar sus ventas y percibir mayores ganancias que le permitan salir adelante y progresar. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Luz Angélica is an 18 year old mother who lives with her husband and young child in one of the villages that make of the farming district of Olmos, an area known at a regional level for producing mainly lemons and passion fruit. This community is part of Lambayeque Province and located more than two hours away from the city of Chiclayo.

Luz Angélica works by selling clothes to the general public. She acquires her merchandise in the city of Chiclayo and sells them according to orders. This business provides her with some income so that she can help her husband with supporting their family. She strives continually to maintain her business and look for new customers.

Luz wants to acquire more articles of clothing so that she can increase her sales and earn more income to allow her to move forward and make progress. To achieve this goal, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 500 PEN.

loans.use: Acquire more clothing to sell

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a married woman who lives in Bogo City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: selling of fruits and a general store businesses. Her husband Antonio P., who is 61 years old, works as a carpenter to earn his living.  They have two children who are 34 and 39 years old. And they have already a job of their own. Cecilia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 10 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Cecilia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 20,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 31,200, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 11th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 22,000, which she intends to use to pay for more buy stocks of fruits to sell to a market so that she could continue to save up for future family needs. Cecilia is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund the operations of her fruits and general store to sell

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha tiene 37 años D. edad, es madre soltera y resiD. junto a su menor hija en el distrito agrícola D. TambogranD., una zona semitropical que produce principalmente frutas como el mango, el limón y la maracuyá. La localidad pertenece a la región Piura y se encuentra situada a más D. cuatro horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

Bertha se dedica a la venta D. productos cosméticos por catálogo, ella trabaja en base a pedidos, ofreciendo sus productos a sus clientes (en su mayoría vecinos y conocidos), el pedido le llega los fines D. mes y ella gana dinero D. acuerdo a la cantidad D. pedidos que realice. Adicionalmente trabaja como vendedora en una ferretería D. la zona. Bertha  se vale D. estas dos actividades para ayudar a su hija a salir adelante.

Bertha desea adquirir productos con cuenta propia para poder contar con un stock fijo que le permita satisfacer rápidamente la demanda con la que cuenta, sin tener que llegar a fin D. mes, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden con el logro D. su objetivo.
texts.en:
Bertha is 37 years old.  She is a single mother and lives together with her youngest daughter in the agricultural district of TambogranD., a semi-tropical area that mainly produces fruit such as mangoes, lemons and passion fruit.  It is located in Piura region, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque region.

Bertha sells cosmetics through a catalog.  She takes orders, offering her products to her customers (mainly neighbors and acquaintances).  Her goods arrives at the end of the month and she earns money according to how many orders she has taken.  Bertha also works as a saleswoman in a local hardward store.  She uses the income from these two activities to help her daughter get ahead in life.

Bertha would like to acquire products with her own money so that she can have a fixed stock that will allow her to quickly satisfy the demand she has without having to wait until the end of the month.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa that will help her achieve her goal.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics to expand her business

loans.name: Sendenbadam

texts.en: Sendenbadam is 59 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His wife is retired and operates a vegetable growing and trading business during summer months to support her family income. Sendenbadam sells water to the people of his town who live too far away from the town well. Since 1990, he has been delivering water using his horse cart and has built a stable operation. After years of operation, he was able to expand his business by hiring six more workers and today he owns nine horse-carts. For the future, he hopes to continue running his business with stable and sustainable operation. Sendenbadam is a hardworking man and is requesting 2,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase the hay necessary for his horses.

loans.use: To purchase the necessary hay

loans.name: Mayra Natali

texts.es:
Mayra es una madre de familia de 25 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a su menor hijo en el distrito agrícola de Oyotún, una localidad de terrenos bastante fértiles que se encuentra bastante cerca a la sierra de norte de nuestro país. Se encuentra situado aproximadamente a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Mayra se dedica desde hace cinco años a la venta de productos cosméticos por catálogo, ella trabaja en base a pedidos, ofreciendo sus productos a sus clientes (en su mayoría vecinos y conocidos), el pedido le llega los fines de mes y ella gana dinero de acuerdo a la cantidad de pedidos que realice.
