Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento económico de su familia.

Mayra desea adquirir productos por cuenta propia para poder contar con un stock fijo que le permita satisfacer rápidamente la demanda con la que cuenta, sin tener que llegar a fin de mes, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden con el logro de su objetivo.
texts.en:
Mayra is a 25 year-old mother who lives with her husband and young son in the agricultural district of Oyotún, a place of fertile lands which is located quite near our country's northern mountain range, approximately two hours from the city of Chiclayo.

For five years, Mayra has been selling cosmetics through a catalog.  She takes orders, offering her products to her customers (mainly neighbors and acquaintances).  Her goods arrive at the end of the month and she earns money according to how many orders she has taken.  She uses the income that she makes from this business activity to help her husband support their family financially.

Mayra would like to acquire products with her own money so that she can have a fixed stock that will allow her to quickly satisfy the demand that she has, without having to wait until the end of the month.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which will help her to achieve her goal.

loans.use: To acquire cosmetics with her own money so that she can have a fixed stock

loans.name: Phay

texts.en:
Mrs. Thai S. is 47 years old, and she is a villager who lives in Prasat village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who rents a plot of land which she uses to grow morning glory for a living. With this farming, she doesn’t have enough money to support its, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and gasoline for growing morning glory. The rest of the loan, she would uses to buy a fishing board for fishing.  Aside from farmer, she also earns her living by fishing in the local village. 
Mrs. Thai S. is widow with three children; one is a laborer, one is a construction worker, and the last one is attending in a local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and gasoline for growing morning glory.

loans.name: Leonorio

texts.es:
Leonorio es un padre de familia de 47 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus  tres hijos en el sector Sipán del distrito de Zaña, la localidad es una zona dedicada principalmente a la agricultura que se encuentra situada a media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte en una mototaxi  (vehículo motorizado que consiste en una motocicleta a la cual se le anexa una cabina para brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros) el cuenta con una clientela estable. Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores. Los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades los utiliza para solventar los gastos económicos de su familia.

Leonorio desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más animales y alimento balanceado, así como realizar algunas reparaciones en su unidad móvil, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Leonorio is a 47 year-old father who lives with his wife and three children in Sipán sector, in Zaña district.  This is an area whose residents mainly work in farming.  It is located half an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

Leonorio provides transport services with a 'mototaxi' (a motorized vehicle which consists of a motorbike with a cabin behind it in which cargo and passengers are carried).  He has a stable customer base.  In addition, he also raises and sells animals.  He uses the income that he makes from these activities to cover his family's expenses. 

Leonorio would like to expand his business by purchasing more animals and balanced feed.  He would also like to carry out some repairs on his vehicle.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which will help him achieve his goal.

loans.use: To expand his business by purchasing more animals and balanced animal feed

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Kong R. is a 52-year-old married woman and a local villager living in a medium-sized home with family members in Kompong Cham Province. She has a life partner in her husband who works as a fisherman in his community. She has seven children; five are married, the other two are single, and they are employed in various jobs. Kong R. owns a piece of farmland that she inherited many years ago from her grandparents. Kong R. uses this land to grow rice crop, and she could get the great result from her farming business almost every season. Kong R. will be using her loan to add to her personal savings to buy a plot of her neighbor’s farmland near her house, which is a good location for farming. She will use this land for doing farming. 

Note: Kong R. and her husband are in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a plot of farmland for doing farming.

loans.name: Jorge Benjamin

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 24 años de edad, es soltero y vive en casa de sus padres, la cual está ubicada en uno de los caserios que conforman el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola que produce principalmente limón y  maracuyá, se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte en una mototaxi  (vehículo motorizado que consiste en una motocicleta a la cual se le anexa una cabina para brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros) el cuenta con una clientela estable y brinda su servicio entre su localidad y el pueblo central de Olmos. Los ingresos que percibe los utiliza para solventar sus gastos personales y apoyar a su familia con sus gastos económicos.

Jorge desea realizar algunas reparaciones en su unidad móvil para garantizar su correcto funcionamiento ya que su vehículo ha empezado a experimentar algunas fallas producto del excesivo uso y del estado accidentado de los caminos de la zona, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Jorge is 24 years old, single, and lives at the home of his parents located in one of the villages that make up the District of Olmos, an agricultural area known for producing mainly lemons and passion fruit. This area lies in the Province of Lambayque and is more than two hours away from the city of Chiclayo.

Jorge provides transportation services with a motorcycle taxi (a motorized vehicle that consists of a motorcycle attached to a cabin for transporting cargo and passengers). He has a stable customer base and offers his services within his town and the central village of Olmos. The income he generates is used to meet his personal expenses and support his family with their expenses.

Jorge needs to repair his vehicle so that it functions properly. It has started to experience a few mechanical failures due to excessive use and the poor conditions of the local roads. For this reason, he is requesting a loan of 2000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa in order to achieve his goal.

loans.use: Pay for vehicle repairs

loans.name: Batbold

texts.en: Batbold is 45 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Suhbaatar province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent in his son in law's fence. His oldest daughter works as a teacher for the local school in Erdenetsagaan subprovince while his middle son works as a salesperson in the local grocery shop. His youngest son attends a local vocational training in a computer class. His wife has been operating a sewing business out of her home where she sews a variety of traditional clothing items, since 2000. Batbold operates a meat trading business. He started his business in 2006 and has gained a lot of experience.  For the future, he plans to have his own plot of land and fence for his family. He will use this loan to purchase a large amount of meat to sell in Ulaanbaatar, a capital city of Mongolia for profits. With his business earnings, he hopes to purchase timbers and woods from Ulaanbaatar to build a fence in his own land which was given by the government. He is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to use as he planned.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of meat

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin M. is from the village of Esperanza West. He is 46 years old. Benjamin is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Benjamin owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Benjamin has been engaged in his business for over 18 years and earns approximately 25000 during harvest season.

In 2010, Benjamin joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Benjamin is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Benjamin from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of the borrower's children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Eang's Group

texts.en:
Eight people who live in Roka village in Kandal province have formed a village bank loan and all the members selected Mrs. Eang R. as a village bank president. All the members will use their loan in different purposes.

Mrs. Eang R. is a farmer in the local village. In her farming, she now has faced a problem because she does not have enough money to buy rice seeds for her cultivating. ThU., she would like to ask for a loan to buy more rice seeds for her field. Her husband, Mr. Chorn Choun, is a fisherman who can make a little income to support the family. This couple has two children one is a garment worker while the other is a student.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more rice seeds for her field.

loans.name: Maria Dolli

texts.es:
María Dolly es una madre de familia de 42 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en una zona marginal del distrito de Lambayeque, una zona bastante comercial situada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en la crianza y venta de animales menores. Ella cría aves de corral en su domicilio, las engorda con granos y alimento balanceado y cuando ya han obtenido un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona y con el público en general. El negocio es una fuente importante de ingresos para el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia por lo que siempre trata de mantenerlo del mejor modo posible.

María desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más animales y alimento balanceado de modo que pueda aumentar sus ventas y percibir mayores ingresos por sus ventas. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
María Dolly is a 42 year old mother who lives with her husband and children in a marginalized area of the District of Lambayeque. This commercial area is located twenty minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

María Dolly works by raising and selling small animals. She raises poultry from her home, fattening them with grain and balanced feed. When the animals have reached the proper level of development, she sells them to merchants who frequently visit the area and to the general public. This business is an important source of income to support her family’s finances, so she always tries to care for her animals in the best way possible.

María wants to expand her business by purchasing more animals and balanced feed so that she can increase her sales and generate more income. To keep growing, she is requesting a loan of 2000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: Purchase more animals & balanced feed

loans.name: Hermogenes

texts.en:
Hermogenes G. is from the village of Esperanza West. He is 42 years old. Hermogenes is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Hermogenes owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Hermogenes has been engaged in his business for over 15 years and earns approximately 30000 PHP per harvest.

In 2010, Hermogenes joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hermogenes is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Hermogenes from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of the borrower's children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en: To make a living, Ricardo D. S. plants and harvests rice for sale. He is 42 years old, married and has three school-aged children. They are from the village of Esperanza West. Ricardo has been in his business for over 12 years and earns approximately 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) per harvest. In 2010, Ricardo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Ricardo is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This will be his first loan from ASKI. He plans to use additional income to improve and expand his business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Eng

texts.en:
Eng S. is 50 years old and a married woman from the province of Kompong Cham. She was married years ago and has five children: one is single and four are married. Eng S. is currently a recycling seller. She buys used goods to sell to a wholesaler, who then sells the goods in bulk to other countries. The used goods she sells are mostly leftover electrical wires and plastic. Her husband helps her with the business. 

Eng S. is concerned that her old bathroom is too small for her family. She wishes to build a larger bathroom in order to make it easier for her whole family to use. That is why Eng S. is asking for a loan from Kiva.

loans.use: To build a bathroom for the family

loans.name: Felipe

texts.en: Felipe C.'s main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. He is 42 years old, married and has four school-aged children. They are from the village of Esperanza West, Aurora, Isabela. Felipe has been in his business for over 25 years and earns approximately 35,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) during harvest season. In 2010, Felipe joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Felipe is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This will be his first loan from ASKI. He plans to use additional income to improve and expand his business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok S. is the elected president of a village bank loan, composed of nine people in Roka village in Kandal province. The members will uS. their portion of this group loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Sok S. is a widow who is a Khmer cake seller in the local village. Since she has only one business, she does not have enough money support her family. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets and ducks to start a new business. She hopes to be able to support her family well. Mrs. Sok S. has only one child, who is a student in the local village.

loans.use: To buy piglets and ducks to start a new business

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel M. is from the village of Esperanza West. He is 38 years old. Samuel is single. To make a living, Samuel owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Samuel has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 25000 PHP every harvest season.

In 2010, Samuel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Samuel is requesting a new loan of 22000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Samuel from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his  family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase seeds & seedlings

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie U. is from the village of Esperanza West. She is 47 years old. Rosalie is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosalie owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Rosalie has been engaged in her business for over 17 years and earns approximately 30000 PHP per harvest.

In 2010, Rosalie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalie is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Rosalie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees for her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Soung's Group

texts.en:
Nine people who live in Roka village in Kandal province has formed a village bank.  The members have selected Mrs. Soung N. to be the village bank president.  The members will use their portion of this loan for their different needs.

Mrs. Soung N. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. She does not have enough money to pay for the laborers needed to work her farm, so she decided to ask for a loan to pay for this labor. 

Mrs. Soung N. is a widow with four children, one is employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To pay for laborers to cultivate rice

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo M. is from the village of Esperanza West. He is 46 years old. Eduardo is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Eduardo owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Eduardo has been engaged in his business for over 16 years and earns approximately 28000 PHP every harvest season.

In 2010, Eduardo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eduardo is requesting a new loan of 21000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Eduardo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees for his children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Narantsetseg

texts.en:
Narantsetseg is 49 years old and lives with her husband and five children in Bayanhongor province in central Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent, on her sibling's fenced lot. Her three children are university students. Her husband works as a repairman at a standardization and metrology center and earns a monthly salary of 210,000 MNT. 

Narantsetseg currently operates a grocery trading business out of a rented shop called "Rich Lake" in her town. Between 1992 and 1994, she operated a mobile meal business.  From 1995 to 2004, she had a dairy products business.  In 2004, she started her grocery store. 

After many years of business, she has gained much experience.  Her earnings have enabled her to not only improve her family's standard of living but also pay her three children's tuition fees. She is a professional construction decorator and does that work during the summer months in addition to her grocery trading business to supplement her earnings. 

In the future, Narantsetseg hopes to continue operate her business at a stable level. Narantsetseg is requesting a 2,300,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more grocery products to sell in her shop.

loans.use: To purchase grocery products to sell

loans.name: Kun

texts.en:
Kun S. is a 43-year-old mother caring for four children, one is married and the other three are single. One of them is working in the garment industry in Phnom Penh City as a sewing worker, and has a fixed salary of $50 per month. 

Kun S. and her husband are recycling sellers – they buy used goods to sell to a wholesaler, who then resells them in bulk to other countries. The used goods they deal in are mostly leftover electrical wires. 

Kun S. is looking for a loan to use as capital to buy more stock to increase her profits.  With the remainder of the loan, she will use to add to her savings to buy a used motorbike to use as transport for the business.

loans.use: To buy more electrical wires for sale.

loans.name: 03- Dong Son Group

texts.en:
Cuong N. T. (274) is a 49-year-old femaL. living in the town of Thanh Hoa.  Cuong is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 03-Dong Son (10.13.03 Dong Son).


Cuong is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To making a living, Cuong operates a family member's business in the retail sector running a general store.  WhiL. not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste, in the local community.  Cuong has been engaged in this business for over 12 years and earns approximately 2000000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2010, Cuong joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Cuong has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1963500 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase products to sell.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6000000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  The loan will be her 2nd loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Cuong plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  N. T. Ha (278) is a 27 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.


2.  L. T. Hong  (277) is a 60 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a service-based business.


3.  T. T. Lan (276) is a 31 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a service-based business.


4.  D. T. Nhan (275) is a 52 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Cuong N. T. (274) là 49 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa.  Cuong là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 03-Dong Son (10.13.03 Dong Son).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các mặt hàng nhu yếu phẩm như dầu gội đầu, xà bông & kem đánh răng trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Cuong thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 12 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Cuong kiếm được khoảng 2000000 VND.  Vào 2010, Cuong đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Cuong đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 1,963,500 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6,000,000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

2.  L. T. Hong  (277) là 60 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


3.  T. T. Lan (276) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


4.  D. T. Nhan (275) là 52 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Simplicio

texts.en:
Simplicio V. is from the village of Esperanza West. He is 41 years old. Simplicio is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Simplicio owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Simplicio has been engaged in his business for over 14 years and earns approximately 30000 PHP per harvest.

In 2010, Simplicio joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Simplicio is requesting a oan of 21000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Simplicio from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

texts.en:
Femy G. is from the village of Esperanza West. She is 37 years old. Femy is married. To make a living, Femy owns & operates a business of planting and harvesting rice for sale. Femy has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 25000 PHP per harvest.

In 2010, Femy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Femy is requesting a new loan of 21000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Femy from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Carlita

texts.en:
Carlita is a 64-year old single who supports her family by operating 2 business ventures: a general store and ice candy. She lives in Ilog, Negros Occidental. Carlita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1998 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 5 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Carlita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 9000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 6th loan, she is borrowing PHP 10000, with which she intends to purchase more stock to sell so that she can continue to save up for future business. 

Carlita is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Tuya

texts.en: Tuya, 37 years old, is married and has three children who all attend a high school in town. Tuya and her family live in their own house and yard in the Hovd province of Mongolia. Her husband was previously a driver, but he is now not working. Tuya has been operating a towel-selling business since 2008. She has also started to sell underwear. She and her husband are planning to operate furniture-making business and to buy tools and to do repairs. Tuya is a handy person. She requesting 3,500,000 MNT to purchase more goods to increase her working capital.

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  D. việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Danny

texts.en:
Danny G. Jr. is from the village of Esperanza West. He is 35 years old. Danny is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Danny owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Danny has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 25000 PHP per harvest.

In 2010, Danny joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Danny is requesting a loan of 15000 PHP, which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. This loan will be his 1st loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Delia's Group

texts.en:
Delia S. is from the village of Casalatan, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 45 years old. Delia is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Delia is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Delia owns & operates a business selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling vegetables to the local community. Delia has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Delia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Delia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used for working capital and to purchase additional inventory. Delia is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 4th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Rosel Noel

texts.es:
Rosel es un padre de familia de 25 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a su hija en un sector urbano marginal del distrito de Lambayeque, una zona comercial que se encuentra situada a más de veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte en una mototaxi  (vehículo motorizado que consiste en una motocicleta a la cual se le anexa una cabina para brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros) el cuenta con una clientela estable y brinda su servicio en su localidad y en las zonas aledañas. Los ingresos que percibe los utiliza para solventar los gastos económicos de su familia.

Rosel desea realizar algunas reparaciones en su unidad móvil para garantizar su correcto funcionamiento ya que su vehículo ha empezado a experimentar algunas fallas producto del excesivo uso y del estado accidentado de los caminos de la zona, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Rosel is 25 years old.  He lives with his wife and daughter in an outlying area of Lambayeque district, a commercial zone located more than twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

He runs a motorcycle taxi (a motorcycle with a cabin for transporting goods and people attached to the back).  He has a stable clientele and works locally and in neighboring areas.  He uses his income to cover his family's expenses.

Rosel would like to do some repairs to his vehicle so that it works properly, since it has started to show some problems stemming from  its constant use and the poor state of the roads in his area.  He has asked microfinance partner Edpyme Alternativa for this loan so he can accomplish this objective.

loans.use: To do some repairs to his vehicle so that it works properly.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Martín es un padre de familia de 39 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en uno de los caseríos del distrito de Mórrope, una zona agrícola que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra situada a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en la confección de prendas de vestir. El cuenta con un pequeño talkler instalado en su domicilio en donde confecciona camisas, pantalones, blusas y otras prendas dependiendo de la temporada y de los pedidos que le realice un acopiador que siempre visita la zona en donde viven para comprarles las prendas que han confeccionado. El negocio es su única fuente de ingreso y es compartido con su esposa. Ambos se esfuerzan diariamente para salir adelante ya que dependen de esta actividad para lograrlo.

Martín desea adquirir material para poder confeccionar más prendas de temporada de verano, de modo que puedan incrementar sus ventas y sus ingresos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Martín is 39 years old.  He lives with his wife and children in a country house in Mórrope, an agricultural area that is part of the province of Lambayeque and which is located more than an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

He is a tailor.  He has a small workshop in his home, where he makes shirts, pants, blouses, and other garments depending on the season and the orders he fills for a wholesaler who always visits the area where he lives to buy his clothing.  The business is his only source of income, and he shares it with his wife.  They both work hard on the tailoring every day so they can get ahead.

Martín would like to buy material to make summer clothes, so that he can increase his sales and his income.  He has asked microfinance partner Edpyme Alternativa for this loan to help him meet this goal.

loans.use: To buy material to make summer garments so as to augment sales.

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.es:
Teodoro tiene 52 años de edad, es soltero y reside junto a sus padres en el distrito de Mórrope, una zona agrícola de regular movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El cuenta con una bodega que funciona en su domicilio y en la cual ofrece en venta una variedad de productos de primera necesidad, abarrotes y verduras tanto al contado y al crédito. Este negocio es administrado por él y por su hermana y debido al buen trato que brindan sus clientes actualmente cuentan con una clientela fiel y estable. Adicionalmente Teodoro trabaja como jornalero en los campos agrícolas de la zona en donde reside.

Teodoro necesita adquirir más productos para poder satisfacer la demanda con la que cuenta actualmente. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Teodoro is a 52-year-old single man who lives with his parents in the district of Mórrope. Mórrope is an agricultural area with a steady amount of commercial activity, located in the province of Lambayeque, over an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

He runs a grocery store out of his home where he sells a variety of staple products, groceries and vegetables. They accept payment by cash or credit. He and his brother co-manage the store and thanks to their excellent customer service, they have a steady number of loyal customers. Teodoro also works as a day laborer in the fields of the farms near where he lives.

Teodoro needs to purchase more products in order to satisfy the current demand. He found it convenient to request a loan through Edyme Alternativa for 2,000 Peruvian nuevos soles, which will help him to meet his goal.

loans.use: Purchase of more products in order to satisfy the current demand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy construction supplies and repair home

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is married with two small children. She sells women's shoes and boots at the central market in Belaya Tserkov. Her monthly profit is about 5,000 Grivnas.

Lina started this business two years ago. She was very brave to start it during the crisis times. Her hard work and persistence enabled Lina to develop her business and make it the main source of income for her family. Today Lina has two business locations. Her business goal is to move from a kiosk at the market to a small store.

Lina is requesting a loan of 10,000 Grivnas to purchase additional inventories in order to start a third location and increase her sales. Lina and her husband live with his parents who need additional medical care. Lina hopes that a third location will help her to receive additional income to take better care of her big family.

loans.use: To start a second location

loans.name: Oyun

texts.en: Oyun is 52 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a house in the Han-Uul district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her oldest daughter works for the Skytell company while the youngest attends university. Oyun sells women’s handbags that are imported from China out of a rented stall at the largest outdoor Ulaanbaatar market, Narantuul, which is a difficult place to operate trades during the winter months. She began her business in 2000 after working as a quality control specialist for the Mongolian Leather company between 1976 and 1993. Before starting her current business, she made a variety of leather bags herself and sold them at the market. After years of successful operation, she has built a stable operation and her earnings have enabled her to build a house in her fence for her family. In the future, she plans to expand her business and increase her business profits. She is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more handbags to sell for the upcoming Tsagaan Sar, Mongolian New Year holiday.

loans.use: To purchase more handbags to sell

loans.name: Sharifaan's Group

texts.en:
Sharifaan is a housewife and lives in a combined family system in Depalpur. Depalpur is a small city in Punjab Pakistan and is known for its agriculture industry. She came here after her marriage to M. A.. She is the mother of three sons and a daughter. Three of them study while youngest one is only a year old. Sharifaan is a very supportive lady. She carries out her responsibilities of a housewife very well. She is also a very caring mother and raising her children with great responsibility. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her brother-in-law who will invest the loan in his grocery store business. He sells daily use items like cooking oil, sugar, rice and spices etc through his store and will buy more stock with the loan. He started this business three years ago and Sharifaan is hopeful that an investment will be a profitable one for him. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In a previous loan year, she has established good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery store business

loans.name: Marline

Marline I. is from the village of Dalig Viejo. She is 49 years old. Marline is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Marline owns & operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Marline has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 7,200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Marline joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marline has successfully repaid a previous loan of 35,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Marline is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the 12th loan taken out by Marline from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.name: Wazeeran's Group

texts.en:
Wazeeran is a resident of Depalpur, which is an ancient city and famous for its agriculture industry. She has lived there with her family in the area named Khalilabad for past 16 years. She is a widow and lost her husband a few years ago as a result of a sudden death. It was a time of great difficulty for Wazeeran but she never lost her hope. She brought up her four sons and a daughter with great care. She helped her elder son to find a job and her younger son to establish his business of burger joint. Now all of her children are doing either their businesses or working in different organizations for reasonable income. Even her only daughter has started working as a teacher in nearby school. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her younger son who wants to buy some ingredients like cooking oil, bread, chicken meat and spices etc for his burger joint. He started this business four years ago and Wazeeran is very hopeful that the loan will help him in further establishing his business. She has a plan to marry her eldest son who is now 24 years old and she is confident that she will be able to do that with the help of an improved financial conditions. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her fifth loan application. She is a responsible loan user who always paid her installments on time and never missed a single meeting.

loans.use: To buy ingredients like cooking oil, bread, chicken meat and spices for burger joint business

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira O. is from the village of Bacnor East, Burgos, Isabela. She is 50 years old. Elvira is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she provides motorcycle transportation services. Elvira has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 5000 Php a month for these activities.

In 2006, Elvira joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase tires and other motorcycle accessories. 

Elvira is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP which will be used to repair the motorcycle for better service. This will be her 9th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair her vehicle for better service

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy necessities for his shop

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo E. is from the village of San Rafael, Roxas, Isabela. He is 43 years old. Reynaldo is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, he plants and harvests rice for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately $694 every harvest season.

In 2010, Reynaldo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 27,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This will be his 1st loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell to expand his business

loans.name: Feliza's Group

texts.en:
Feliza G. is from the village of Villa Concepcion, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 63 years old. Feliza is the group leader of a 12-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Feliza is married and has eight adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $126 when she sells one of her raised animals.

In 2008, Feliza joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. 

Feliza is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which again will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her 6th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase all the necessities of her business

loans.name: Bilqees' Group

texts.en:
Bilqees lives in Depalpur, a small city of Pakistan that is known for its dairy industry. She has lived there for many years with her family in the area named Khalilabad. Bilqees has given birth to two sons and a daughter. 

Her husband’s name is M. Y., and he is a tailor by profession. He is expert in sewing men’s clothes and known for his good quality work in the region. 

Bilgees is a very talented lady who does embroidery work, mainly for her neighbors. She has been doing this business for more than 10 years. Now she wants to introduce her work to different customers as well.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to expand her embroidery business. She will hire a worker who will collect orders from different boutiques and clothes-selling shops. With the loan, she will buy supplies such as cloth, beads and colored thread in bulk. Then she will fulfill the orders on time and increase her sales. 

Her elder son also does embroidery. He learned this art from Bilqees and helps her in completing the orders on time. Her second son is a driver by profession. Her daughter is 11 years old and stays at home. Bilqees couldn’t provide her children a good education due to financial constraints.
 
Bilqees is very hopeful that an investment will take her business to a more profitable position and will help her manage her household expenses better. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In the previous loan year, she established a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy supplies for embroidery business

loans.name: Esthere

texts.en:
Esthere U. has been in the business of selling spare parts for eight years. She is 33 years old and is married with two children. Esthere works hard every day in order to expand her business. She works from 7 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day.

Esthere has requested a loan in order to expand her business and purchase more spare parts to sell. She really hopes that her sales will increase as well as her profits. Esthere will keep reinvesting the profits in her business for better financial stability.

loans.use: To purchase more spare parts

loans.name: Nifah

texts.en:
Nifah N. is 16 years old and lives in the town of Wobulenzi in the Luweero region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Nifah has a grocery store business, which she has run for two years.
To help expand her business, Nifah has requested a loan of 100,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase sugar cane. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Nifah hopes to generate greater profits and sometimes buy food. In the future, Nifah hopes to buy a fridge. Nifah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to read books.

loans.use: To purchase sugar cane

loans.name: Kulusum

texts.en:
Kulusum W. is 18 years old and lives in the town of Wobulenzi in the Luweero region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Kulusum has a restaurant business, which she has run for five years.
To help expand her business, Kulusum has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase and stock food. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Kulusum hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, she hopes to own a salon. Kulusum is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to use money.

loans.use: To purchase and stock food

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine N. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Wobulenzi in the Luweero region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Christine has a retail shop business, which she has run for three years.
To help expand her business, Christine has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase sugar. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Christine hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, she hopes to expand her business. Christine is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to work hard.

loans.use: To purchase sugar for resale

loans.name: Naheed's Group

texts.en:
Naheed lives in Khalilabad, a small residential area of Depalpur. Depalpur is a small city, located in Punjab, Pakistan, and known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there for six years.
 
Her husband’s name is M. K. and he owns a mobile phone selling and repairing shop in the market. He can repair almost any kind of mobile set and also offers new mobile phones from different companies to his clients at competitive rates.
 
Naheed herself is a caring lady who prefers to stay at home and take care of her household responsibilities. She has given birth to three sons and a daughter. All of them are studying except her eldest son, who left his education after matriculation and started helping his father in his business.
 
Naheed has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further growth of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will purchase new models of mobile phone sets. This will help him sell more and earn a larger income.
 
He has been doing this business for five years and Naheed is very confident that he will successfully be able to improve his business after the loan investment.
 
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy mobile phones for mobile phone selling business

loans.name: Donato

texts.en:
Donato C. is from the village of Quiling, Roxas, Isabela. He is 36 years old. Donato is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Donato plants and harvests rice for sale. Donato has been engaged in his business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 30,000 PHP per harvest.

In 2010, Donato joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. Donato is requesting a loan of 24,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the first loan taken by Donato from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to pay the tuition fees of his children. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine A. is 26 years old and is married with two children aged 1 and 4 years old. Vestine owns a small well-organized business selling shoes and has an experience of seven years. Her business is open from 6 a.m. until 7 p.m. every day. 

Vestine's husband is a salesman who works with her in the shoe store. 

Vestine has requested a loan in order to expand her business by purchasing more sacks of shoes. She hopes to use any profits to continue to grow her business, and she would like to save for the future.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes to sell

loans.name: Bonface Muithi

texts.en:
Bonface Muithi M., 26 years old, is married to Susan and they have been blessed with two children. Bonface has been selling assorted fruits at the main market in Kongowea, Mombasa, for the last twelve years and the business has been a success.

Bonface has never borrowed from any other MFI, and this will mark his first loan from KADET LTD. He plans to use the loan to purchase new stocks of different varieties of fruit for resale and to use the anticipated profits to educate his children. His dream is to own a taxi in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase new stocks of fruit

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna runs a small business selling jeans. She started this business a few years ago on the recommendation of her friends. Affordable prices and excellent client service helped Anna to develop her business. Today, she has many repeat customers and good sales. 

Anna is single. She lives with her mother and grandmother. Her business is the only source of income for her family.

Anna is a highly motivated person. She works hard to develop her business further. Anna would like to receive a loan of 20,000 UAH to purchase more winter inventory. Anna's business goal is to open a small store to sell clothing that anyone can afford.

loans.use: to purchase winter inventories

loans.name: Jackson Ole

texts.en:
Jackson Ole N. is 24 years old. He is married to Naibartun N. and blessed with two children. Jackson has been farming for the last three years. His farm is in a productive area which has proved to be good for maize farming.

Jackson learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his second loan, which he is planning to use to buy maize seeds and fertilizers. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming to increase his maize production and educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to become a large scale farmer, to buy a bigger piece of land and to build a permanent home. Jackson is a scrupulous man who can do more if supported financially

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Nezikokolima Mpirigwa Group B-Mityana

texts.en: K. Hussein, 36 years old, has been selling agro produce for the last 22 years at the Mpiriggwa Trading Center food market in Mityana. He mostly sells bananas, maize, cassava, beans and potatoes. Hussein also farms as a subsidiary business. His business, which was begun through a friend's influence, generates 40,000 UGX weekly. Hussein is happily married with 8 children and belongs to the Nezikokolima Mpirigwa group-Mityana. With this loan, Hussein plans to purchase more agro produce to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more agro produce to resell

loans.name: Moses Musana

texts.en:
Moses Musana O. S. is 42 years old. He is married to Sarafina S. and he is a father of three children. He is a farmer and he does the farming on his own piece of land, which he has been doing for the last two years. 
  
He learned about KADET Ltd. from a member of a group that is registered with KADET. This will be his second loan and he is planning to buy maize seeds and fertilizer. Maize has proved to be doing well in his area due to good climatic conditions. 

With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to re-invest in the farm and plant more acres of maize. His hope and dream is to export maize overseas and be a large-scale farmer.

Moses is a diligent man who focuses on his set objectives.

loans.use: To buy maize seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en:
Dennis B. is from the village of Quiling, Roxas, Isabela. He is 27 years old and single. To make a living, Dennis plants and harvests rice for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over four years and earns approximately $688 every harvest season.

In 2010, Dennis joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 24,000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase his crop yield. This will be his 1st loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay for services to increase his crop yield

loans.name: Janibek

texts.en:
Janibek is a 24-year-old man who lives with his wife and their 3-year-old daughter in the Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. They live in their own ger, a traditional nomadic tent and fence. 

Janibek has been operating a grocery trading business since 2007 in his own grocery store near his home. In the area where they live, there aren't any other grocery stores. That’s why he decided to open his business, and he already has his own regular customers.  The average daily income from the sale of goods is about $50 a day. Net income is about 15-20 % of sales income. His wife also works in the store. 

Month by month his grocery trading business is growing, and he needs more grocery products to sell. In the future he wants to make his grocery store bigger than it is now, and he also wants to open chain stores in other provinces. 

Janibek is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more grocery products for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria N. is 18 years old and lives in the town of Wobulenzi in the Luweero region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Maria has a salon business, which she has run for two years.
To help expand her business, Maria has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase braids. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Maria hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, she hopes to expand her business further. Maria is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future and taught her how to play volleyball.

loans.use: To purchase braids

loans.name: Kamidah

texts.en:
Kamidah N. is 17 years old and lives in the town of Wobulenzi in the Luweero region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Kamidah has a fish-selling business, which she has run for two years.
To help expand her business, Kamidah has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase fish. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Kamidah hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, she hopes to own a retail shop. Kamidah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to save.

loans.use: To purchase fish for resale

loans.name: Baasanjav

texts.en:
Mrs. Baasanjav T. is 42 years old and married with four children. Her eldest daughter, Uranbaigal, 19, is married and lives separately. 

Mrs. Baasanjav’s family owns a piece of land and a wooden house in a suburb of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been renting a stall in Bumbugur, the second largest indoor market in the city, and has been running a clothing retail sales business since 2008. She buys the clothes from wholesalers who brings them from China and resells them.
 
Mrs. Baasanjav’s husband, Gankhuyag, 44, works part time as a taxi driver and rest of the time he helps in her wife’s business. The couple’s main goal is to provide a good education for their children. 

The reason Mrs. Baasanjav is requesting a loan is that Mongolians are expecting to celebrate the lunar new year in February, 2011, and she is planning to stock up on goods before the shopping spree starts.

loans.use: To stock up on goods before the Mongolian new year and the shopping spree starts

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Wobulenzi in the Luweero region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. Lydia has a business selling clothes, which she has run for less than a year.
To help expand her business, Lydia has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase clothes. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Lydia hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, she hopes to own a retail shop. Lydia is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to save.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for resale

loans.name: Mapatano Group

texts.fr: Baeni N. est entrepreneur, présidente du groupe Mapatano, âgée de 40 ans mariée, mère de 8 enfants.  Son conjoint est Enseignant. Elle fait le petit commerce de vente de divers  dans un kiosque à son domicile. Elle  commença son business  avec son fonds propre par une activité de vente de farine de manioc, maïs, braise. Plus tard, elle bénéficia de crédit de l’IMF  Hekima de 50$ en 2008. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec  des nouveaux articles (sucres, sel de cuisine, savons, bombons, allumettes, biscuits, souliers, habits,  Fanta,  etc.) pour augmenter le stock en volume et en valeurs.  En plus, elle ambitionne devenir commerçante grossiste et s’approvisionner dans le grand centre à l’étranger, à Kampala. La cliente Baeni N. remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique. Le groupe Mapatano est constitué de 35 membres.
texts.en: Baeni N. is an entrepreneur and chairs Mapatano Group. She is 40 years old, married and the mother of eight children. Her husband is a teacher. She runs a small business selling various articles in a vending booth at her home. She began her business with her own funds, selling cassava flour, corn and charcoal. Some time later, in 2008, she benefitted from a loan of $50 granted by the microfinance institution Hekima. This new loan will allow her to stock up with new articles (sugar, kitchen salt, soap, sweets, matches, cookies, shoes, clothes, soft drinks, etc.) to increase her inventory in quantity and in value. In addition, she aims to become a wholesaler and buy her articles in Kampala, the great commercial center abroad. The customer Baeni N. thanks Hekima for its support of poor people excluded from the traditional banking system. Mapatano Group consists of 35 members.

loans.use: To buy sugar, kitchen salt, soap, sweets, matches, cookies, shoes, clothes, soft drinks, etc.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline C. is from the village of Taguilon. She is 47 years old. Evangeline is married and has three school aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a fishing boat. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately $100 a month for these activities.

In 2007, Evangeline joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. 

Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials for fishing boat repair. This will be her 2nd loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in north-western Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials for fishing boat repair

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal and food for resale

loans.name: Perlito

texts.en:
Perlito M. is from the village of Quiling. He is 54 years old. Perlito is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, he plants and harvests rice for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over twenty-nine years and earns approximately 8000 Php a month for these activities.

In 2010, Perlito joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 24,000 PHP, which will be used to pay for services to increase his crop yield. This will be his 1st loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.
