loans.name: C7774 Urugero Group

texts.en:
Innocent is 26 years old and single. He is the president of a group called “Urugero”, which means "Setting a good example" in English.  Each member has their own business selling bananas.  He has five years of experience in this business, which he operates from 7am until 6pm every day.

Innocent has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to buy more bananas to sell at the market. With this expansion, he really hopes that the earned profits will increase and he will be able to satisfy the demand of his customers. In addition, each member of the group will start saving and be able to satisfy the basic needs of his/her family.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantity of bananas to resell.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro G. is from the village of Bacolod, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. He is 38 years old. Pedro is married and has three school-aged children and one infant child. To make a living, Pedro operates a motor cab and he also operates a sari-sari (variety) store. Pedro has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately $150 a month for this activity.

In 2010, Pedro joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional grocery stock. This will be his 2nd loan from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

 About PMPC:

 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for his variety store

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is a thirty-eight-year-old single mother of four children, living in her own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is charged with the responsibility of providing the basics for her family, and her goal is to educate her children up to the university level. 

She is a poultry farmer and has been in this kind of business for six years, which has enabled her to generate a minimum of income for the family. Her desire is to have at least three thousand birds. Charity needs the loan to buy chicken feed.

loans.use: Purchasing chicken feed.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia B., is from the barangay (village) of Bacolod, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 53 years old. Amalia is a widow and has seven adult-aged children. To make a living Amalia has been working as an OFW (overseas Filipino worker) for over fifteen years and earns approximately $538 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Amalia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used for placement fees for her son. This will be her 1st loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her work to improve the general living conditions of her family.

 About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For placement fees for her son

loans.name: Mason  Eboyi

texts.en:
Mason Eboyi B. is 40 years old, married and the father of four beautiful children. He and his family live in Kisumu Ndogo in the outskirts of Kitale.

He sells charcoal as well as fast moving food items like sugar, rice, cooking fat, etc. He has been in this business for four years and he gets a monthly income of KES 7,000.

This will be Mason's first loan from  KADET Ltd., and he plans to use the money to buy rice worth KES 10,000, charcoal worth KES. 4,000, one box of cooking fat worth KES. 1,000 and one bag of sugar worth KES 5,000, among other things. 

He plans to use the income that he will get to buy a motorcycle that he can use to transport his shop items faster. In the future, he wants to buy a plot of land where he can build his own home and also expand his business.

loans.use: To add stock  like charcoal and cereals  for resale

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver N. is 17 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Oliver has a business selling drinks, which she has run for one year.
To help expand her business, Oliver has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more drinks. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Oliver hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, she hopes to expand her business further. Oliver is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to do business.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks for resale

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence N. is 18 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is married and has two children.    Florence has a business selling food, which she has run for a year.         
To help expand her business, Florence has requested a loan of 150,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase   food. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Florence hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, she hopes to own a sewing machine. Florence is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to work hard and make new friends.

loans.use: To purchase food for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more shoes for her husband's shop

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine K. is 35 years old and married to Samuel Kiplagat, who sells charcoal. They have two children. 

She practices farming as a primary business and also she walks around and sells home products such as basins, water jugs, buckets, etc. She has been in this business for three years and right now her monthly income is KES 3,000.

She is borrowing a first loan of KES 5,000 from KADET Ltd., which she will use to increase her home products for sale. She plans to use the anticipated profit to expand the business. She hopes to grow her business and in the future, to purchase a plot of land and develop it.

loans.use: To add more home products stock

loans.name: Charo Mngwani

texts.en: Charo Mngwari M. is 64 years old. He is married to Dama and together they have five children. Charo has been a livestock trader for the last two years. This marks his second loan from KADET LTD and he intends to use it to purchase more goats to rear and sell later at a profit. He has never borrowed from any other MFI. Charo intends to expand the business from the anticipated profits. His hope and dream is to succeed through KADET.

loans.use: to purchase more goats

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy different kinds of thread and cloth.

loans.name: Chen

texts.en: Sewing clothes is the main part of 52-year-old Chen S.'s daily routine. Chen S. provides her service to her neighbors: sewing both traditional clothes and modern clothes. She runs her business very well and a lot of customers recognize the good service she provides. Chen S. is married to Kosal, 30, a government official, and they have only one child who is still living under their care. Chen S.’s husband has been paying for taxis to get to work because he doesn't own a vehicle. To solve this problem, Chen S. is applying for a loan for her husband to purchase a used motorcycle in order to ride to work.

loans.use: To purchase a used motorcycle.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John K., 32 years old, is married to Daisy Kabon, a housewife, and they have two children. John has been practicing livestock keeping for three years and his current monthly income is KES 8,000.

John is borrowing KES 5,000. He plans to use this loan to open a shop in his location. He plans to invest the anticipated profit back into the business for it to expand. This is his first loan from KADET LTD, and he has never borrowed from any other MFI. In the future, John hopes to purchase a plot, build rental houses and educate his children.

loans.use: To open a shop

loans.name: Nov

texts.en: Nov P. has been in the farming business for years. She grows various crops to earn a living and typically generates an income of $2 per day. Her husband earns a living by providing battery charging services to his neighbors and villagers in the province of Kompong Tom. This couple has been married for years and has only one child, who is attending in school. Nov P. wishes to open a small shop in order to sell a few products for additional income. Because her savings account is not enough to start this new business, Nov P. would like to request a loan to buy some items, such as food, soft drinks, sweets, and other necessary products, to sell.

loans.use: To buy some items, such as food, soft drinks, and sweets, for selling.

loans.name: Safia's Group

texts.en:
Safia lives in Gujranwala, a mid-sized city in Pakistan, known for its rice industry. She lives with her family in the area of Sabri chowk in a 2-room brick house. She moved here 22 years ago. Safia is married to M. A., 42 years old, who is involved in a construction supplies sales business in the market. Safia is the mother of 3 sons and a daughter. Her elder son works with his father in his construction supplies business and the other children attend a local school.

Safia supports her family financially by making artificial flowers. She supplies these flowers to different gift shops and also sells decoration pieces. She has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy construction supplies, such as cement, bricks and sand, in bulk and increase his sales. He has been operating this business for the past 15 years and Safia is hopeful that an investment will bring positive changes to it. Safia is a regular lender with Asasah and this is her 4th loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed a meeting. Note: In the photo, Safia is holding a book (called the Asasah passbook).

loans.use: to buy construction supplies

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 25-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with one parent and four siblings. He stopped his education and decided to start a new career by working in a car repair garage for 13 years, to help his family with the income. This young experienced man was able to open his own garage five years ago and executed his individual business. He has obtained his first Kiva loan and he was an excellent client with punctual payments. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to renew his garage’s tools to make his work faster and provide his customers with better services.

loans.use: To renew his garage’s tools

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 41-year-old married man. He lives with his wife and four school-age children. He is from Lebanon. He worked in a bakery and a butcher shop at the same time for 10 years to satisfy his family’s income.  After gaining the needed experience in the same occupation, he opened his own bakery/butcher shop in 2004. His oldest child helps him occasionally in his work. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase mandatory machinery for his butchery work and complete his shop’s decoration and paintings.

loans.use: To purchase mandatory machinery for his butchery work

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 32-year-old single woman living with one parent and four siblings. She is from Lebanon. She has worked in the agriculture field for 10 years. In 2007, in cooperation with her father she bought her own land and started to produce vegetables and sell them in her town and surroundings.  

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase required machinery and tools for her business to increase her productivity, sales and profits.

loans.use: To purchase required machinery and tools for her business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 53-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and six young children who are still attending school. He has worked as a private taxi driver for more than five years. Because of his old age, some of his children must replace him from time to time in the client’s transportation business to maintain the family in a reasonable financial state.     

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to make the necessary repairs on the car and do some painting so that he can serve his customers in an appropriate means of transportation.

loans.use: To make the necessary repairs on the car and do some painting

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en:
Zarina, who is married and has two children, started working as a market vendor 8 years ago and today runs her own business selling candies and sweets. After the economic crisis reached Tajikistan, purchasing prices rose so Zarina needed a loan to maintain her inventory. She has established a reputation as an entrepreneur of integrity, having repaid every loan received from IMON International without any defaults. This time, Zarina is asking to borrow 10 000 TJS to purchase candies and sweets wholesale. An increase in sales will help her generate more profit and develop her trade even more.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase candies and sweets wholesale

loans.name: Irine Jepkemoi

texts.en:
Irine Jeokemoi C. is newly married to Peter Kipkorir Meli, 36 years old and a primary school teacher. Irine owns a poultry farm where she rears broilers for sale at maturity.  She has been running this business for 13 years and is really doing well as she earns a monthly profit of KES 25,000.
  
Irine has borrowed her first loan of KES 50,000 from KADET LTD. She wishes to use 25,000 KES to buy 1-day-old chicks, KES 10,000 for feed and KES 15,000 for vaccines and drugs. She will save the profits she gets from the sales, hoping to expand her poultry farming to one where she can rear at least 1,000 broilers.

loans.use: to purchase chicks, poultry feed, vaccines and drugs

loans.name: Abdulaziz

texts.en:
Abdulaziz is married and has 4 children. He owns a small 24-hour grocery store. Abdulaziz has been in this business for 3 years since a friend of his suggested he get involved in it and become a partner. Abdulaziz understands his clients' needs well and adjusts his stock accordingly. He would like to get a seasonal loan of 7,000 TJS  to purchase more goods. He hopes to increase his sales and offer more product variety to his clients.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase more foodstuffs to increase his range of goods

loans.name: Ismatullo

texts.en:
For the past 12 years, Ismatullo has sold flour and oil in the central market of Isfara, Northern Tajikistan. A married father of three, Ismatullo is determined to provide a better living for his entire family. Ismatullo is hardworking and persistent, giving him the ideal blend of entrepreneurial determination and service. Skilled in trade and abounding in character, Ismatullo has both a strong business base and a perfect credit history with IMON international. Currently he is seeking a loan to purchase more wholesale products and expand his business. With the increased income, Ismatullo plans to continue enlarging his business and improving his family's financial situation.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase more foodstuffs to increase his range of goods

loans.name: Laon Ole

texts.en:
Laon Ole L. is 43 years old. He is married to two wives and the father of eight children. L. has been farming for the last fifteen years. His farm is in a productive area which has proved to be good for livestock farming.

Laon learned about KADET LTD through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his second loan, which he is planning to use to buy twenty goats for fattening, which normally do well in his area due to good climatic conditions. Laon hopes to use the profit from this loan to build a new house and educate his children. His hope and dream is to buy and build rental premises. L. is a young and energetic man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy 20 goats for fattening

loans.name: Anorkhon

texts.en:
For the past 15 years, Anorkhon has sold women’s clothes. A married mother with two children, she is determined to provide a better living for her entire family. Anorkhon is hardworking and kind, giving her the ideal blend of entrepreneurial determination and service. Skilled in trade and abounding in character, Anorkhon has a strong business base. Currently, she is seeking a loan of 6,000 TJS to purchase a new vending facility and expand her business. With the increased income, Anorkhon plans to continue enlarging her business and improving her family's financial situation.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to increase her working capital in order to develop her business

loans.name: Kameri Ole

texts.en:
Kameri Ole Npuumei is 42 years old, married to Ndama and blessed with seven children. Kameri has been farming for the last 23 years. His farm is in a productive area which has proved to be good for maize farming.

Kameri learned about KADET LTD through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his second loan, which he is planning to use to buy maize seeds and fertilizers for the planting season. Kameri hopes to use the profit from this loan to educate his children and to acquire more land for farming to increase his maize production. In the future, he plans to practice large scale farming, buy land and build a permanent home. Kameri is a rigorous man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Sarvarkhon

texts.en:
Sarvarkhon is a widow and mother who lives in the town of Isfara, where she operates a typical small business selling women's clothing in the local market. She's been in this field for 20 years and has gained much experience working with clients and handling business-related challenges. She is applying for a loan for 11,000 Somoni to buy additional merchandise to sell to her customers. She is hoping to buy it wholesale and make a good profit when she sells it retail. Sarvarkhon is an entrepreneur who is constantly developing and growing as she experiments and introduces new and trendy clothing. Her customers always leave her kiosk pleased with their purchases, and we are hoping to see her continue to thrive and succeed in her business endeavors.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being the home of a key post along the Silk Road and the place where the rule of Alexander the Great ended. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, Western culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous and only seven percent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients have viable business propositions. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy more products to sell to her cusotmers.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en:
V. Mahbuba is 51 years old, married and has eight children. Her husband is a teacher, and the couple is committed to ensuring that its children have everything they need. For the last 16 years, Mahbuba has made a living selling fabrics used in the making of her country's national dresses, which are an important item in the dowry of any young woman. She is known for providing outstanding service and selling well-made, carefully-chosen merchandise at good prices. She buys her fabrics in the neighboring city Khujand, where she regularly searches for items that meet her customers' needs. She is applying for a loan to expand her business because her children are growing up and her expenses are rising. She plans to use this loan for TJS 13,000 to buy more items to sell, and thanks Kiva lenders for their generous support. She promises to repay the loan on time.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being the home of a key post along the Silk Road and the place where the rule of Alexander the Great ended. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy more fabrics to sell to her customers

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina K. is married, has two children and went to school through junior high school. She makes a living preparing and selling palm oil, and also works as a seamstress in the town of Abrafo near Abura. She has been a seamstress for a decade, and during that time her husband has worked as a security officer. Georgina uses her income to support her family, including paying for school fees, books and uniforms. She is applying for a loan to buy more palm fruits to turn into oil and to buy more of the materials she needs to work as a seamstress. She plans to use the income made possible by this loan to expand her two small businesses and further the education of her children.

loans.use: To expand two small businesses

loans.name: Dama Masha

texts.en:
Dama Masha B. is a 55 year-old lady from Mtwapa. She is married to Dio Dzombo and together they are blessed with three children. Her husband is a business man who owns a retail shop. 

Dama is a charcoal dealer and she has been in this business for the last three years. This being her first loan from KADET, she intends to purchase more sacks of charcoal for sale. 

The anticipated profits will be reinvested into the business. Dama’s hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop.

loans.use: purchase sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson S. is 51 years old. He is married to Ruth S. and blessed with eight children. He has had a mixed farm for the last twenty years. His farm is in a productive area which has proved to be good for mixed farming.

He learned about KADET LTD through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area. This will be his second loan with which he is planning to buy farm supplies. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to educate his grand children.

His hope and dream is to educate his children and re-invest in the farm. Wilson is a conscientious man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 29-year-old single man. He is from Lebanon. He lives with his parents and three siblings. He has specialized in cultivating vegetables for 12 years. In 2000, he bought his own land and proceeded with his business operation by cultivating his land and selling vegetables to people from his community.  He cooperates with his parents in the family’s income.

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to implement an irrigation canal for his land to provide the needed water for his cultivated vegetables to make his productivity faster and bigger.

loans.use: To implement an irrigation canal for his land

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 54-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and four school-age children. He worked as a car painter agent for 20 years and opened his own car painting shop in 1998. He is the only income provider in his family.

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a painting compressor for the cars to facilitate his work and make it more profitable by increasing the number of cars that he can paint.

loans.use: To purchase a compressor

loans.name: Kipailoi Ole

texts.en:
Kipailoi Ole N. is 37 Years old. He is  married to Nasieku N. and is the father of four children. Kipailoi is a farmer who has farmed his own piece of land for the last eighteen years.

He learned about KADET LTD from other members in a group already registered with KADET in his area. This will be his third loan which he is planning to spend on preparing his land to plant maize. Maize has been doing well in the area due to good climatic conditions.

He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small scale to commercial farming. Kipailoi's dream is do large-scale farming and build a rental store. He is a hard-working man who is determined to achieve his goals.

loans.use: to prepare land for maize planting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To renew his computers and perform maintenance for the shop

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 40-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and two children, who are attending school. He owns a car repair shop and he specializes in rebuilding engines. He is the only source of income for his family. He obtained his first Kiva loan and was very satisfied with the results.

Today, he is requesting a loan of $1500 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to complete his work and buy required tools so that he can increase his income.

loans.use: To buy tools

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 35-year-old married man living with his wife and one child in Lebanon. He has 13 years of experience in the concrete field. In 1999, he started to work as a freelance concrete carpenter. He provides the only financial support for his family. He previously obtained his first Kiva loan and was a very good client with prompt payments.

Today, he is requesting a loan of $1000 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase some wood for his projects to make them stronger and well-built.

loans.use: To purchase some wood

loans.name: Sergei

texts.en:
Sergei is married and has two sons, both of whom are in college. He is a farmer and entrepreneur who lives in the town of Vodyanoye, where he grows early spring vegetables. He owns six big greenhouses where he has planted 12,000 large tomato plants. He has been a farmer for the last 17 years and has invested about 140,000 Grivnyas in this business. He also spends about 30,000 Grivnyas a year on seeds and other equipment

Sergei is seeking a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to build a new greenhouse. His goal is to expand his business and get his seedlings in the ground early, thereby ensuring a good and timely harvest and a stable income for his family. He works hard and hopes to make enough money to put his sons through college.

loans.use: to build a new greenhouse

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is a widow who lives in the town of Berdichev with her 17-year-old daughter Anna. She makes a living selling women’s lingerie, hats, scarves and gloves in her town's busy central market. She is known for being friendly to her customers and very good at choosing the items that work best for each of them, which is why people keep coming back for new items. She has invested about 50,000 Grivnyas in her business since starting it many years ago.  

Irina is applying for a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to buy more items to sell to her customers, especially a wider assortment of winter items such as gloves and hats. She believes this will be a very good way to increase her revenue and earn a larger income for herself and her daughter. In time, she hopes to open a second location for her store.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 20-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents and two siblings. He's been working in agriculture for seven years. In 2008, he bought his own land and started to produce vegetables to sell in his town and neighboring villages. He works with his brothers to bring in the family’s income. 

Today, he is requesting a loan of $1200 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase some pesticides and seeds so he can increase his productivity and make his work faster.

loans.use: To purchase some pesticide and grains

loans.name: Vasyl

texts.en:
Vasyl is a married small businessman from Ivano-Frankivsk who has been offering taxi services in his home town and beyond for the past seven years. His monthly income is 6,000 Grivnyas. Vasyl sold vehicles before he started this enterprise.

Vasyl is requesting a loan of 7,000 Grivnyas to purchase new winter tires and an accumulator unit, as well as to repair the running gear of his vehicle. Two of his goals are to pay off his car loan and buy all necessary furniture and appliances for his apartment.

loans.use: To purchase new winter tires and an accumulator unit and repair running gear of his vehicle

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 39-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and five school-age children. He started his career by selling car spare parts from his house 20 years ago. He works hard day after day to provide a good income for his family. He has obtained three Kiva loans and he was an excellent client with on time payments. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to improve his business so he can increase his sales and therefore his profitability.

loans.use: To improve his business

loans.name: Nadiya

texts.en:
The married mother of a 12-year-old son named Mikhailo, Nadiya runs a clothing sales business in her home town of Ivano-Frankivsk, Western Ukraine. In the trade for 17 years, Nadiya sells women’s clothing in one of the locals malls called ‘Malva Plus’. She launched this venture right after she finished school, and her business has grown considerably since then. Presently, she has one employee working for her.

Nadiya’s business is the main source of income for her and her family. Currently, she is seeking a loan of 20,000 Grivnyas to purchase assorted seasonal merchandise, i.e. women’s warm winter pants. She is hoping to continue expanding her business and open a new vending location in the near future. One of her personal goals is to give her son a chance to get a good college education.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Tabitha  Wanja

texts.en:
Tabitha Wanja M. is a 48-year-old lady, married to Philip, and they have one child. Tabitha has owned a catering business  for the last ten years. 

This is her second loan from KADET, and she plans to use it to purchase an electric generator which is essential for the business.

She will spend the anticipated profits on her child’s education. Her dream for the future is to open a hotel.

loans.use: purchase an electric generator

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more chicken mash

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To renew his electric tools

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
An entrepreneur from Ivano-Frankivsk, Oksana is the married mother of a teenage daughter. For the past ten years, Oksana has been selling women’s clothing in one of the local malls. She has a hired salesperson to work for her.

Oksana is requesting a 20,000 Grivnya loan to diversify seasonal merchandise, i.e. purchase additional winter pants and sweaters for women. She is very close to her family, working hard to ensure a decent living for them. Her mom underwent a very complicated heart surgery recently, and Oksana covered all of her medical expenses. Oksana is planning to open an additional vending location in the future and wants to ensure higher education for her daughter, who is going to college this year.

loans.use: To purchase winter merchandise

loans.name: Ibtesam

texts.en:
Ibtesam is a 44-year-old wife and mother of two daughters and two sons. She is married to Maher who is retired now from the Palestinian National Authority.

Ibtesam added a new room to their house. When building the room was over, she needed to do the painting and installing tiles. The cost of the final touches was covered by a loan taken from FATEN.

Ibtesam's husband appears in the picture here instead of her since she is a conservative woman, as are most Gaza citizens, and not comfortable with her picture published online.

loans.use: To complete the final touches of a new room added to the house

loans.name: Kuntai Ole

texts.en:
Kuntai Ole Y. is 33 years old. He is married to Joyce and blessed with three children. Kuntai has been farming for the last five years. His farm is in a productive area which has proved to be good for maize farming.

Kuntai learned about KADET LTD through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his second loan, which he is planning to use to buy maize seeds and fertilizers. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to educate his children and to acquire more land for farming to increase his maize production. Kuntai's hopes and dreams are to become a large scale farmer, to buy a bigger piece of land and to build a permanent home. Kuntai is a meticulous man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Dmytro

texts.en:
Dmytro, who is single, lives and works in Ivano-Frankivsk. For the past 2 years, he has owned a store called ‘Auto Skhid’ (Auto East), selling spare car parts, in downtown Ivano-Frankivsk. There are basically no competitors in this neighborhood, which promotes the growth and expansion of Dmytro’s business. His monthly income amounts to 8,000 UAH.

Dmytro’s vehicle parts sales business is his main source of income. Dmytro is requesting a loan of 20,000 UAH to purchase additional spare parts for vehicles manufactured in Korea and China. One of his big dreams is to accumulate enough savings to be able to buy his own housing in the future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for Korean and Chinese vehicles

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 42-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and two young children who are attending school. He worked as a furniture painter for 10 years and in 2008, he opened his own furniture painting shop.  He cooperates with his wife who works as a teacher in a local school to satisfy the family’s needs. He has obtained his first Kiva loan and he was a very good client with prompt payments.

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase his inventory by getting additional products to attract more customers by offering them a larger variety of designs and paintings.

loans.use: To increase his inventory

loans.name: Daniel  Mwangi

texts.en: Daniel Mwangi N., 24 years old, is single and he supports his two younger brothers. He has been running a retail shop for the last two years. Daniel has never borrowed from any other MFI. This marks his second loan from KADET and he plans to use it to expand his business. The anticipated profits have been directed to his brother’s education. Daniel's dream is to succeed through KADET.

loans.use: to expand his business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 34-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and four school-age children. He has owned a perfume and accessories shop since 1995. He cooperates with his wife who works in a clothing store to keep the family’s financial status at a good stage. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional products to improve his business by increasing his sales and therefore his income.

loans.use: To purchase additional products

loans.name: Kimperly Kanini

texts.en: Kimperly Kanini M. is a 28-year-old woman from Mnarani. She supports her sister. Kimperly has been operating an M-pesa (mobile-phone based money transfer service) outlet in Mnarani for the last year. This marks her first loan from KADET LTD and she plans to use it to purchase more float for sale. Kimperly will use the anticipated profits to expand her business. She hopes to succeed through KADET.

loans.use: to purchase more float for her money transfer service outlet

loans.name: Joseph Maina

texts.en: Joseph has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the last 23 years. He is married to Lydia Waithira and they have two children. Joseph was introduced to KADET LTD  by his friend and this will be his third loan. He repaid all his previous loans well and in good time. Joseph plans to use this loan to prepare his land for the planting season. In the future, Joseph hopes to practice onion farming on a large scale.

loans.use: to prepare his land for the planting season

loans.name: C7575 Coparimiga Group

texts.en:
Theresie, 36 years old, is married and has 7 children between 4 and 15 years old. She also cares for 3 relatives. Theresie and her husband are both farmers but he breeds many varieties of animals.  Theresie is the president of a group called “Coparimiga” whose members are all farmers working within the agricultural business. Theresie has had 13 successful years in this business and employs 80 people to help her.

Theresie has requested a loan to pay her farmers' salaries, buy fertilizer and employ new staff. With this expansion, she hopes to earn more profits and will use this money to buy land to farm.

loans.use: to pay her farmers' salaries, buy fertilizer and employ new staff

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 20-year-old single woman from Lebanon. She lives with her parents and three siblings. She has owned a small beauty salon since 2006. Because of her good business reputation, she is able to have loyal customers who are very satisfied with her work. She has obtained her first Kiva loan and she was a very good client. She cooperates with her father in the family’s income. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1,500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to improve her business so she will be able to welcome her customers in a proper salon.

loans.use: To improve her business

loans.name: Joseph Kipkemoi

texts.en:
Joseph Kipkemoi A. is 62 years old. He is married to Esther Koskei and blessed with nine children. Joseph has been practicing mixed farming for the last twenty years. His farm is in a productive area which has proved to be good for mixed farming.

Joseph learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his second loan, which he is planning to use to buy farm supplies. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to educate his grandchildren. His hope and dream is to educate his grandchildren. Joseph is a scrupulous man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies

loans.name: Risa Ole

texts.en:
Risa Ole M. is 24 years old. He is married to Melua M. and blessed with four children. Risa has been farming for the last three years. He learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his second loan, which he is planning to use to buy maize seeds and fertilizers. 

Risa hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming to increase his wheat production and to educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to become a large scale farmer, to buy a bigger piece of land and to build a permanent home. Risa is a scrupulous man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 21-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents. He works as a private teacher from his house and from time to time, he teaches his students in their own houses. He has obtained his first Kiva loan and it showed very good results. He is specialized in science, third year. Despite his young age, he has to work hard to help his father with the family’s income and be able to handle his university expenses.

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to pay his university fees and pursue his education without having any financial issues.

loans.use: To pay his university fees

loans.name: Julio Daniel

texts.es:
Julio Daniel C. M. tiene 28 años, vive en Unión Libre con su esposa en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 3 hijos de diferentes edades. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. TIERRA NUESTRA se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Luís de Zapotal pertenece al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla de 14 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra de maíz, arroz.

Julio Daniel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, cacao, soya y arroz. Compra sus productos en  Ecua - Agro y vende en el mismo lugar.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, y arroz, compra de insumos y semillas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es que sus hijos estudien y esten bien

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Julio Daniel C. M. is 28 years old.  He lives with his common-law wife in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.  He has three children.

The 'Tierra Nuestra' (Our Land) community bank is located in San Luís de Zapotal district, in Ventanas canton.  The bank has 14 members who work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice.

Julio Daniel grows corn, cacao, soya and rice.  He buys his products in Ecua - Agro and sells in the same place.  He is requesting this loan to grown corn and rice, to buy supplies and seeds.  The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs.  He faces challenges such as insect infestations, diseases and changes in the weather.  His dream is for his children to study and for them to be all right.

Julio Daniel likes taking part in sports.

loans.use: To buy supplies and seeds

loans.name: John Gitonga

texts.en: John Gitonga K. is a 30-year-old man from Bamburi. He has been in the transport business for the last two years. This marks his second loan from KADET, and he plans to use it to repair his vehicle. The anticipated profits will be directed into the expansion of his clothing business. His dream is to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle

loans.name: Twezimbe Kayabwe Development Group-Mpigi

texts.en:
32-year-old Dan K. is happily married with one child. He belongs to the Twezimbe Kayabwe Development Group-Mpigi.

Dan has been running his barbershop for the last five years in Kayabwe-Mpigi. He also does some farming. Dan says he opened his barbershop immediately after he finished school. He says hard work and determination have gotten him this far. His business generates 100,000 UGX weekly.

With this loan, Dan says he is going to buy a generator.

loans.use: To purchase a generator

loans.name: Kaze Group

texts.fr:
Vincent M. est un commerçant âgé de 30 ans qui habite la Commune  urbaine de Kanyosha en Mairie de Bujumbura. Il fait le commerce des produits de boutique depuis 10ans. Il a fréquenté l’école primaire. Il est marié et père de 3enfants et ne vit pas avec les autres membres de sa famille ; sa femme et ses enfants résidant actuellement dans sa région natale en Commune Mubimbi de la Province de Bujumbura Rural. Il arrive au 4e cycle dans le crédit Communautaire avec Turame. 

Il demande le crédit Kiva pour  accroitre son capital  en achetant de grandes quantités de  boutique à revendre aux clients et ainsi pouvoir accroitre ses économies. Il compte aussi diversifier ses produits en y ajoutant les produits de première nécessite comme les fruits, les legumes, etc. Il espère qu’avec les économies réalisées avec ce credit, il pourra arriver au niveau élevé dans son métier de commerçant

Il  est membre  du groupe  communautaire« Kaze».
texts.en:
Vincent M. is a 30-year old merchant who lives in the urban community of Kanyosha, of the Bujumbura municipality. He has had his general store for 10 years. He has a primary education. He is married and he is the father of 3 children, although he does not live with them. His wife and children live in their hometown of Mubimbi in the Bujumbura Rural province. He is on his fourth loan cycle with Turame (Kiva Field Partner). 

He requests a loan from Kiva to supplement his capital funds. He plans to purchase large quantities of general merchandise to resell to his clientele with the goal of improving his income. He also endeavors to add variety to his products by including products of primary needs, such as fruit, vegetables, etc. He hopes that with the profits generated with this loan, he will be able to become a higher level merchant.

He is a member of the communal bank named "Kaze".

loans.use: To use as working capital.

loans.name: C7850 Duteraninkunga Group

texts.en:
Venant is the leader of a group called called 'Duteraninkunga'.  He is pictured above sitting in the first row on the right-hand side. The group contains fourteen members: eight women and six men. 

Venant is 36 years old, is married with four children aged between 3 and 7 years old. He also cares for four relatives. He farms rice and he employs four people on his farm. This is his eighth year growing rice.

With this loan, Venant will buy more equipment for his farm.  Any profit from the use of the loan will allow him to save money for the future and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more equipment for his farm

loans.name: Abraham

texts.es: Abraham, de 35 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Dina (33)  y sus tres pequeños hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida.Los campos de cultivo han sido en la vida de Abraham, una actividad necesaria para vivir, ya que desde muy pequeño sus padres siempre le enseñaron a trabajar en la chacra, es por eso que decidió continuar con esta labor familiar y ahora tiene sus propios cultivos, donde sembró café y plátano, los cuales una vez cosechados llevara a vender al mercado de la ciudad de Pichanaki. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar, ya que sabe que de esta actividad depende la tranquilidad de su familia, lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de los cambios bruscos del clima, pues eso afecta mucho su productividad. Para más adelante, desea seguir trabajando duro y mejorando sus cultivos.Es el segundo  préstamo que tiene con MFP, sabe que el dinero del crédito será muy beneficioso en el desarrollo de su actividad. En su banco comunal es un socio muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy respetado.Abraham tiene planeado invertir  los seiscientos soles solicitados, en la compra de abono e insecticidas que necesita para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Abraham is 35 years old.  He is a very simple and hard-working man who lives in his own home with his wife, 33 year-old Dina, and his three young children, for whom he would like to provide a better quality of life.

Farming has been a necessary activity in Abraham's life in order for him to survive.  His parents taught him to work on the farm when he was very young.  He decided to continue in his family's line of work and now he has his own crops.  He grows coffee and bananas which, once harvested, he takes to sell at market in the town of Pichanaki.

What Abraham most likes about his work is sowing his crops since he knows that his family's well-being depends on this activity.  He has been in this business for 15 years and he considers the most difficult part of his work to be protecting his crops from sharp changes in the weather since this can really affect his productivity.  In the future, Abraham would like to continue working hard and improve his crops.

This is Abraham's second loan from MFP and he knows that the loan money will be very useful to him in carrying out his business.  He is a very responsible member of his community bank which means that he is also a well-respected member.  Abraham plans to invest the 600 Peruvian soles he is requesting in buying manure and insecticides which he needs to improve his crops.

loans.use: To buy manure and insecticides to improve his crops

loans.name: Akeza Group

texts.fr:
Aline Marie N. est une commerçante âgée de 32 ans qui habite la Commune  urbaine de Kanyosha en Mairie de Bujumbura. Elle fait le business de salon de coiffure pour dames depuis 6ans. Elle a fait ses études jusqu’au niveau de l’école primaire. Elle est mariée et mère de 5enfants. Elle arrivait au 4e cycle dans le crédit Communautaire avec Turame mais elle a été éligible au crédit solidaire. 

Elle demande le crédit Kiva pour  accroitre son capital  en achetant des equipements pour son salon de beauté et ainsi pouvoir accroitre ses économies. Elle espère qu’avec les économies réalisées avec ce credit, elle pourra avoir un grand capital et ainsi son business atteindre un haut niveau de performance

Elle est  une des membres  du groupe  solidaire« Akeza».
texts.en:
Aline Marie N. is a 32-year old merchant who lives in the urban community of Kanyosha, located in the municipality of Bujumbura. She has had a ladies' beauty salon for the past 6 years. She has a primary school education. She is married and she is the mother of 5 children. She is on her fourth loan cycle with Turame (Kiva Field Partner) but she was eligible to have an independent loan.

She requests a Kiva loan to supplement her capital funds. Her goal is to purchase equipment for her beauty salon and to improve her income. She hopes that with the profits generated with this loan, she will be able to accumulate larger capital funds and expand her business.

She is a member of the communal bank named "Akeza".

loans.use: To purchase beauty salon equipment.

loans.name: Albina

texts.es: Albina, de 38 años, es una madre de familia muy laboriosa y responsable, vive en la casa de sus suegros junto a su esposo Tito (39) y sus dos pequeños hijos.Son 16 horas las que Albina pasa dentro de su tienda, ya que abre a las seis de la mañana y atiende todo el día de corrido hasta aproximadamente las 10 de la noche, su bodega esta ubicada frente a un colegio de la comunidad de Yurinaki (Comunidad  del distrito de Pichanaki) y es muy concurrida por los alumnos del plantel, como también por los profesores, a quienes además brinda el servicio de pensión. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y enterarse de las cosas que suceden en la comunidad, ya lleva cuatro  años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda, sin poder salir a la calle. Con el tiempo, espera que su negocio crezca y le pueda brindar mejores ingresos económicos.Es su  sexto préstamo con MFP, y esta dispuesta a trabajar muy duro para pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, en su banco comunal es muy respetada por la puntualidad que demuestra.Albina tiene planeado invertir los  quinientos soles solicitados, en la compra de mayor cantidad de  productos que necesita para implementar mejor el stock de su tienda, de esta manera espera alcanzar el progreso.
texts.en:
Albina is 38 years old and she is a very hard working and responsible mother. She lives with her in-laws, together with her husband, Tito (39), and they two young children. Albina operates her store 16 hours every day, starting at 6 in the morning and closing at 10pm. 

Her grocery store is located in front of a school in the community of Yurinaki (a community in the district of Pichanaki), and it is patronized often by the students and teachers. She also offers pension services to them. What she most enjoys about her work is chatting with her clients and to keep up with the community news. She has four years in the business. The most difficult part of the job is to remain in the store all day, without getting a chance to go out.

In time she hopes to expand her business in order to improve her income. This is her sixth loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she is ready to work very hard to make her loan payments on time. She is a well respected member of her communal bank for the responsibility she demonstrates. 

Albina plans on investing the requested five hundred soles in the purchase of a large quantity of products that she needs to supply her store. This way she will be able to progress in her business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to supply her store.

loans.name: Alex

texts.es: Alex, de 21 años, es un joven muy alegre y trabajador, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida.Los años le han enseñado a este laborioso hombre  que el trabajo bien realizado brinda sus recompensa, es por eso que todos los días  desde muy temprano trabaja en sus chacras, para volverlas más productivas. Sus productos naturales los lleva a vender en las cooperativas de Pichanaki y los productores  le ofrecen un muy buen precio por su café. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus plantaciones de café, ya que es el producto que le genera su principal ingreso, lleva cinco años realizando esta actividad  y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus tierras. Para más adelante tiene planeado comprar nuevas tierras para ampliar sus plantaciones.Este es el primer préstamo con MFP, y  siente que este crédito le ayudara mucho en el desarrollo de su actividad, además en  su banco comunal es un socio, muy responsable, por  lo cual se siente muy orgulloso.Alex tiene planeado invertir  los quinientos soles solicitados en la compra de  más abono e insecticidas que necesita para mejorar sus tierras.
texts.en:
Alex is 21 years old and he is a very happy and hardworking young man. He lives in his own home and his greatest wish is to improve his quality of life. Time has taught this hardworking man that a job well done brings its own rewards. And this is why he sets out in the very early morning to work the fields to make them more productive.

He takes his harvest to sell in the cooperatives in Pichanaki and the distributors give him very good prices for his coffee. What he most likes about his work is to harvest his coffee plants, especially because this product is his main source of income. He has five years in the business. The most difficult part of his work is to fumigate the plantation. 

In the future he plans on purchasing more land to expand his plantations. This is his first loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner). He believes that this loan will greatly help him in the development of his business. As a member of his communal bank he is very responsible and it is a source of great personal pride. Alex plans to invest the five hundred nuevos soles in the purchase of more fertilizer and pesticides needed to improve his harvests.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Sylvere

texts.en:
Sylvere is 31 years old and single. He takes care of two relatives who are 12 and 16 years old.

Sylvere is a self-employed businessman. He sells a variety of goods, such as cosmetics products and foodstuffs (bread, rice, sugar, cooking oil, etcetera). His shop is open from 6 a.m. until 7 p.m. daily. He employs two people to help him.

Sylvere has now requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to  purchase a large quantity of bread, sugar and rice, as they are in high demand. With this large quantity, he will also start wholesaling. In doing so, Sylvere hopes to earn more profits which in turn will allow him to renovate his house and continue paying school fees for his two relatives.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of sugar, bread and rice

loans.name: Baba

texts.fr:
Monsieur Baba B. est un homme marié de 60 ans qui vit dans une famille monogame  avec ses  seize enfants dans le quartier Est de la ville de Kolondièba, troisième région (Sikasso) de la République Mali. 
Pour augmenter son capital il adhère au programme crédit de  Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son premier cycle. 
Monsieur B. a trente  ans d’expérience dans cette activité et il appartient à une ethnie d’éleveurs.
Il achète ces bœufs,  dans la ville de Kolondièba, dans les villages environnants et la frontière Ivoirienne. 
Il vend ces animaux en Côte d’Ivoire,  un pays frontalier du Mali. La vente se fait essentiellement au comptant.   
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice de 50.000FCFA par mois soit 150.000 FCFA par trimestre.
Le bénéfice  sera réinvesti  dans l’entreprise.
texts.en:
Mr. Baba B. is a 60-year-old married man who lives in a monogamous family with his sixteen children in the Est neighbourhood in the city of Kolondièba, third region (Sikasso) of the Republic of Mali.

To increase his capital he is a member of the Soro Yiriwaso loan program, with whom he is in his first cycle. Mr. B. has thirty years of experience in this activity and he belongs to an ethnic group of cattle farmers. He buys his steer in the city of Kolondièba, the surrounding villages, and the Ivory Coast border. He sells these animals in the Ivory Coast, a country bordering Mali. He sells primarily for cash. He foresees making a profit of 50.000 CFA francs per month, which is 150.000 CFA francs per trimester. The profit will be reinvested in his business.

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Bejica

texts.es: Bejica, de 21 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Gelacio (28) y sus tres pequeños  hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida.El trabajo al que Bejica se dedica, es el cultivo de plátanos y café. Todos los días desde muy temprano, trabaja en su cultivo, ya que sabe que el dinero que obtenga de la venta de su cosecha, dependerá mucho de la calidad de sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que los meses de trabajo han tenido sus frutos, y ya lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus tierras, puesto que siempre hay el peligro de que los químicos las enfermen. Para más adelante tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad de esta manera espera mejorar sus cosechas y ganancias.Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, manifiesta que el dinero del crédito le ayudara mucho en el progreso de su trabajo, además en su banco comunal es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras, ya que es muy solidaria con el resto.Bejica tiene planeado invertir  los mil  soles solicitados en la compra de  más insecticidas, ya que desea tener sus  campos libres de plagas, así espera continuar progresando.
texts.en:
Bejica is 21 years old.  She is a very kind and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her husband, 28 year-old Gelacio, and her three young children for whom she would like to provide a better quality of life.

Bejica grows bananas and coffee.  Very early every morning, she goes out to work amongst her crops since she knows that the money she will make from selling her harvest will depend a lot on the quality of her produce.  What she most likes about her work is harvesting her land since that is when she feels that her months of work have borne fruit.  She has been in this business for 4 years and considers the most difficult part of her work to be spraying her land since there is always the danger that the chemicals will make her ill.  In the future, she plans to grow a larger quantity of crops.  In this way, she hopes to improve her harvests and profits.

This is Bejica's second loan with MFP.  She says that the loan money will help her a lot in making progress in her work.  She is a very well-liked member of her community bank since she is very supportive of her fellow bank members.  Bejica plans to invest the 1,000 Peruvian soles she is requesting in purchasing more insecticides since she would like to have her fields pest free.  In this way, she hopes to continue making progress.

loans.use: To buy insecticides for her crops

loans.name: Aura Lucía

texts.es:
A sus 54 años de edad, Aura Lucía Z. D. quien desde hace 3 años empezó con su almacén de ropa, entendió que para salir adelante es importante ser emprendedor, pues a pesar de los obstáculos que enfrenta en temporada baja en la que sus clientes no compran constantemente, ha seguido luchando porque con su trabajo aporta para cubrir los gastos del hogar. 

Actualmente Aura necesita un crédito para comprar más surtido y realizar un mantenimiento general en su local, así espera aumentar sus ventas con el fin de incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida, la de su esposo y la de su hija.
texts.en:
At 54 years of age, Aura Lucía Z. D., who set up her clothes store 3 years ago, realized that in order to get ahead in life, it is important to be enterprising.  In spite of the obstacles that she faces during the low season when her customers aren't buying constantly, she has continued working hard so that she makes enough from her work to cover her household expenses.

Currently, Aura needs a loan to buy more stock and to do some general maintenance work on her premises.  In this way, she hopes to increase her sales, in order to increase her profits and improve her own quality of life as well as that of her husband and her daughter.

loans.use: To buy stock and make some improvements to her premises

loans.name: Dancina

texts.fr:
Monsieur Dancina Koné est âgé de 36 ans et vit dans une famille monogame   avec ses cinq enfants à N’gomi, un des villages de la préfecture de Bougouni dans la troisième région (Sikasso) de la république Mali. 
Dans le souci de s’insérer dans le tissu économique, Monsieur Dancina  se lance dans le commerce (après quelques années d’apprentissage)  en ouvrant une boutique de vente d’articles divers. Avec une expérience de trois Dancina est très apprécié et sollicité.  
Pour augmenter son capital il adhère au programme de  Soro Yiriwaso  avec lequel,  il est à son deuxième  cycle. Le premier fut correctement remboursé. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt il compte acheter, 500 kilogrammes de sucre, un carton de cigarettes, deux cartons de thé et des radios récepteurs à Bamako (la capitale de la  république du Mali).  
Il compte faire prospérer son commerce en faisant varier ses articles pour réaliser un chiffre d’affaire plus élevé dans les jours à venir. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice de 15.000FCFA par mois  qui sera réinvesti dans l’entreprise.
texts.en:
Mr. Dancina Koné is 36 years old. He has five children and lives in a monogamous family in N’goi, a village in the Bougoni prefecture in the third region (Sikasso) of Mali. 

In order to be able to earn an income, Mr. Dancina launched a business (after a few years of apprenticeship) and opened a general store. Having three [years] of experience, he is well respected and popular. In order to increase his capital, he has joined the Soro Yiriwaso program, and is now on his second loan. The first loan was properly repaid.

With this new loan he plans to purchase in Bamako 500 kg [1100 lbs] of sugar, a carton of cigarettes, two cartons of tea and some radio receivers. He plans to build his business by increasing the variety of his goods in order to achieve a higher income in the future. He plans to achieve a monthly income of 15,00 West African francs, which will be reinvested in his is business.

loans.use: Purchasing miscellaneous items

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba F. is divorced and has 6 children. She has received schooling through Middle School. Aba has been selling porridge in Abrafo, near Abura, for 12 years. She uses her income to pay for utility bills and her children's school fees and books. Aba will use the loan to purchase more maize for preparing the porridge she sells. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to continue expanding her business by preparing more porridge and, as a result, serving more customers.

loans.use: to purchase more maize to make porridge

loans.name: Daouda

texts.fr:
Monsieur Daouda  Koné  est un homme marié de 29 ans polygame qui  vit   avec ses  deux  enfants à Gouna, dans un  village de la  Préfecture de Kolondièba, dans une grande famille élargie  dans la  troisième région (Sikasso) de la  République Mali.
N’ayant pas eu la chance de fréquenter l’école, Daouda s’est très vite initié aux activités génératrices  en optant pour fait l’achat vente de petits ruminants. 
Pour augmenter son capital il adhère au programme de  Soro Yiriwaso  et il est à son premier  prêt. Monsieur Koné a 10 ans d’expérience dans cette activité.
Il achète des  montons et chèvres, dans son village Gouna et environnants et les revend au marché à bétail de Kolondièba à une clientèle composée de bouchers et d’autres consommateurs. La vente se fait  généralement au comptant.   
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice de 40.000FCFA par mois soit 120.000FCA par trimestre.
Le bénéfice  sera réinvesti dans  l’entreprise. 
Il ambitionne ouvrir une boutique pour la vente des articles et divers pour diversifier ses activités.
texts.en:
Mr. Daouda Koné is a polygamous man, 29 years of age, who lives with his two children in a large extended family in Gouna, a village in the Kolondièba, in the third Region (Sikasso) of Mali.

Not having had the opportunity to attend school, Daouda very early started earning an income, deciding to go into selling goats and sheep. In order to increase his capital, he has joined Soro Yiriwaso  and is now on his first loan. Mr. Koné has 10 years of experience in this business. He purchases sheep and goats in Gouna and nearby village and resells at the animal market Kolondièba to a customer base composed of butchers and other consumers. He generally sells for cash. He plans to achieve a monthly income of 40,000 West African Francs, i.e. 120,000 for  a three-month period. The income will be reinvested n his business. His goal is to be able to open a general store in order to diversify his activities.

loans.use: Purchasing goats and sheep

loans.name: Adjoah

texts.en:
Adjoah E. is married and has 6 children. She has had no formal education. Adjoah has been selling provisions such as onions, canned tomatoes and cooking oil, in addition to a range of other goods, at her store in Abrafo, near Abura, for 5 years. Her husband is a farmer. Adjoah and her husband use their incomes to pay for food, other necessities and school fees and books.

Adjoah will use this loan to purchase more provisions for her shop to have a broader range of goods to gain more satisfied customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adjoah plans to reinvest in her business. She will also use some of the profit to repay her loan and further her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase more provisions to have a broader range of goods

loans.name: Diakaridia

texts.fr:
Monsieur Diakaridia D.  est un homme marié de 45 ans monogame et père de neuf  enfants, vivant   dans le quartier Ouest de Kolondièba ( préfecture ) dans une  famille nucléaire,   dans la troisième région (Sikasso) de la république du  Mali. 
Pour mieux alléger sa pauvreté, Monsieur D. adhéra au programme de prêt individuel de stockage et commercialisation de céréales de Soro Yiriwaso. Il  est à son premier prêt.
Avec ce prêt, il compte acheter, 10 tonnes de maïs et qu’il stockera pour revendre en un moment où le prix sera plus intéressant au marché de Kolondièba. En plus du stockage commercialisation des céréales Monsieur Diakaridia fait aussi achat et vente de beurre de karité. Il s’approvisionne dans  les  villages environnants et envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de  35. 000 FCFA. .Ce bénéfice sera utilisé dans les frais scolaire des enfants.
texts.en:
Mr. Diakaridia D. is a 45-year old man, married and living in a monogamous family, with nine children. He lives in the Ouest district of the Kolondièba Prefecture with his nuclear family, in the third region (the Sikasso Region) of Mali.

In order to alleviate his poverty, Mr. D. joined the Soro Yiriwaso program of individual loan for stocking and selling cereals. He is on his first loan. With this loan he plans to purchase 10 tons of corn, which he will stock until the  prices for corn go up at the  Kolondièba market. In addition to selling cereals, Mr. Diakarida also resells shea butter. He stocks up in the nearby villages. He plans to achieve an average monthly income of 35,000 West African francs. This income will be used towards the school fees of his children.

loans.use: Purchasing cereals

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena M. is a widow with 3 children. She has no formal education. Abena has been selling gari, which is made from the cassava plant, and groundnuts, a popular snack in Ghana, in Abrafo, near Abura, for 15 years. Abena uses her income to pay for her family's sustenance as well as school fees and books for her children.

Abena will use this loan to purchase more cassava which she mills to prepare gari. By increasing the amount of sold gari and groundnuts, Abena is also hoping for an increase in profit. With the new profits from her expanded business, Abena plans to reinvest some of the money into her growing business and to repay her loan. With the rest, she will take care of her children and make sure they receive the best possible education.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava to mill to prepare gari

loans.name: Fousseyni

texts.fr:
Monsieur FOUSSEYNI Koné est un homme marié de 30 ans, monogame qui est père de deux enfants. Il  vit avec son épouse et ses enfants dans le quartier Koko de Kolondièba,  troisième région (Sikasso) de la république du  Mali. 
Monsieur Koné en plus de ses activités de maçonnerie fait aussi le stockage des céréales depuis maintenant  5 ans.  
Afin d’augmenter son capital il adhère au programme crédit du prêt individuel de stockage et commercialisation de céréales de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui  il est à son premier cycle. C’est un jeune qui a abandonné l’école au second cycle du  fondamental (système éducatif Malien).
Avec ce prêt, il compte avoir acheter, 4 tonnes  de maïs  pour les revendre à aux grossistes de Kolondièba. Il s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants et espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de  21.875  F CFA qui sera investi dans les articles  divers afin de mieux diversifier ses activités génératrices de revenus, en ouvrant une boutique.
texts.en:
Mr. Fousseyni Koné is a monogamous, 30-year-old married man and father of two children. He lives with his wife and children in the neighborhood of Koko, in Kolondièba, Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Mr. Koné quit school in the second cycle of the fundamental program (Mali’s educational system). In addition to working as a mason, he has also been engaged in grain storage for five years.

Wanting to increase his working capital, he joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution to avail himself of its individual loan program for grain storage and marketing. This is his first loan cycle with the organization. 

He plans to use the loan to buy four tons of corn to be sold to Kolondièba wholesalers. He gets his stocks in surrounding villages and hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 21,875 FCFA, which will be invested in various items to diversify his income generating activities by opening a shop.

loans.use: To purchase grain

loans.name: Celia

texts.es: Celia, de 26 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Walter (30)  y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida.Junto a su esposo trabaja todos los días en sus cultivos. Y con mucho esfuerzo a logrado que sus tierras sean muy productivas y ahora siembra de todo, ya que sabe que todo producto que obtenga será de muy buena calidad. Ella principalmente siembra plátano y café, ya que estos productos son muy solicitados en el mercado de la ciudad de Pichanaki. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos de las plagas que pueden afectarlas, y ya lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos hacia zonas alejadas. Para el futuro de su negocio, espera comprar mayor cantidad de  tierras para incrementar su producción actual.Es su segundo préstamo con MFP, siente que este crédito le ayudara mucho en el desarrollo de sus actividades, y en su banco comunal es una socia, muy responsable, por  lo cual se siente muy orgullosa.Celia tiene planeado invertir los mil soles solicitados, y  los invertirá en mejorar sus cultivos, para ello comprará abono e insecticidas, de esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Celia is 26 years old.  She is a very kind and hard-working woman who lives in her own home with her husband, 30 year-old Walter.  What Celia wishes for more than anything is to improve her quality of life.

Together with her husband, Celia works every day on her crops.  Through a lot of hard work, she has managed to make her land very productive and now she grows a bit of everything since she knows that every crop she grows will be very good quality.  She mainly grows bananas and coffee since these are the most requested products in the market in the town of Pichanaki.

What Celia most likes about her work is protecting her crops from pests that could affect them.  She has been in this business for 10 years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be transporting her crops to remote areas.  In the future, she hopes to buy a larger quantity of land so that she can increase her current production.

This is Celia's second loan with MFP.  She feels that this loan will help her a lot in carrying out her business.  She is a very responsible member of her community bank and she is very proud of this fact.  Celia plans to invest the 1,000 Peruvian soles she is requesting in improving her crops.  To this end, she will buy manure and insecticides.  In this way, she hopes to improve her profits.

loans.use: To buy manure and insecticides to improve her crops

loans.name: Luz Dolly

texts.es:
