Luz Dolly D. J. es una mujer emprendedora que siempre ha trabajado para aportar con los pagos propios del hogar, por ello, desde hace 7 años decidió crear su propio negocio, una tienda de abarrotes en la que vende diferentes productos. 

Con el fin de comprar más productos y adquirir estantería para mejorar la presentación de sus productos, Luz Dolly necesita de un crédito para lograr este objetivo que le permitirá incrementar sus ventas y caminar hacia su gran sueño: llegar a tener un Supermercado reconocido en el municipio.
texts.en: Luz Dolly D. J. is an enterprising woman who has always worked to cover her own household expenses. For this reason, seven years ago she decided to set up her own business: a grocery store in which she sells different products.  Luz Dolly would like to buy more products and acquire some shelving to improve the presentation of her products.  She needs a loan in order to achieve this goal that will allow her to increase her sales and take a step further towards her biggest dream: to own a well-known supermarket in her town.

loans.use: To acquire merchandise and buy shelving

loans.name: Issa

texts.fr:
Monsieur Issa D.   est  marié et  âgé de 41ans. Il vit dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie à Boundioba  dans la  troisième région (Sikasso) de la  république Mali, avec ses  cinq enfants et ses épouses. 
Issa D. excelle dans l’achat vente de bétails dans lequel il est très réputé.
Pour augmenter son capital il adhère au programme de  Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son premier prêt. Monsieur Issa D.  a 5 ans d’expérience dans cette activité.
Il  compte acheter avec son prêt, des bœufs, des moutons et des  chèvres dans son village  Boundioba  et environnants pour les revendre au marché à bétails de Bamako (capitale du Mali) et à Koumantou, à une clientèle venant du Sénégal, un pays frontalier de la République du Mali s’agissant des bœufs  et quant aux petits ruminants aux bouchers de la place. Les ventes se font très généralement au comptant.   
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice de 50.000FCFA par mois qui sera réinvesti dans  l’entreprise. 
Il ambitionne ouvrir une boutique de vente d’articles divers à Kolondièba pour davantage diversifier ses sources de revenus.
texts.en:
Mr. Issa D. is married and he is 41 years old. He lives in a large traditional family in  
Boundioba is the third region (Sikasso) of the Republic of Mali. He lives with his five children and his wives. 

Issa D.'s specialization is the buying and selling of cattle, a business in which he has earned a high reputation.  In order to supplement his capital funds he joined Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner). It is his first loan.  He has five years' experience in the business.

He plans to purchase cattle, sheep, and goat livestock in his village, Boundioba, and in the neighboring regions for resale in the cattle market in Bamako (capital city of Mali) and in Koumantou. His clientele come from Senegal, a neighboring country to the Republic of Mali. They purchase beef cattle as well as small livestock from the butchers of the region. He completes his sales most of the time in cash.

He plans on earning a monthly income of 50.000FCFA which will be reinvested back into the business. He endeavors to open a general store to sell a variety of merchandise in Kolondieba as an additional source of income

loans.use: To purchase livestock.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama P. is married and has 4 children. She has no formal education. Ama has been selling chilled mineral water and drinks in Abrafo, near Abura, for 5 years. Her husband is a supervisor. Ama is responsible for paying for her family's livelihood. Together with her husband, she also takes care of her children's school fees and books.

Ama's loan will be used to buy more mineral water and drinks to serve a greater amount of customers and increase her profit. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to further expand her business by buying more mineral water. She will also use this money to repay her loan and make sure her children get a good education.

loans.use: to buy more drinks

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr:
Monsieur Moussa Sangaré  est un homme marié de 43 ans qui est un polygame vivant au village N’Tjinina,  dans une grande famille traditionnelle,  avec ses  six  enfants, préfecture de  Kolondièba,    troisième région administrative de la République du Mali. 
Moussa Sangaré fait l’achat vente de céréales de toutes sortes depuis maintenant deux ans.
Pour augmenter son capital il adhère au programme de  Soro Yiriwaso avec qui  il est à son deuxième prêt. Le premier a été bien remboursé. 
En ce moment où les céréales sont chères, Monsieur Sangaré fait ses achats à un prix très abordable. Pendant  la saison sèche  il vend ses articles aux revendeurs et consommateurs.
Il compte acheter, 10 tonnes de maïs  céréales à  Kolondièba auprès des producteurs et dans les villages environnants.     
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice bimestriel de 50.000FCFA.
Le bénéfice  sera investi dans la nourriture et dans les frais scolaires.
texts.en:
Mr. Moussa Sangare is a 43-year old married man who is polygamous and who lives in the village of N'Tjinina. He lives in a large traditional family, including six children, in the prefecture of Kolondieba, the third administrative region in the Republic of Mali. 

Moussa Sangare's business has been to buy and sell cereal grains of all sorts for the past two years. In order to supplement his capital he joined Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner). It is his second loan. The first loan was successfully repaid. 

At this moment when cereal grains are abundant, Mr. Sangare makes his purchases at a very affordable price. During the dry season he sells his product to retailers and to consumers. He plans on purchasing 10 tons of corn in Kolondieba from the producers in the surrounding villages. 

He expects to make a bimonthly profit of 50.000FCFA. The profits will be invested in the purchase of food and to pay for schooling fees.

loans.use: To purchase cereal grains.

loans.name: Sanata

texts.fr:
Madame Sanata D.  est une femme mariée de 41 ans qui vit  dans une famille monogame avec son mari et ses quatre  enfants  dans le quartier Est de Kolondièba dans la  troisième région administrative de la république  Mali. 
Sanata est une Enseignante qui donne cours  au premier cycle de l’école fondamentale A de Kolondièba. En plus de cette profession, elle mène  des activités génératrices de revenus telles l’achat vente d’articles divers et le stockage commercialisation de céréales. 
Elle a fait trois cycles dans le prêt solidaire tous bien remboursés. 
Pour augmenter son capital elle décide aller au  prêt  individuel de stockage et commercialisation de céréales de Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est à son deuxième  prêt individuel, le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
Elle s’approvisionne sur le marché de Kolondièba et dans les villages environnants pendant les jours fériés lors des  foires hebdomadaires. Elle revend aux grossistes venant de Bamako et Sikasso parfois à ses camarades enseignants.
Avec ce prêt, il compte acheter, 1500  kilogrammes de maïs  qu’elle stockera pour revendre à la période de cours élevé.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice  moyen de  20.000FCFA. Le bénéfice  sera  réinvesti dans l’entreprise.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sanata D. is a 41-year old married woman who lives in a monogamous family, consisting of her husband and their four children, in the East Kolondieba quarter of the third administrative region in the Republic of Mali. 

Sanata is a teacher who gives primary school lessons at the school named "Fondamentale A" in Kolondieba. In addition to this career, she also carries out revenue-generating activities, including the sale of a variety of merchandise and the storage and sale of cereal grains. 

She has had three previous loan cycles and they have all been successfully repaid. In order to supplement her capital she decided to approach Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner) for an individual loan to store and purchase cereal grains. It is her second individual loan, the first of which was successfully repaid.

She purchases her products in the market in Kolondieba and in the surrounding villages during holidays and during weekly fairs. She resells to the wholesalers from Bamako and Sikasso, and sometimes to her teacher colleagues. 

With her loan she plans on purchasing 1500 kilograms of corn which she will store for resale during the peak season. 

She expects to earn an average monthly income of 20.000FCFA. Her profits will be reinvested back into the business.

loans.use: To purchase cereal grains.

loans.name: Yaya

texts.fr:
Monsieur Yaya  Koné  est un homme marié de 34ans monogame vivant   avec ses  quatre  enfants dans le quartier Ouest de la ville de Kolondièba, troisième région administrative de la république Mali.
Yaya fait le commerce de bétails depuis maintenant quinze ans. Il est très sollicité et apprécié dans cette activité. 
Pour augmenter son capital il adhère au programme de  Soro Yiriwaso  avec qui il est à son deuxième cycle. 
Monsieur Koné compte achète des bœufs, des moutons et des chèvres, dans la ville de Kolondièba et environnants.  
Il vend ces animaux au marché à bétails de Kolondièba, au comptant et souvent à crédit.   
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice de 70.000FCfa par mois. 
Le bénéfice  sera investi dans les frais  santé et le reste dans l’entreprise.
texts.en:
Mr. Yaya Koné is a monogamous, 34-year-old married man who lives with his four children in the western district of the city of Kolondièba (in the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Yaya has been selling livestock for the past fifteen years. He is in high demand and enjoys a very good reputation in this business.

To increase his working capital, he joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution and is now on his second loan cycle.

Mr. Koné plans to purchase oxen, sheep and goats in Kolondièba and neighboring areas. He sells the animals at the Kolondièba cattle market for cash and often on credit. He expects to earn a monthly profit of 70,000 FCFA, which will be used to pay for health care and to fund his activities.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Cynder

texts.es: Cynder, de 34 años, es una madre de familia muy amorosa y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Cesar (41), quien trabaja como chofer de un auto y sus cuatro  pequeños  hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida.En la comunidad de Yurinaki (Comunidad del distrito de Pichanaki), Cynder tiene su tienda de abarrotes, ella se siente muy feliz con su negocio, ya que le es muy rentable y esta en muy buena  ubicación, pues por la zona transita cantidad de personas. Desde las 5 y 30 de la mañana abre su tienda y se dispone a vender los productos que tiene en stock, esta actividad la realiza hasta las 10 de la noche que es la hora cuando cierra su tienda. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es comercializar  y es muy buena realizando esta labor, ya que siempre sus clientes salen muy contentos de su tienda, ya lleva cuatro  años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es permanecer todo el día dentro de su bodega, sin poder salir a la calle a realizar sus actividades. Para más adelante, espera mejorar su tienda y hacerla crecer, para así poder atender mejor a sus clientes.Es  el noveno préstamo que tiene  con MFP, y promete que será muy  puntual en sus pagos, ya que no desea perjudicar a las demás socias de su banco comunal, en donde es muy querida y respetada.Cynder tiene planeado invertir  los quinientos soles solicitados en la compra de  más productos para implementar mejor su tienda de abarrotes, de esta manera espera mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Cynder is a very loving and hard-working, 34 year-old mother.  She lives in her own home together with her husband Cesar (41), who works as a car driver, and her four young children for whom she would like to provide a better quality of life.

Cynder own a grocery store in her community of Yurinaki (in Pichanaki district).  She is very happy with her business since it is very profitable and in a good location as a large number of people pass through the area.  She opens her store at 5.30am and gets ready to sell the products that she has in stock.  She works until 10.00pm when she closes her store.

What Cynder most likes about her work is selling and she is very good at this job since her customers always leave her store very happy.  She has been in this business for four years and she considers the most difficult part of her work being the fact that she has to stay in her store all day without being able to go out and do what she needs to do.  In the future, she hopes to improve her store and help it grow so that she can better serve her customers.

This is Cynder's ninth loan with MFP and she pledges to be very punctual in making her repayments since she does not want to cause trouble for the other members of her community bank where she is a very well-liked and respected member.  Cynder plans to invest the 500 Peruvian soles she is requesting in purchasing more products so that she can better run her grocery store.  In this way, she hopes to improve her sales.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to stock her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To acquire a second-hand overlock sewing machine

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr:
Monsieur Abdoulaye Koné est un homme marié de 27 ans, monogame qui est père de deux enfants. Il  vit avec son épouse à Flacoda, un hameau de Socourani, l’un des villages de la sous-préfecture de Fakola  dans une  famille traditionnelle élargie, Préfecture de Kolondièba  dans la troisième région (Sikasso) de la République du  Mali. 
Monsieur Koné, qui  n’a pas eu la chance de fréquenter l’école, s’est très vite intéressé aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat ventes des produits agricoles.
Pour alléger sa pauvreté Monsieur Koné adhère au programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui  il est à son premier cycle.
Avec ce prêt, il compte acheter, 3 tonnes  de riz pour les revendre à Bamako et à Guèya, un village de la  République sœur de la  Côte-d’Ivoire. 
Quand Monsieur Koné vend son riz  à Guèya en Côte-d’Ivoire,  de retour il achète des ignames, des bananes, des pâtes de maniocs moins chers pour les revendre au Mali. Il s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants et espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de  100. 000  F CFA qui sera investi dans l’entreprise, les frais de santé, scolaire, nourriture et achat d’animaux.
texts.en:
Mr. Abdoulaye Koné is 27 years old, married (in a monogamous marriage) and the father of 2 children. He lives with his wife in a  traditional extended family in Flacoda, a hamlet near Socourani, one of the villages in the sub-prefecture of Fakola, prefecture of Kolondièba in the Third Region (Sikasso) of the Republic of Mali. 

Mr Koné, who did not have the opportunity to go to school, soon became interested in activities that produce revenue, in particular, buying and selling agricultural products. To ease his poverty, Mr. Koné belongs to the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso, and he is in his first cycle. With this loan, he plans to buy 3 tons of rice to re-sell in Bamako and in Guèya, a village in Mali's sister republic, Côte-d’Ivoire. When he goes to Guèya in Côte-d’Ivoire, on his way back he buys yams, bananas, and cassava paste cheaply, to re-sell in Mali. 

He obtains his supplies in the surrounding villages and hopes to make an average profit of 100,000 CFA francs which will be invested in his business, and also used for healthcare, school fees, food, and to buy animals.

loans.use: To buy rice

loans.name: Daouda

texts.fr:
Monsieur Daouda C. est un homme marié et sans enfant de 24 ans qui vit dans une famille monogame dans le quartier Est  dans la préfecture de Kolondièba (troisième  région administrative de la république  Mali.
 Monsieur C. fait le commerce d’articles divers avec l’achat vente d’habits, de chaussures, de tissus etc. 
Afin d’augmenter son capital et satisfaire sa clientèle, elle a décidé d’adhérer au programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est à son deuxième prêt. Le premier a été bien remboursé et aux dates dues.  Sa boutique  sise  au marché de Kolondièba est très fréquentée.
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt, 40 complets de prêt-à-porter, 30 pagnes de wax Hollandaise  et 100 paires de chaussures en plastiques et en cuirs.
Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako la capitale de la république du Mali. Avec une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes, elle vend au comptant et souvent  à crédit.
Elle compte   réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de  50. 000  F CFA qui sera réinvesti dans la santé, nourriture et habillement.
texts.en: Mr. Daouda C. is a 24 year old married man without children who lives in a monogamous family in the Eastern District in Kolondièba prefecture (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  He has a business selling various articles, buying and selling clothing, shoes, fabric etc.  To increase his capital and satisfy his customers, he decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's  loan program. He is on his second loan, having paid the first loan on the dates due. His shop located at Kolondièba market draws many customers.   With this loan, he intends to buy 40 ready-to-wear outfits, 30 Dutch wax pagnes (a colorful West African cloth) and 100 pairs of shoes made of plastic or leather.  He gets his supplies in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali). His sales are in cash and often by credit to a clientele composed of men and women. He expects to make a monthly profit of 50,000 CFA. which will be reinvested in health care, food and clothing.

loans.use: To buy various articles

loans.name: Drissa

texts.fr:
Monsieur Drissa Konaté  est  âgé de 35 ans et vit dans une famille la grande famille traditionnelle  avec ses épouses, ses quatre enfants à N’godiarala,  un des villages de la Sous-préfecture de Fakola, Préfecture de Kolondièba, troisième région (Sikasso) de la république du  Mali. 
Pour mieux alléger sa pauvreté, Monsieur Konaté  adhéra au programme de prêt individuel de stockage et commercialisation de céréales de Soro Yiriwaso. Il  est à son cinquième prêt. Tous les quatre prêts précédents ont été remboursés sans aucune difficulté.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, il compte acheter,  400  kilogrammes de grains de fonio, 10.000  kilogrammes de maïs et 200 kilogrammes de mil qu’il stockera pour revendre en un moment où le prix sera plus intéressant. Il s’approvisionne dans  les  villages environnants et envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de  50. 000  F CFA.
texts.en: Mr. Drissa Konaté is 35 years old and lives in a large traditional family with his spouses and his four children in N’godiarala, a village in the sub-prefecture of Fakola, prefecture of Kolondièba, in the 3rd administrative region (Sikasso) of the Republic of Mali. To alleviate his poverty further, Mr. Konaté joined the individual loan program at Soro Yiriwaso for stocking and marketing grains. He is on his fifth loan. The four previous ones have all been repaid without any problems at all. With this new loan, he intends to buy 400 kg of fonio seeds; 10,000 kg of corn; and 200 kg of millet that will be stocked up for resale when prices are better. He gets his supplies in surrounding villages and envisions making an average monthly profit of 50,000 francs CFA.

loans.use: Buying grains

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua E. is married and has 3 children. She has no formal education. Ekua has been selling smoked fish in Abrafo, near Abura, for 7 years. Ekua's husband is a farmer. Together with her husband, Ekua is responsible for paying for her children's school fees and books.

Ekua's loan will be used to buy more fish. She would also like to start selling charcoal. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to further expand it by reinvesting part of the profit. She will repay her loan with some of the money and use the rest of it to take care of her children.

loans.use: increasing her stock of fish and charcoal

loans.name: Delina

texts.es: Delina, de 30 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Mario (40)  y sus cinco hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor  calidad de vida.Se dedica  al  cultivo de plátano y café. Todos los días, muy temprano, empieza con su labor  en sus cultivos, ya que sabe que el dinero que obtenga de la venta de su cosecha, dependerá mucho de la calidad de sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que los meses de trabajo han tenido sus frutos, ya lleva cuatro  años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus tierras. Para más adelante, desea cultivar en mayor cantidad, para incrementar su producción.Es  el primer préstamo de Delina con MFP, y manifiesta que el dinero del crédito le ayudara mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras, ya que es muy solidaria con todas, además de responsable.Con los mil soles solicitados, comprará mayor cantidad de  abono y fertilizantes que necesita  para mejorar la productividad de sus cultivos, de esta manera espera salir adelante.
texts.en:
Delina is 30 years old.  She is a very simple and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her husband Mario (40) and her five children for whom she would like to provide a better quality of life.

Delina grows bananas and coffee.  Very early every morning she starts work on her crops since she knows that the money she obtains for selling her harvest will depend a lot on the quality of her products.  What she most likes about her work is harvesting her crops since that is when she feels that the months of work have borne fruit.  She has been in this business for four years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be spraying her land.  In the future, she would like to grow a larger quantity of crops and increase her production.

This is Delina's first loan with MFP and she says that the loan money will help her a lot in making progress in her work.  She very well liked by the other members of her community bank since she is very supportive of the other members and also responsible.  She will use the 1,000 Peruvian soles she is requesting to buy a larger quantity of manure and fertilizers that she needs in order to improve the productivity of her crops.  In this way, she hopes to get ahead.

loans.use: To buy manure and insecticides to improve her crops

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua M. is single and has 2 children. She has been educated up to senior high school. Efua has been selling palm oil, which she helps prepare, in Abrafo, near Abura, for 5 years. She is responsible for paying for her children's food, school fees and needed learning materials.

Efua's loan will be used to buy a larger quantity of palm fruits to increase her sales. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to continually expand it by reinvesting most of the profit. She will use some of the money to repay her loan and make sure her children are well and receiving a good education.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of palm fruits

loans.name: Mahamadou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Mahamadou S. est un homme marié de 29 ans qui vit dans une famille monogame dans le village de Niamala dans la Préfecture de Kolondièba (troisième  région administrative de la république  Mali.
 Mahamadou fait le commerce d’articles divers avec l’achat vente d’habits, de chaussures, de tissus etc. 
Afin d’augmenter son capital et satisfaire sa clientèle, il a décidé d’adhérer au programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Il est à son premier  prêt. 
Il compte acheter avec ce prêt, 35 complets de prêt-à-porter, 90 pagnes de wax  et 100 paires de chaussures.
Il s’approvisionne à Bamako la capitale de la République du Mali. Avec une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes, il vend au comptant et souvent  à crédit.
Il compte   réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de  60. 000  F CFA qui sera réinvesti dans la santé, nourriture et l’habillement des enfants.
texts.en: Mr Mahamadou S. is a married 29 year old man that lives in a monogamous familly in the village of Niamala in the District of Kolondièba (third largest administrative region in the republic of Mali). Mahamadou works in retail selling a variety of articles including clothes, shoes, cloth, etc. In order to increase his revenues and satisfy is customer base, he decided to join the microlending group Soro Yiriwaso. This is his first loan. He plans to purchase 35 bundles of clothes, 90 specialized Malian cloths named pagnes and 100 pairs of shoes. He stocks up on articles in Bamako, the capital city of the Republic of Mali. He sells his articles mostly on a credit base to a customer base composed of both women and men. He hopes to gain monthly profits of 60.000 CFA [approximately 120 USD] which he will reinvest in health, food and clothing for his children.

loans.use: Purchasing diverse articles

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Mamadou Diabaté est un homme marié de 26 ans polygame qui est père de deux enfants. Il  vit avec son épouse à Socourani, l’un des villages de la sous-préfecture de Fakola  dans une  famille traditionnelle élargie, Préfecture de Kolondièba  dans la troisième région (Sikasso) de la République du  Mali. 
 Monsieur Diabaté  adhéra au programme crédit du prêt individuel de stockage et commercialisation de céréales de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui  il est à son premier cycle.
Avec ce prêt, il compte acheter,  20 tonnes  de maïs pour les revendre à Bamako aux grossistes. Il s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants et espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de  50. 000  F CFA qui sera utilisé dans les frais scolaire, de santé, de nourriture et acheter des petits ruminants..
texts.en: Mr Mamadou Diabaté is a married 26 year old polygamous man and the father of two children. He lives with his wife Socourani and his extended family in a village in the sub-district of Fakola, in the District of Kolondièba, in Sikasso, the third largest region of the Republic of Mali. Mr Diabaté is a member of the individual loan program for stocking and selling cereals and grains provided by Soro Yiriwaso, and is asking for his first loan. He plans to use this loan to purchase 20 tons of maize from surrounding villages and resell them in Bamako to wholesalers. He hopes to gain an average monthly profit of 50,000 CFA [approximately 102 USD] which will be spent on school fees, health, nutrition and to purchase small grass-fed animals.

loans.use: Purchasing grains/cereals

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame N. is married and has 6 children. She has no formal education. Maame has been selling palm oil in Abrafo, near Abura, for 4 years. Her husband is a mechanic. Maame uses her income to pay for sending her children to school. This means that she and her husband have to pay for school fees, books and uniforms. Any leftover money is used for the family's sustenance.

Maame will use this loan to purchase larger quantities of palm fruits in order to produce more oil to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Maame plans to provide a solid financial foundation to enable her children to enjoy the best possible education. She will reinvest part of the money in her business and repay the loan.

loans.use: to purchase larger quantities of palm fruits

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr:
Monsieur Moussa D.  est un homme marié de 38 ans, polygame   avec deux  enfants, il  réside à Siana, un village de la Préfecture    de  Kolondièba (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas eu la chance de fréquenter l’école, Moussa s’intéressa très tôt aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment  à la réparation de vélos et mobylettes. 
Il dispose d’un magasin qui se trouve au bord de la route traversant son village Siana lequel il vend des pièces détachées pour vélos et mobylettes, des vélos neufs et occasions, en plus de ses activités de réparateurs. 
Pour augmenter son capital il décide d’adhérer au programme  crédit de  Soro Yiriwaso avec qui, il est à son premier prêt individuel.  
Il compte  acheter une importante quantité de pièces détachées à Bamako (capitale du Mali) auprès des grossistes. Il revend ses pièces en détail au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle diverse  et variée. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice de 30.000 FCFA par mois qui sera essentiellement pour achat des animaux et  payer les frais de santé et scolaire des enfants.
texts.en: Monsieur Moussa D. is a 36 year old married polygamous man with two children. He lives in Siana, a village in the District of Kolondièba (third largest administrative region in the Republic of Mali). As he did not have the chance to attend school, Moussa became interested at a young age in activities that generate profits, especially repairing bicycles and motorbikes. He owns a store on the side of the road that passes through Siana and sells spare parts for bicycles and motorbikes, new and secondhand bicycles, and offers to repair other bicycles. In order to increase his revenue he became a meme of the lending group Soro Yiriwaso and his asking for his first individual loan. He plans to use the loan to purchase a large number of spare parts from wholesalers in Bamako (capital city of Mali). He re-sells the individual parts for cash as well as for credit to a diverse clientele. He hopes to gain monthly profits of 30,000 FCFA [approximately 61 USD] which will be used to purchase animals and pay the school and health fees for his children.

loans.use: Purchasing spare parts

loans.name: Eduardina

texts.es: Eduardina, de 37 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Julio (38)  y sus cinco pequeños  hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida.El cultivo de plátano y café es la actividad que realiza diariamente Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado que sus tierras sean muy productivas, lo cual ha generado que sus cultivos sean muy bien apreciados en la ciudad de Pichanaki, que es donde traslada a vender sus productos naturales. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, lleva tres  años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. Para más adelante tiene planeado  comprar nuevas tierras, para poder sembrar más.Es  el segundo préstamo de Eduardina con MFP y espera ser muy puntual en sus cuotas, puesto que no quiere darle problemas a su banco comunal, en el cual se siente muy contenta, pues sus integrantes son muy solidarios y responsables.Eduardina tiene planeado invertir los  mil soles solicitados en la compra de cantidad de  abono que necesita para mejorar la productividad de sus chacras, de esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Eduardina, age 37, is a very simple and hard-working woman. She lives in her own house, together with her husband Julio (38) and her five young children, whom she would like to provide with a better quality of life. Growing bananas and coffee is her daily work. With great effort, she has been able to make her lands very productive, so that her crops are well appreciated in the city of Pichanaki, the place where she takes her natural products to sell. What she likes most about her work is caring for her crops. She has done this work for three years, and she thinks the most difficult aspect of it is transporting her products, since the sacks she carries are very heavy, and they make her tired. For the future, she plans to buy more land so that she can expand her plantings. This is Eduardina's second loan with MFP, and she plans to be very punctual with her payments, since she does not want to cause any problems for her communal bank. She feels very happy in her communal bank, because the members are very responsible and have a strong sense of solidarity. Eduardina plans to invest the thousand Peruvian soles she is requesting in buying fertilizer in bulk, which she needs to improve the productivity of her fields, and thus she hopes to improve her earnings.

loans.use: Buying fertilizer to improve her crops

loans.name: Youssouf

texts.fr:
Monsieur Youssouf Koné est un célibataire de 27 ans qui vit dans une grande  famille élargie chez son père  dans le quartier Koko de la ville de Kolondièba (Préfecture) (troisième  région administrative de la république  Mali.
Monsieur Koné  est un enseignant de l’école communautaire qui fait également la distribution des cartes téléphoniques prépayées des sociétés de téléphonies du Mali.
Afin d’augmenter son capital et satisfaire sa clientèle, elle a décidé d’adhérer au programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est à son premier  prêt. 
Elle compte acheter, des cartes de recharge orange à Bamako (la capitale de la République du Mali) et pour les revendre à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes, au comptant et quelques fois à crédit. Il ravitaille aussi plusieurs boutiquiers de la place à crédit payable hebdomadairement.
Elle compte   réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de  24. 000  F CFA qui sera réinvesti dans l’entreprise.
texts.en:
Mr. Youssouf Koné is a single, 27-year-old man who lives in a large extended family at his father’s house in the Koko neighborhood of the Kolondièba prefecture (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Mr. Koné, a community school teacher, also sells prepaid mobile phone recharge cards from various telephone companies of Mali. 

To increase his working capital and meet customer demand, he joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution and is now on n his first loan cycle. 

He plans to buy Orange recharge cards in Bamako (capital of Mali) for resale to a customer base of both men and women, for cash and occasionally on credit. He will also supply several local shopkeepers on credit, payable weekly.

He expects to make an average monthly profit of 24,000 FCFA to be reinvested in the company.

loans.use: To purchase mobile phone recharge cards

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Mademoiselle Fatoumata Dramé est âgée de 21 ans. Elle est mère d’un enfant. Cette dame est née en Côte-D’Ivoire où elle grandit. C’est suite au    décès de son père que sa maman décida de retourner au Mali, son pays d’origine. 
Afin d’aider sa mère à subvenir aux dépenses de famille, Fatoumata fait le commerce de céréales et ouvre en plus, un restaurant à Fakola, un village de la préfecture de Kolondièba, troisième région (Sikasso) de la république du  Mali. 
Pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuse et exigeante, Fatoumata  adhère au programme crédit  de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui  elle est à son premier cycle.
Avec ce prêt, il compte acheter, 5 tonnes  de maïs dans les villages environnants pour les revendre à Bamako, au comptant, acheter des ignames, des bananes, des pâtes de maniocs moins chers en Côte-D’Ivoire pour les revendre au Mali. 
Elle espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice moyen mensuel de  120. 000  F CFA qui sera réinvesti dans entreprise et les frais de santé, scolaire   et nourriture. 
Fatoumata ambitionne toujours diversifier ses activités et compte ouvrir une boutique de lux beauté à Fakola.
texts.en:
Miss Fatoumata Dramé is 21 years old with one child.  She was born and grew up in Côte-D’Ivoire.  After the death of her father, her mother decided to return to Mali, her country of origin.

In order to help her mother with the family expenses, Fatoumata sells grain and is also opening a restaurant in Fakola, a village in the Kolondièba prefecture of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali.

To better satisfy her growing number of demanding customers, Fatoumata is working with Soro Yiriwaso's credit program, where she is in her first cycle.

With this loan, she plans to buy 5 metric tons of corn in surrounding villages to resell on a cash basis in Bamako; and to buy yams, bananas, and manioc paste, which are cheaper in Côte-D’Ivoire, to resell in Mali.  With this loan she hopes to make an average monthly profit of 120,000 FCFA, which will be reinvested in her business and used for health, schooling, and food expenses.

Fatoumata would like to further expand her business and plans to open a beauty shop in Fakola.

loans.use: Purchase of grain

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama N. is married and has 4 children. She has received schooling through junior high school. Ama has been selling roasted plantain in Abrafo, near Abura, for 5 years. Her husband is a driver. Ama uses her income to pay for her children's education, including school fees, uniforms, books and other learning materials.

Ama will use this loan to purchase larger quantities of plantain in order to increase her sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to guarantee her children the opportunity to enjoy a good education. She will also reinvest some of the money back into her business and repay the loan she received.

loans.use: to purchase larger quantities of plantain

loans.name: Tènè

texts.fr:
Madame Tènè D. est une femme sans enfant, qui vit ses coépouses et enfants dans une famille polygame à Fakola, préfecture de Kolondièba troisième région administrative de la république du Mali.
Tènè fait le commerce d’articles divers et du stockage commercialisation depuis bientôt trois  ans. Après deux cycle en prêt solidaire tous bien remboursés, elle décide de venir au prêt  individuel de stockage commercialisation dans lequel elle est à son deuxième prêt, le premier ayant été correctement remboursé.
Téné compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 1000  kilogrammes de riz, 1000  kilogrammes de mil qu’il stockera pour revendre en une période  où le cours sera plus  élevé.
Elle s’approvisionne sur le marché de  Fakola les jours de foire et dans les villages environnants.
Avec ce prêt, il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de  41.670  F CFA.
Le bénéfice  sera  utilisé dans les frais  santé, d’habillement et le reste pour l’augmentation du capital.
texts.en:
Mrs Tènè D. is a woman without children who lives with her cowives and their children in a polygamous family in Fakola, prefecture of Kolondièba (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Tènè has been trading with various articles for almost three years, stockpiling and then selling them. After two cycles of solidarity loans, all repaid on schedule, she decided to opt for individual loans to finance her activity. This is her second loan, after having properly repaid her first loan. Tènè wants to use her loan to buy 1,000 kilograms of rice and 1,000 kilograms of millet that she will stockpile and resell once the price will have gone up. She gets her supplies at the market in Fakola on market days and in the neighboring villages.

Thanks to this loan, she expects to make an average profit of 41,670 CFA francs a month, which she will spend on health services and clothing. Any remaining amount will be used to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Sékou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Sékou S. est un homme marié de 31 ans polygame qui est père de trois enfants. Il  vit avec son épouse à Soromana, l’un des villages de la sous-préfecture de Fakola  dans une  famille traditionnelle élargie, Préfecture de Kolondièba  dans la troisième région (Sikasso) de la République du  Mali. 
Monsieur S. est un cultivateur qui  pendant la saison non pluvieuse fait du commerce de céréales. 
Afin de satisfaire sa clientèle il  adhère au programme crédit du prêt individuel  de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui  il est à son premier cycle.
Avec ce prêt, il compte avoir acheter,  30 tonnes  de maïs pour les revendre à Bamako, à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et quelques  consommateurs. Il s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants et espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de  120. 000  F CFA qui sera investi dans entreprise.
texts.en:
Mr. Sékou S. is married (polygamous) and the father of three children. He lives with his wife in an extended traditional family in Soromana, one of the villages in the sub-prefecture of Fakola, prefecture of  Kolondièba, in the third administrative district (Sikasso) of the Republic of Mali. 

Mr. S. is a farmer who sells cereals during the dry season. In order to satisfy his customers, he has joined Soro Yiriwaso's individual loan program, and is currently in his first cycle. With this loan, he plans to buy 30 tonnes of maize to re-sell in Bamako, to customers who are both re-sellers and consumers. He obtains his supplies in the surrounding villages and hopes to make an average monthly  profit of 120,000 CFA francs which will be re-invested in the business.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es: Efraín, de 32 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Noria (29) y sus tres pequeños  hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida.Trabajando muy duro Efraín ha logrado que sus chacras se vuelvan muy fértiles y productivas. Todos los días labora con dedicación en sus tierras, haciendo que sus cultivos sean cada vez mejores. Lo cosechado lo lleva a vender al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Pichanaki, donde generalmente recibe muy buena paga. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar, ya  lleva seis años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos a zonas alejadas. Con el tiempo, espera comprar nuevas tierras para ampliar sus plantaciones y aumentar sus ganancias.Es  el segundo préstamo de Efraín con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos y espera serlo ahora también. En su banco comunal, es un socio muy responsable y siempre esta al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en el grupo.Efraín tiene planeado invertir  los dos mil soles solicitados, en la compra de  abono e insecticidas, para sus tierras, y espera mejorar su producción.
texts.en: Efraín, age 32, is a very simple and hard-working man. He lives in his own house, together with his wife Noria (29) and his three small children, for whom he wants to provide a better quality of life. By working very hard, Efraín has been able to make his fields very fertile and productive. Every day, he works in his fields with dedication, constantly improving his crops. He takes his harvest to sell at the wholesale market of the city of Pichanaki, where he generally receives very good earnings. What he likes most about his work is cultivating his crops. He has done this work for six years already, and he thinks the hardest part is transporting his products to distant areas. Over time, he hopes to buy new land to expand his plantings and increase his earnings. This is Efraín's second loan with MFP; he has been very punctual with his previous payments and he plans to continue in the same way. In his communal bank, he is a very responsible member who always keeps up to date with the agreements made by the group. Efraín plans to invest the two thousand Peruvian soles he is requesting in buying fertilizer and insecticides for his fields, and he hopes to improve his production.

loans.use: Buying fertilizer and insecticides to improve his crops

loans.name: Kayira Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe KAYIRA est composé des femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 24 ans et 1 enfant. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies avec leurs frères, sœurs, co-épouses, enfants et époux. Ces femmes résident dans le quartier Hérémakono-centre de la ville de BOUGOUNI, (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
A travers les relations de commerce et de parenté elles se sont connues. 
Dans l’intention de faire le stock afin de traiter avec les grossistes, elles ont décidé d’adhérer à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur sixième prêt de groupe et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt Salimata BAGNA S., compte acheter,600Kg de maïs, 400kg de petit mil et 200kg de fonio auprès des fournisseurs de des villages environnants de Bougouni. Elle effectue sa vente en détail et en gros, au comptant et à crédit, dans le marché de Bougouni. 
Avec ce prêt Salimata BAGNA S. compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 35.000 FCFA  qui sera utilisé dans  son activité.
texts.en:
The KAYIRA loan group is made up of married women who are on average 24 years old and have 1 child. They live in large traditional married families, including their brothers, sisters co-spouses, children and husband. These women live in the Heremakono neighborhood in the center of the city of Bougouni. (Third administrative district in the Republic of Mail). They came to know each other through common business and family ties.

They become involved with the Soro Yiriwaso Microfinance bank with the intention of increasing their stocks buy buying through wholesalers. This is their sixth group loan and all their previous loans have been duly repaid.

With tthis new loan Samimata Bagna S. plans to buy 600 kg of corn, 400 kg of millet and 200 kg of fonio from suppliers in the villages around Bougouni. They will resell their products at retail and in wholesale volumes, for cash or credit, at the market in Bououni. With this loan Samimata Bagna S. will earn an income of 35,000 FCFA which will be used in her business.

loans.use: To purchase supplies of cereals

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sabougnouma est composé de trois femmes mariées et d’une   célibataire, ayant une moyenne d’âge de 26 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies avec leurs frères, sœurs, co-épouses, enfants et époux. Ces femmes résident dans le quartier Torakabougou de la ville de BOUGOUNI, (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Ces  femmes se sont connues par des relations de commerce, de parenté et de voisinage. 
Dans le souci d’avoir un font de roulement et faire beaucoup d’achat, elles ont décidé d’adhérer à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et cela pour faire le commerce d’habits et de chaussures tel ADIARA C.. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de groupe et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Avec ce  prêt ADIARA C., compte acheter, 40 paires de chaussures de qualités différentes pour les femmes et les enfants. 
Elle s’approvisionne auprès des grossistes de Bamako pour les revendre  en détail et en gros, au comptant et à crédit, dans le marché de Bougouni. 
Avec ce prêt ADIARA C. espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 70.000 FCFA  qui sera utilisé dans leurs activités.
texts.en:
The Sabougnouma group is made up of three married women and one single woman; they average 26 years of age with an average of two children each. They live in traditional extended families with their brothers, sisters, co-wives, children and husbands. These women live in the Torakabougou neighborhood of the town of Bougouni (the Republic of Mali's third administrative region). They met each other through business contacts, relatives and neighbors. 

With a view to having a good working capital and buying large quantities of goods, they decided to join the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso. Some of the women, such as Adiara C., aim to trade in clothes and shoes. They are on their fifth group loan and all the previous loans have been repaid in full.

With this loan, Adiara C. is planning to buy 40 pairs of differing quality shoes for women and children. She gets her supplies from wholesalers in Bamako to resell them retail and wholesale, for cash and on credit in the market at Bougouni. With this loan Mrs C. is hoping to make a monthly profit of 70,000FCFA, which will be used for her business.

loans.use: Purchase of shoes

loans.name: Eladio

texts.es: Eladio, de 51 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Isabel (49)  y sus tres pequeños  hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida.La avanzada edad de Eladio, no ha sido un impedimento, para que con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación haya podido sobresalir en la vida, él heredo hace muchos años, unas tierras de sus padres, las cuales trabajó y cuidó muy bien, gracias a esto su café, plátano y cacao que siembra se están vendiendo muy bien en el mercado de la ciudad de Pichanaki. Lo que más le gusta de sus trabajos es que los administra él solo, y ya lleva 25 años trabajando en agricultura y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus tierras. Con el tiempo, espera que sus cultivos  aumenten y se convierta en una de las más importantes de la zona.Este es el segundo préstamo de Eladio con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente si desea acceder a otro crédito posteriormente. En su banco comunal, es un socio muy participativo.Eladio tiene planeado invertir  los mil soles solicitados en la compra de abono y fertilizantes, que necesita para mejorar la productividad de sus tierras.
texts.en: Eladio, 51 years old, is a very simple and happy man. He lives in his own house along with his wife Isabel (49) and his three small children, to whom he wants to bring a better quality of life. The advanced age of Eladio has not been an impediment. With a lot of effort and dedication he has been able to excel in life. Many years ago he inherited some land from his father on which he worked and took good care of. Thanks to this, the coffee, banana, and cocoa that he plants is selling very well in the market in the city of Pichanaki. What he most likes about his work is that he administrates it alone. He has been working in agriculture for 25 years and considers the most difficult thing to be fumigating his land. In time, he hopes that his crops increase and become one of the most important in the zone. This is the second loan for Eladio with MFP. He knows that he has to make his payments punctually if he wants to have access to another loan subsequently. He is a very participatory member of his communal bank. Eladio has planned to invest the thousand soles he is requesting in the purchase of organic and chemical fertilizers, which he needs to improve the productivity of his land.

loans.use: To buy organic and chemical fertilizers to improve his crops

loans.name: Virgen De Chapi De Yanacoto Group

texts.es: “Virgen D. Chapi D. Yanacoto”, es una D. las Alcancías más unidas que tenemos en nuestra agencia ellos trabajan desD. hace 6 años con EDAPROSPO, una D. las integrantes más  antiguas D. este grupo es Basilia, ella tiene 48 años D. edad es madre soltera tiene cuatro hijos y uno D. ellos es aún menor D. edad, Basilia se dedica a distintas labores como: vender pedidos D. ropa, venta D. cebiche y frutas, todas estas labores las realiza como ambulante. Además D. estas actividades, también realiza trabajos D. bisutería(collares,pulsera),  el pequeño ingreso que percibe D. estas labores le ayudan a cubrir los gastos D. educación D. su menor  hijo y los gastos D. las casa. Ella solicitó el préstamo a EDAPROSPO con la finalidad D. comprar materiales D. bisutería (muranos, ojo D. gato, piedras naturales, elástico y algodón) para hacer pulseras, collares que le solicitaron sus clientes, también buzos y camisas para la campaña escolar. A Basilia le gustaría mejorar la construcción D. su casa y para así poder tener un puesto D. trabajo propio. En la fotografía se pueD. apreciar a las 8 integrantes más  el esposo D. la Sra. Inés, él la acompaña a todas partes para ayudarla a movilizarse ya que ella tiene una pequeña discapacidad.
texts.en:
“Virgen D. Chapi D. Yanacoto” is one of the most united community banks that we have in our agency.  The members have been working with EDAPROSPO for 6 years.  One of the longest-standing members of this group is 48 year-old Basilia.  Basilia is a single mother with four children, one of whom is still a minor.  She works in a number of business activities such as: selling clothes to order, selling 'cebiche' (marinated fish) and selling fruit.  She makes all of her sales as an itinerant street vendor.  She also makes jewelry (necklaces and bracelets).  The small income she makes from this work helps her to cover her youngest son's education expenses and her household expenses.

Basilia requested her loan from EDAPROSPO in order to buy jewelry materials (murano glass, cat's-eyes, natural stones, elastic and cotton) for making bracelets and necklaces that her customers have requested from her.  She will also make sportswear and shirts for the back-to-school season.

Basilia would like to improve her home so that she can have her own work space.  In the photo you can see the 8 members of the group and Inés' husband who goes everywhere with her in order to help her get about since she has a small disability.

loans.use: To buy materials for making jewelry, sportswear and shirts for the back-to-school season

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes que compose le groupe BENKADI sont toutes mariées et ont une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales nucléaires avec leurs  époux et enfants. Ces femmes résident dans le quartier Torakabougou de la ville de BOUGOUNI, (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles se sont connues par des relations de commerce, et de voisinage. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire leurs clientèles et augmenter la taille de leur entreprise, elles ont décidé d’adhérer à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et cela pour faire le commerce des chaussures, des pagnes et des condiments tel  COUMBA D..
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de groupe et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt COUMBA D., compte acheter, 5 sacs de 25kg de sel, 20 boites de 2kg de tomate concentré, 40 paquets de 100 morceaux de cube maggi.
 Elle s’approvisionne auprès des grossistes de Bamako. La vente se fait en détail et en gros, au comptant et à crédit, dans le marché de Torakabougou et à son domicile.
Avec ce prêt COUMBA D. espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40.000 FCFA  dont une partie sera utilisée dans son entreprise et l’autre partie pour appuyer son époux à surmonter les dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
The women of the group named Benkadi are all married and have an average age of 34. They each have 4 children. They live in conjugal families with their husband and children. These women live in the quarter of Torakabougou in the village of Bougouni (third administrative region in the Republic of Mali). They are known through business relationships and as neighbors.

With the goal of satisfying their clients to make their business grow they have decided to join the microfinance institution of Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner). They sell shoes, cloth saris, and condiments as is the case of Coumba D.. They are on their fourth group loan with the previous loans having been successfully repaid. 

Coumba D. plans on the purchase of five 25Kg sacks of salt, twenty 2Kg boxes of tomato paste, and forty boxes of 100 pieces each of Maggi cubes.

She makes her purchases from the wholesalers in the Bamako market. She sells in retail and in wholesale, completing the sales in both cash and credit in the Torakabougou market and from her home. 

With the help of her loan, Coumba D. expects to earn a monthly income of 40.000FCFA. A part of her income will be invested in her business, and another part will be used to contribute with her husband to meet their family's expenses.

loans.use: To purchase condiments.

loans.name: Eliazar

texts.es: Eliazar, de 25 años, es un joven muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Rina (19) y sus dos pequeños hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida.La actividad a la que se dedica es el cultivo de café y plátano, las plantaciones que posee, lo han convertido en un gran productor. Sus productos los vende en la ciudad de Pichanaki, donde ya tiene compradores fijos, ya que sus productos son de muy buena calidad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar el café y lo hace con mucho empeño, ya lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus plantaciones de las plagas que pueden afectarlas. En el futuro, desea comprar un carro nuevo, en el cual podrá  transportar sus productos sin dificultad.Este es el segundo préstamo de Eliazar con MFP, está dispuesto a pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y para eso ya está empezando a ahorrar. En su banco comunal es un socio muy alegre y siempre esta muy al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en sus reuniones.Con los ochocientos  soles solicitados, contratará peones para que lo ayuden en el cultivo de sus tierras, de esta manera espera continuar sin problemas.
texts.en:
Eliazar is 25 years old.  He is a very simple and hard-working young man who lives in his own home together with his wife Rina (19) and his two young children for whom he would like to provide a better quality of life.

Eliazar grows coffee and bananas.  He owns some plantations and has become a big producer.  He sells his produce in the town of Pichanaki where he has regular buyers since his products are good quality.  What he most likes about his work is sowing his coffee and he does this with a lot of dedication.  He has been in this business for 3 years and he considers the most difficult part of his work to be protecting his plantations from the pests that can affect them.  In the future, Eliazar would like to buy a new car which he could use to transport his produce without difficulty.

This is Eliazar's second loan with MFP and he is prepared to make his repayments punctually and he is already beginning to save so that he can do this.  Eliazar is a very happy member of his community bank and he is always very much up to date with all the agreements that are reached during the meetings.  Eliazar will use the 800 Peruvian soles he has requested to hire laborers to help him with his crops.  In this way, he hopes to continue working without problems.

loans.use: To pay the wages of laborers who will help with his crops

loans.name: Miriam Marlene

texts.es: Miriam Marlene R. C. de 37 años de edad, reside en Sensuntepeque, ubicado en el departamento de Cabañas, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como agricultor, y así mismo junto a cuatro hijos. Miriam posee una venta de ropa para caballeros, mujeres y niños, la cual comercializa en el mercado de Sensuntepeque, lugar en el cual se ha dedicado a este oficio desde hace varios años atrás. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar ropa por mayor, de manera que surta su negocio para este año que esta por iniciar de manera que su producto llame mucho la atención a nuevos clientes. De esta manera Miriam espera aumentar sus ventas y mejorar su estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Miriam Marlene R. C. is 37 years old and lives in Sensuntepeque, in Cabañas department.  She lives together with her husband, who works as a farmer, and her four children.  Miriam has a clothes stall where she sells men's, women's and children's clothes.  She makes her sales in Sensuntepeque market and has worked in her business there for several years.

Miriam is requesting a loan so that she can buy clothes wholesale and stock her business for this year which is about to begin.  She wants her products attract the attention of new customers.  In this way, Miriam hopes to increase her sales and improve her financial stability.

loans.use: To buy a variety of clothes to sell

loans.name: María Vilma

texts.es: María Vilma C. P. de 34 años de edad, es una persona muy trabajadora, quien se dedica de lleno a su negocio, todo con el único deseo de salir adelante y de esta manera brindarle una vida mejor a sus cinco hijos, todos menores de edad. María vive junto a su esposo e hijos en  el departamento de San Salvador. Ella posee una venta de frutas y verduras, la cual esta ubicada en el centro de San Salvador, en donde desde hace 12 años que se dedica a vender estos productos, su esposo le ayuda con el negocio, cargando todos los objetos pesados y así mismo a atender a sus clientes, los cuales son varios. María solicita un préstamo a Integral con el deseo de poder aumentar la cantidad de frutas y verduras, ya que de esta manera ella podrá vender más, lo cual es su prioridad, ya que de esta manera podrá darles una vida mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
María Vilma C. P. is 34 years old.  She is a very hard-working person who is fully committed to her business.  Her sole desire is to get ahead in life and, in this way, provide her five dependent children with a better life.

María lives with her husband and children in San Salvador department.  She owns a fruit and veg stall in the center of San Salvador where she has been selling her products for 12 years.  Her husband helps her with the business, loading heavy objects and serving her many customers.

María is requesting a loan from Integral as she would like to increase her quantity of fruit and vegetables as this will enable her to sell more which is her priority since, in this way, she can provide her children with a better life.

loans.use: To buy fruit and veg wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fabric, thread and needles to make clothes

loans.name: Elmer

texts.es: Elmer, de 30 años, es un hombre muy amable y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Luz (40)  y sus dos pequeños hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor educaciónElmer se dedica al cultivo de café y plátanos. Todos los días por la mañana trabaja en su cultivo, ya que sabe que el dinero que obtenga por sus productos dependerá mucho de la calidad de su cosecha. Él comercializa  sus productos en el mercado de Pichanaki puesto que es donde mejor le pagan y tiene compradores fijos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que los meses de trabajo han tenido sus frutos, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus tierras, puesto que siempre hay el peligro de que los químicos lo enfermen. Para más adelante tiene planeado  mejorar sus cultivos, para mejorar sus  ingresos.Es el  segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y manifiesta que el dinero del crédito le ayudara mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es muy querido por el resto de sus compañeras, ya que es muy solidario con todos.Elmer tiene planeado invertir los  dos mil soles solicitados en la compra de  insecticidas, ya que desea tener unos campos libres de plagas y espera  mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Elmer is 30 years old.  He is a very kind and hard-working man who lives in his own home together with his wife Luz (40) and hios two small children for whom he would like to provide a better education.

Elmer grows coffee and bananas.  Every morning he starts work on his crops since he knows that the money he makes for his produce depends a lot on the quality of his harvest.  He sells his products in Pichanaki market since that is where people pay him the most and he has regular buyers.  What he most likes about his work is harvesting his crops since that is when he feels that the months of work have borne fruit.  He has been in this business for 10 years and he considers the most difficult part of his work to be spraying his land since he knows that there is a danger that the chemicals will make him ill.  In the future, he is planning to improve his crops to improve his profits.

This is Elmer's second loan with MFP and he says that the loan money will help him a lot in making progress in his work.  He is a very well-liked member of his community bank because he is very supportive of the other members.  Elmer plans to invest the 2,000 Peruvian soles he has requested in buying insecticides since he would like to have his land free from pests and he hopes to improve his crops.

loans.use: To buy insecticides to improve his crops

loans.name: María Esperanza

texts.es: María Esperanza P. C. de 52 años de edad, reside en Santa Anita, en el departamento de San Salvador, en donde vive únicamente junto a su padre de avanzada edad. María es una señora muy trabajadora, quien posee una venta de mariscos en el mercado de San Jacinto, en el mismo departamento. María posee muchos clientes, gracias a los cuales posee un negocio bastante estable, lo que es muy bueno para ella ya que es esta la única fuente de ingresos con la que cuenta para vivir. María solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor variedad de mariscos, los cuales son muy bien vendidos, de esta manera María desea hacer crecer su negocio y así mismo contar con una vida estable junto a sus padres.
texts.en:
María Esperanza P. C. is 52 years old.  She lives in Santa Ana, in San Salvador department, together with her elderly father.

María is a very hard-working lady who owns a seafood stall in San Jacinto market, in the same department.  María has a lot of customers, thanks to whom she has a very stable business.  This is very good for her since hers is the only source of income on which she has to live.  María is requesting a loan so that she has the money she needs to buy a bigger variety of seafood, which sell well.  In this way, María would like to grow her business and also be able to live a stable life together with her parents.

loans.use: To buy seafood to sell

location.town: Santa Anita, departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
This is 27-year-old Salamatu T.. She is married and has two children ages 4 and 6. 

In 2000, Salamatu T. established her local goods business, selling palm oil, pepper, rice and bananas. She began her business because she wanted to be self-employed and sustain herself. Working seven days a week and seven hours a day, she earns about  250,000 SLL every month. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL in order to increase business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 300,000 SLL. 

In the future, Salamatu plans to educate her children, help her husband to support their family, and buy additional goods in larger quantities to sell in a nearby town or city. She thanks you for your support

loans.use: To buy additional palm oil

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Marcelina M. D. R. D. 46 años D. edad, vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos menores D. edad, quienes se dedican a estudiar. Ella resiD. en San Jacinto, en el departamento D. San Salvador, en donD. vive junto a su familia. Marcelina posee un comedor, en el cual trabaja D. lunes a sábado, en el cual sus ventas son bastante estables, ya que esta rodeada D. colegios y fábricas, cuyos empleados y estudiantes consumen sus alimentos, ya que Marcelina comercializa desayunos, almuerzos y así mismo diferentes tipos D. bebidas y golosinas. Debido a que cuenta con varios clientes Marcelina posee una persona quien le ayuda a elaborar los alimentos y quien le ayuda a atender a sus clientes. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. frutas, verduras,  bebidas y golosinas, con las cuales tenga mucho más productos que ofrecer y D. esta manera incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Marcelina M. D. R. is 46 years old.  She lives in San Jacinto, in San Salvador department with her husband and her two dependent children who are studying.

Marcelina owns an eatery where she works from Monday to Saturday.  Her sales are quite stable since she is surrounded by schools and factories whose employees and students eat her food.  Marcelina sells breakfasts, lunches and also different types of drinks and candy.  As she has a number of customers, Marcelina employs another person to help her prepare the food and serve her customers.

Marcelina is requesting this loan so that she can buy a larger quantity of fruit, vegetables, drinks and candy so that she has more products to offer and can, in this way, increase her sales.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, drinks and candy to sell

location.town: San Jacinto , departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “AHORRO ES PROGRESO CHOQUETATA – TIPON”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Tipon en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Silvia; La socia tiene 54 años de edad, es conviviente; la socia tiene 3 hijos, la socia trabaja administrando un restaurante, ella tiene un pequeño restaurante en Oropesa, la socia desea el crédito para poder implementar su restaurante con la compra de insumos como aceite, arroz, azúcar, fideos al por mayor, estos productos básicos son los que salen a diario, la socia también comprara una mesa con sus 4 sillas. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de insumos e implementar su restaurante.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Silvia is a member of the "AHORRO ES PROGRESO CHOQUETATA – TIPON” (Saving Means Progress Choquetata - Tipon) community bank which is located in Tipon district, in Cusco province and department.

Silvia is 54 years old.  She lives with her partner and has 3 children.  Silvia runs a small restaurant that she owns in Oropesa.  She would like this loan so that she can keep her restaurant running by purchasing supplies such as oil, rice, sugar and noddles wholesale.  These basic products are those which she uses every day.  She will also buy a table and four chairs.  Silvia is requesting this loan to invest in buying supplies and in keeping her restaurant running.

Silvia is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To invest in buying supplies to keep her restaurant running

loans.name: Anita Antonia

texts.es:
Anita es una madre de familia de 49 años de edad que reside junto a su familia en el distrito de San Pedro de Lloc, una zona agrícola que pertenece a la provincia de Pacasmayo y que se encuentra situada en la región La Libertad, a más de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Anita se dedica a trabajar vendiendo frutas y verduras en un puesto ambulante situado en uno de los centros de abasto más concurridos de su localidad. Allí ella ofrece a sus clientes diversas verduras frescas y frutas de estación atendiéndolos siempre con un trato amable y servicial. Su negocio cuenta actualmente con un grupo de clientes fieles que siempre recurren a su establecimiento para agenciarse de los productos que ofrece. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad le sirven para ayudar a su familia a salir adelante y progresar.

Anita desea surtir su negocio adquiriendo más verduras y frutas de estación de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda con la que actualmente cuenta, así también desea  aumentar sus ventas y percibir mayores ingresos que le permitan progresar. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Anita is a 49 year old mother.  She lives with her family in the San Pedro de Lloc district.  It is an agricultural zone in the Pacasmayo province in the La Libertad region.  It is over two hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

Anita works selling fruits and vegetables as a street vendor at one of the busiest markets in the area.  She offers her customers different fresh vegetables and seasonal fruit.  She always gives her customers kind and helpful service.  Her business now has a group of loyal customers who always return to her establishment to get the products that she sells.  

The income that she gets from this business activity is used to help her family get ahead and progress.  

Anita wishes to stock her business by getting more vegetables and seasonal fruit.  That way she will be able to meet the demand that she currently has.  Also, she wishes to increase her sales and get greater income, which will allow her to make progress.  In order to achieve her objective, she has seen the need to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1,000 soles.

loans.use: To get more vegetables and seasonal fruit

location.town: San Pedro de Lloc - Pacasmayo - La Libertad

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia tiene 39 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en uno de los caseríos que conforman el distrito agrícola de Mórrope, una zona poblada por gente humilde y bastante trabajadora que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar confeccionando diversas prendas de vestir en base a pedidos. Ella cuenta con un pequeño taller de costura instalado en su domicilio, allí ella confecciona camisas, blusas y pantalones en base a los pedidos que le realizan sus vecinos y eventualmente un acopiador que le hace pedidos de confección al por mayor. Ella complementa su trabajo ofreciendo el servicio de reparación de prendas de vestir dañadas. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad le sirven para ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Eugenia desea adquirir materiales como telas e hilos para poder ampliar su negocio y aumentar sus ventas. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles con los cuales espera lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Eugenia is 39 years old and married.  She lives with her husband and her children in one of the settlements that make up the Mórrope agricultural district.  It is a zone populated by humble and very hard-working people.  It is in the Lambayeque province, which is over an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

She works making different articles of clothing by order.  She has a small seamstress shop set up in her home.  She makes shirts, blouses, and pants by orders from her neighbors.  Sometimes retailers place wholesale orders with her.  She compliments her work by offering repair service for damaged garments.

The income that she gets from this business activity helps her to assist her husband keep up with the family finances.

Eugenia wishes to get materials like fabric and thread to be able to expand her business and increase her sales.  Therefore, she believes it is advisable to request a loan from Edpyme Alternative for 1,000.  With the loan she hopes to achieve her objective.

loans.use: To get materials like fabric and thread to be able to expand her business

loans.name: Erly

texts.es: Erly, de 32 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su querida esposa Margot (20)  y su pequeño hijo, a quien desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida.En los años que tiene de vida, Erly nunca le huyo al trabajo y es que desde muy joven laboro en todo lo que pudo. Ahora el tiene sus chacras, las cuales le dan los ingresos que necesita para mantener a su familia, paralelamente a esta actividad también ha  logrado instalar  una pequeña tienda, la cual es muy concurrida por todos sus vecinos, ya que ha puesto todo su esfuerzo en surtirla bien. Lo que más le gusta de su negocio  es que siente que les brinda un servicio muy útil a sus vecinos, lleva 1 año con la tienda y considera que lo más difícil es permanecer largas horas dentro de su negocio. Con el tiempo, espera ampliar las instalaciones de su tienda para ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor comodidad.Es el primer préstamo de Erly con MFP y espera ser muy puntual en sus pagos, es de los pocos varones de su banco comunal, por lo cual es muy querido por el resto de las socias.Erly tiene planeado invertir  los mil soles solicitados en la compra de mayor cantidad de  productos para implementar mejor su tienda; de esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Erly, age 32, is a very unassuming and hard-working man.  He lives in his own house with his beloved wife, Margot (20), and their small child.  He wants to give his child a better quality of life.  During his whole life he has never run away from work.  Ever since he was very young he has worked in everything he could.  Now he has his farm, which gives him the income he needs to support his family.

In addition to this business activity he has managed to establish a small store.  The store is very popular with all of his neighbors because he has put all of his effort into stocking it well.  What he likes most about the business is that he feels that he offers a very useful service to his neighbors.  He has had the store for one year.  He feels that the most difficult part is having to stay inside the store for long hours.

In time he hopes to expand his store’s facilities in order to make his customers more comfortable.

This is Erly’s first loan with MFP.  He plans to be very punctual with his payments.  He is one of the few men in his communal bank, and he is very well-liked by the other members.  

He plans to use the 1,000 soles that he has requested to buy a greater quantity of products to better stock his store.  This way he plans to have improved income.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to better stock his store

loans.name: Angel Eduardo

texts.es:
Ángel tiene 33 años de edad y vive junto a su esposa e hija de 6 años de edad. Juntos residen en el distrito de Paiján, una zona agrícola y comercial que se encuentra localizada en la provincia de Ascope, región La Libertad, a más de dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

El cuenta con un negocio de alquiler de trajes y disfraces para todo público. Su negocio tiene bastante acogida ya que es bastante conocido en el rubro, además su local de atención se encuentra situado cerca del centro de su distrito. El nos comenta que la temporada en la que cuenta con más pedidos es durante la temporada escolar. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad le sirven para sacar adelante la economía de su familia.

Ángel desea adquirir más trajes y disfraces para poder contar con un surtido stock durante la próxima temporada escolar. El desea adquirir su mercadería durante estas fechas ya que el precio suele ser bajo. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Ángel is 33 years old.  He lives with his wife and six year old daughter in the Paiján district.  It is an agricultural and commercial zone in the Ascope province in the La Libertad region.  It is over two and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

He has a business of renting outfits and costumes to the public.  His business is well-received because it is well-known in the area.  Also, the place where he waits on customers is located close to the center of his district.  He tells us that he gets the most orders during the school year.  The income he gets from this business activity helps him to get ahead with the family finances.

Ángel wishes to get more outfits and costumes to be able to be well-stocked during the next school season.  He wishes to get more merchandise during these times because the price is generally lower.  In order to achieve his objective he believes it is advisable to request a loan from Edpyme Alternative for 1,500 soles.

loans.use: To get more outfits and costumes to be able to be well-stocked during the next school season

loans.name: Magali Rosmery

texts.es:
Magali tiene 29 años de edad, es soltera y tiene un hijo dependiente. Reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Mórrope, una zona agrícola y comercial que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra ubicada a más de cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.
