Se dedica a la comercialización de prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños. Ella adquiere su mercadería en la ciudad de Chiclayo y la ofrece a sus clientes en calidad de pedido. Adicionalmente vende productos cosméticos por catálogo entre sus clientes: ella les toma el pedido y la empresa abastecedora se los envía cada fin de mes. Los ingresos que logra percibir de estas actividades los utiliza para sacar adelante a su menor hijo y ayudar a su familia a solventar sus gastos.

Magali desea adquirir ropa de la temporada de verano para poder ampliar su negocio y aumentar sus ventas percibiendo a la vez  mayores ganancias que le permitan seguir progresando y ayudando a su familia a salir adelante. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Magali is 29 years old, single and has one child dependent on her. She lives together with her family in the Mórrope district, a farming and commercial zone that belongs to the province Lambayeque and is found, at most, 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She sells clothing for women, men and children. She acquires her quality merchandise in the city of Chiclayo and offers it to her clients upon their request. Additionally, she sells cosmetic products through a catalogue amongst her clients. She takes their order and the supply company sends the products at the end of the month. She uses the income she makes through these activities to move her youngest son forward and to help cover her family's expenses. 

Magali wishes to acquire summer clothing in order to be able to expand her business and raise her sales, increasing her profits in order to allow her to continue progressing and helping her family move forward. In order to achieve this goal, she has confidently put her trust in asking Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 nuevo soles ($375 USD).

loans.use: To obtain summer clothing in order to be able to expand her business.

loans.name: Jappo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité JAPPO est créé depuis l'inauguration du Banc Villageois qui l'abrite, il y a de cela 2 ans et demi. Il est composé de 23 femmes qui habitent le même quartier et pratiquent la même activité; le petit commerce. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de CITE LAMY

Madame SEYNABOU T. debout au milieux de la photo, les mains aux hanches et mise en médaillon est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 55 ans. Elle est veuve et mère de 06 enfants en charge.

Elle pratique le petit commerce plus précisément la vente de produits divers tels des tissus, des colliers en perles etc. 

La somme de 200.000 franc CFA qu'elle a reçu en financement seront destinés intégralement à l'achat de marchandises

Avec les bénéfices que son petit commerce va générer elle va prendre payer les fournitures scolaires  de ses enfants, la nourriture et éventuellement les frais médicaux en cas de maladie.
texts.en:
The group named Jappo was formed at the same time their communal bank was formed two and a half years ago. It is made up of 23 women who live in the same quarter and carry out the same activity, a small business. The group is a member organization to the communal bank Cite Lamy (Kiva Field Partner). 

Mrs. Seynabou T. is the leader of the group. She is pictured standing towards the middle of the photograph with her hands on her hips, and her image is reproduced above the crowd. She is 55 years old, she is a widow, and she is the mother of 6 children who are in her care.

She has a small business selling a variety of articles such as fabrics, pearl necklaces, etc.

The sum of 200.000FCFA that she received will be used exclusively for the purchase of merchandise.

With the income that she earns from her small business she will be able to afford the school supplies for her children, food, and in the event of an illness, health care expenses.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Euladia

texts.es: Euladia, de 23 años, es una joven muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Noel (24)  y su pequeña hija, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida.Los largos días de trabajo que tiene en sus tierras, han hecho que se vuelva una gran conocedora de la agricultura, los plátanos y el café que cultiva, están muy bien cuidados y siempre consigue un buen precio por la venta de sus productos naturales. Además le gusta cultivar la tierra, ya que es la actividad que realiza desde hace cuatro  años realizando y considera que lo más difícil  es transportar sus productos hasta el mercado de la ciudad de Pichanaki, pues es algo lejano a su zona. Para el futuro  espera comprar más tierras y así incrementar su producción.Este es el tercer préstamo de Euladia con MFP y esta ahorrando para pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde se siente muy contenta.Euladia tiene planeado invertir  los quinientos soles solicitados en la compra de  abono e insecticidas, para cuidar sus tierras, de esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Euladia is 23 years old. She is a humble and hardworking young woman. She lives in her own house with her husband Noel (24), and their young daughter, to whom she wants to offer a better quality of life. Her long work days on her land have made her into a person who knows a lot about agriculture. The plantains and coffee that she plants are well cared for and she always gets a good sale price for her natural products. She likes growing crops, and she has been doing this activity for four years. She considers the most difficult thing to be transporting her products to the market in the city of Pichanaki, which is a little far away from her area. In the future she hopes to buy more land and thus increase her production. This is Eudalia's  third loan with MFP and she is saving to be able to make her payments, since she doesn't want to cause any problems for the other members of her community bank, where she is very happy. Euladia is planning on investing the five hundred soles she has asked for in buying fertilizer ad insecticide to care for her land. In this way, she hopes to improve her earnings.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide to improve her crops.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es: Gregorio, de 49 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Fidelia (50) y su joven hijo, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida.Cuando era niño, los padres de Gregorio le enseñaron todo lo que debía saber de la chacra y poco a poco a medida que pasaba el tiempo, él se fue encargando de las tierras de sus padres. Ahora tiene extensas tierras de cultivo, en las cuales cosecha café y plátanos, y luego las comercializa en el mercado de la ciudad de Pichanaki. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras, ya que es la actividad que le da de comer a su familia; y ya lleva 12 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil consiste en cuidar sus productos de las plagas, es por esta razón que labora con mucha dedicación. Desea con muchas ganas, comprarse un carro, con el cual pueda transportar sus productos.Este es el sétimo préstamo de Gregorio con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas y promete serlo en esta ocasión. En su banco comunal es un socio muy solidario con el resto de sus compañeras.Gregorio tiene planeado invertir  los quinientos soles solicitados en la compra de mayor cantidad de  abono que necesita para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Gregorio, age 49 años, is a very humble and hard-working man who lives in his own home with his wife Fidelia (50) and his young child, to whom he wants to offer a better quality of life. When he was a child, Gregorio's parents taught him everything he needed to know about farming. Bit by bit, with the passing of time, he has taken over his parents' land.

He now has vast farmlands, in which he cultivates coffee and bananas. He later sells them in the Pichanaki city market. He most enjoys working his lands, as this is the work that provides his family with food. He has been doing this work for 12 years, and he finds that his greatest challenge is keeping his crops safe from plagues. For this reason, he works with a great deal of dedication.

He really wants to buy a car with which to transport his products. This is his seventh loan from MFP, and he has always been very punctual in the payments of his quotas. He promises to be so again with this loan. In his community bank, he is very united with the rest of the members. Gregorio plans to invest the requested 500 soles in the purchase of a larger quantity of fertilizer, which he needs to improve his crops.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to improve his crops

loans.name: Rosa Esther

texts.es:
Rosa es una madre de familia de 28 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus tres hijos en uno de los caseríos que conforman el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona semitropical que se caracteriza por producir principalmente frutas como mango y limón. La localidad pertenece a la región Piura y se encuentra situada a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar en actividades relacionadas con la crianza y venta de animales. Ella cría ganado ovino y vacuno en algunos corrales situados cerca a su domicilio, los engorda alimentándoles de pastos naturales y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta al público en general  y a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Adicionalmente comercializa entre sus vecinos la leche que producen sus animales. Esta actividad le permite ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Rosa desea adquirir alimento balanceado para mejorar la crianza de sus animales y lograr que se desarrollen de mejor modo. Con ello logrará percibir mayores ingresos por sus ventas, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 28-year-old mother who lives with her husband and three children in one of the hamlets that make up the Tambogrande agricultural district, a semitropical zone known for mainly producing fruits such as mango and lemon. This area belongs to the Piura region and is located more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region.

She works in activities related to raising and selling animals. She raises sheep and cattle in corrals located near to her home. She fattens them up with natural foods. When the animals have reached a good level of development, she offers them for sale to the general public and to the businesspeople who normally visit her area. She also sells the animals' milk to her neighbours. This work allows her to help her husband with the family's costs.

Rosa wants to acquire balanced food to improve the raising of her animals and allow them to develop better. With this loan, she will achieve a better income from her sales. In order to achieve her goal she has decided to request a loan of 500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To acquire balanced food to improve the raising of her animals, so that they will develop better.

loans.name: Eva María

texts.es:
Eva es una madre de familia de 40 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus dos menores hijos en uno de los caseríos que conforman el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona semitropical que se caracteriza por producir principalmente frutas como mango y limón. La localidad pertenece a la región Piura y se encuentra situada a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de útiles escolares y artículos de escritorio en una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio, el negocio tiene como principales clientes a los estudiantes de la zona, que siempre acuden a su establecimiento porque pone al alcance de sus manos artículos que siempre necesitan y por los cuales tendrían que ir hasta el pueblo central para adquirirlos.

El negocio es una fuente importante de ingresos para su familia ya que gracias a el ayuda a su esposo, que es maestro panadero, con el sostenimiento de los gastos familiares. Es por eso que ella trata de mantener su negocio del mejor modo posible. Actualmente desea ir surtiendo su negocio con más artículos de modo que esté preparada para afrontar la demanda que se presente durante la temporada escolar, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Eva María ya ha tenido un crédito financiado por el fondo Kiva a través de Edpyme Alternativa y de su producto Capital Semilla. En aquella oportunidad también pudo ampliar su negocio y gracias a ello su demanda y ventas aumentaron. Ella se encuentra bastante agradecida con los prestamistas de Kiva que le ayudaron a salir adelante.
texts.en:
Eva is a 40 year-old mother who lives together with her husband and two dependent children in one of the villages that make up the agricultural district of Tambogrande, a semi-tropical area that is noted for mainly producing fruit such as mangoes and lemons.  It is located in Piura region, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque province.

Eva sells school supplies and writing supplies from a small store in her home.  Her main customers are students from the area who always come to her establishment because she is able to supply them with items that they need and which they would otherwise have to go to the central town to acquire.

Eva's business is an important source of income for her family since, thanks to it, she is able to help her husband, who is a master baker, to cover their family's expenses.  For this reason, she tries to maintain her business as well as possible.  She would currently like to stock her business with more items so that she is ready to meet the demand that she will have during the school season.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 800 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which will help her achieve her goal.

Eva has already had a loan from Kiva through Edpyme Alternativa and their 'seed money program'.  With that loan she was able to expand her business and, as a result, her demand and her sales increased.  She is grateful to the Kiva lenders who helped her to get ahead.

loans.use: To acquire items to stock her business

loans.name: Flor Del Sol 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Christella lives with her only child in a small rural town in the Dominican Republic. She runs a small business selling new clothes and shoes from her home, and occasionally she sells her merchandise on the streets of her community. She has been in this business for a year. Starting with some savings, she decided to invest in clothing sales because this is the kind of merchandise most people need.

Christella began her association with Esperanza International Dominican Republic because she was in need of capital, as were her group members and their families. Her story is representative generally of her group and of Esperanza's Dominican and Haitian clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti. Her group is located in the town of Hato Mayor whose economy depends on farming. It is one of the most rural towns in the Dominican Republic. In this town, as in many others, there is a population of Dominicans and Haitian emigrants as well as a scarcity of potable water and electricity.

Christella is requesting a loan to buy a better selection of clothes and shoes to sell. It is her goal to own her own store where she can offer more variety in her merchandise. Christella is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza. She hopes to provide for herself and her child while doing business and, within a few years, save up enough to buy her own home.

loans.use: To buy clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Greyse Zulema

texts.es:
Greyse de 48 años, vende comida rápida, almuerzos y meriendas en un local pequeño para poder general suficientes ingresos y ayudar con  los gastos familiares a su esposo. 

Trabaja desde muy temprano comprando la comida desde las 05h30am hasta que cocina la comida y la vende en almuerzos y meriendas. Su esposo es chofer en una camioneta y tiene una niña de 17 años que está estudiando pero actualmente se le ha complicado la salud teniendo una arteria del corazón desarrollada y le hace daño corre y hacer deporte. 

El préstamo lo quiere dirigir a las recetas médicas de su hija y el tratamiento para que se le deshinche la arteria. En el futuro quiere que su hija se recupere y que tenga una vida profesional exitosa.
texts.en:
Greyse is 48 years old.  She sells fast food, lunches and afternoon snacks from her small premises to make sufficient income to help her husband with their family's expenses.  She works from very early in the morning, buying food from 5.30am.  She then cooks the food and sells it in her lunches and afternoon snacks.  Her husband is a truck driver and she has a 17 year-old daughter who is studying but who currently has health complications as she has a problem with a coronary artery and she suffers when she runs and takes part in sports.

Greyse would like to use her loan to cover her daughter's medical prescriptions and the treatment that she needs to deflate the artery.  In the future, she would like her daughter to get well again and for her to enjoy a successful professional life.

loans.use: Medical prescriptions

loans.name: Fredy De Jesús

texts.es:
Fredy de Jesús M., quien por la falta de oportunidades y después de verse desempleado, se vio obligado a retomar el oficio que aprendió desde joven al lado de un vecino suyo, fue entonces cuando la elaboración de escobas y traperos se convirtió en la fuente de sustento para él, su esposa y su hijo, quienes también apoyan su labor. 

Con la fuerza propia de un emprendedor, Fredy afirma que cada vez que se levanta piensa en trabajar con gran empeño no sólo para sostener su hogar sino también para ofrecerle un mejor futuro a su hijo quien sueña con ser administrador de empresas. 

Actualmente, Fredy requiere comprar más insumos para responder ante los pedidos de sus clientes que cada vez son mayores. 

A futuro Fredy espera construir tres pisos en su casa para ubicar allí su microempresa, pues actualmente ésta funciona en el patio.
texts.en:
Fredy de Jesús M., facing the lack of employment opportunities and finding himself unemployed, was forced to take up again an occupation that he learned as a young man from a neighbor.  He started to make brooms and mops and this became his source of income to support himself, his wife and his son who also help him with the work.

With the strength typical of an entrepreneur, Fredy affirms that every day when he gets out of bed he thinks about working with great effort not only to support his household but also to provide a better future for his son who dreams with becoming a businessman.

Fredy needs now to buy more supplies to meet customer demand which is greater every time.

In the future Fredy hopes to build three stories on his house to install his micro business since it currently operates in the patio.

loans.use: To buy supplies to make mops and brooms.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil una zona urbana con su esposo. Reparte comida en un pequeño local, a diferentes personas el cual le ha ayudado a mejorar los ingresos de su familia. 

Empezó repartiendo comida con la ayuda de su esposo hasta que consiguió tener un pequeño comedor. Comprando víveres como arroz, frejoles, azúcar y comienza a preparar la comida desde muy temprano hasta que reparte los almuerzos con ayuda de su esposo. Tiene muchas aspiraciones para el futuro por eso quiere continuar con su negocio comprando arroz, frejoles, carnes. 

En el futuro quiere tener un restaurante para poder mejorar los ingresos del su familia.
texts.en:
María lives in El Guasmo de Guayaquil, an urban zone, with her husband.  She sells food from a small locale to various people.  This has helped her improve family income.

She started preparing food with her husband’s help until she managed to acquire a small dining room.  Buying foodstuffs like rice, beans and sugar she starts to prepare meals starting very early that she then delivers with help from her husband.  She has a lot of hopes for the future so wants to continue with her business by buying rice, beans and meats.

In the future she wants to have a restaurant to improve her family income.

loans.use: For rice, beans and meats.

loans.name: Gorgorlou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité a été créé depuis le premier cycle du Banc Villageois qui l'abrite en 2009. Il est composé de 26 femmes qui habitent différents quartiers mais qui chaque mois se retrouve pour les activités de leur Banc Villageois. Leur activité principale est pratiquement le petit commerce. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de HERSENT2

Madame ROKHAYA N. portant des lunettes de vue et mise en médaillon est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 51 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants en charge. Elle a aussi la charge de 03 enfants qui lui sont confiés par des proches. 

Elle fait la vente de tissus et d'articles de mercerie. Elle fait aussi la confection sur mesures. 

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d'acheter des tissus et des articles de mercerie pour revendre et faire de la confection d'habits.

Son objectif est de satisfaire ses besoins personnels et ceux de la famille par exemple la scolarité des enfants et la nourriture
texts.en:
This group was created during the first loan cycle with associated communal bank in 2009. It is made up of 26 women who live in different quarters of the city but they meet every month for activities set out by their communal bank. Their main activity is the management of a small business.  The group is a part of the communal bank named Hersent2. 

Mrs. Rokhaya N. is the leader of the group and she appears in the photo wearing glasses, and her image is reproduced above the crowd. She is 51 years old, she is married, and she has 2 children in her care. She also takes care of 3 other children who were left in her care by close friends. 

She sells fabrics and craft supplies. She also is also a seamstress. 

Her new loan will permit her to purchase fabrics and craft supplies for resale and she will also be able to fashion items of clothing.

Her goal is to cover her personal needs and those of her family, including her children's education and nutrition.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics.

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es: Hermelinda, de 46 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Egadi (49) y sus cuatro pequeños  hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor educación.La tienda de abarrotes de Hermelinda es una de las más concurridas del poblado de Yurinaki, el gran carisma que posee y la amabilidad en su trato han hecho que sea la preferida por sus vecinos, quines no dudan en hacer sus compras desde muy temprano, ya que saben que es la primera en abrir .Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinos sobre las cosas que suceden en su pueblo, lleva 4 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer gran parte del día en su tienda, sin que le quede mucho tiempo para cultivar sus tierras, y las tiene algo descuidadas. Para más adelante tiene planeado ampliar las instalaciones de su tienda, para adquirir  más productos para tenerlos  en stock, y así espera  ofrecer lo mejor a sus clientes.Este el primer préstamo de Hermelinda con MFP, sabe que si lo paga a tiempo, podrá acceder a otro con mayor tranquilidad y sin traerle complicaciones a su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por el resto de sus socias.Hermelinda tiene planeado invertir los mil soles solicitados en la compra de más  provisiones para su tienda de abarrotes y así espera incrementar  su stock de productos.
texts.en:
Hermelinda, 46, is a kind, hard working woman.  She lives in her own house with her husband, Egadi, 41, and their four small children for whom she wants to provide a better education.

Hermelinda’s grocery store is one of the most popular in her community of Yurinaki.  Her great charisma and kind way she treats customers have made her very popular among her neighbors who make their purchases from her starting very early since they know that she’s the first one to open for business.

What she most enjoys about her work is chatting with her neighbors about the things that go on in her town.  She’s been in business for 4 years and considers the most challenging part having to stay in her store for most of the day with little time left to farm her land which is a bit neglected as a result. For later on she’d like to expand her store to acquire more items to stock thus offering better customer service.

This is Hermelinda’s first loan with MFP.  She knows that if she repays on time she may access future loans more easily and without causing complications for her communal bank where she is very well liked by her fellow group members.

Hermelinda plans to use the requested 1000 soles to buy more stock items for her grocery store hoping thereby to increase her stock of products.

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Hermenegildo

texts.es: Hermenegildo, de 55 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y amable, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Julia (52)  y su joven hija, juntas se esfuerzan cada día por salir adelante.A lo largo de su vida, Hermenegildo a trabajado en diferentes oficios, ahora se decida al trabajo de  albañilería y es muy solicitado por sus vecinos, pues hay bastante demanda por la zona y  él es el albañil con mayor  experiencia, al que todos recurren. Disfruta de trabajar en la construcción, sabe que con este digno oficio  puede pagar la educación de sus hijos, lleva 21 años realizando su dedicada labor  y considera que lo más difícil es cargar los pesados ladrillos para manejar el cemento hasta con las manos, lo que le ha perjudicado porque sus  manos han envejecido rápidamente. Para el futuro desea renovar sus herramientas para mejorar el trabajo que hace, y brindar un servicio de calidad.Es el noveno préstamo de Hermenegildo con MFP y no quiere dejar de pagarlo por falta de dinero, así que ya esta haciendo contactos para realizar más trabajos de construcción, él es el único varón de su banco comunal por lo que siempre trata de ser responsable y respetuoso con las demás socias.Con los dos mil quinientos soles solicitados, comprará tablones nuevos y aumentará su número de puntales (herramientas de apoyo), con lo cual podrá trabajar en más construcciones a la vez y así espera mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Hermenegildo, 55, is an unassuming, kind man.  He lives in his own house with his wife, Julia, 52, and young daughter.  Together they struggle daily to get ahead.

Throughout his life Hermenegildo has worked at various jobs; he’s currently a bricklayer and very sought after by his neighbors because there is a lot of demand in the area and he’s the most experienced bricklayer so everyone comes to him. He enjoys working in construction.  He knows that this honest work will allow him to pay for his children’s education.

He’s been in this line of work for 21 years and considers the most difficult part of it carrying the heavy bricks and mixing cement sometimes by hand, something that has damaged his hands and caused them to age quickly.  In the future he’d like to upgrade his work tools to improve the work he does and provide quality customer service.

This is his 9th loan with MFP and he does not want to miss payments for lack of money so he is already making contacts for more construction jobs.  
He is the only male in his communal bank so he always strives to be respectful and responsible towards his fellow members.

He plans to use the requested 2000 soles to buy new beams and supports so that he can work at several construction jobs at once thus hoping to improve his income.

loans.use: To buy work tools.

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es: Mariela, de 23 años, es una joven madre de familia, muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Nilson (24)  y su pequeña hija , a quienes desea brindar un mejor futuro.Los arduos trabajos que realiza en su chacra, han logrado  que sus cultivos estén muy bien cuidados y que los días de venta, sus productos sean rápidamente comprados. Su principal fuente de ingresos, es la venta de plátanos y café, en cantidad ya que son de  muy buena calidad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que siente que su trabajo esta dando sus frutos, lleva tres  años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que pueden afectarlas. Con el tiempo, desea adquirir nuevas tierras, para ampliar sus cultivos.Este es el segundo préstamo de Mariela con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos y nunca a tenido problema con los integrantes de su banco comunal, en donde es la encargada de poner la cuota de alegría que mantiene a las demás socias muy felices.Con los mil doscientos soles solicitados, tiene planeado comprar cantidad de abono e insecticidas para mejorar sus plantaciones, de esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Mariela is a very modest and hard-working young mother aged 23.  She lives in her own home together with her husband Nilson (24) and her young daughter for whom she would like to provide a better future.

The hard work that Mariela does on her farm has meant that her crops are very well cared for and, on sales days, her products sell quickly.  Her main source of income is selling bananas and coffee in quantity.  They are very good quality.  What Mariela most likes about her work is harvesting her crops since she feels that her work is bearing fruit.  She has been in this business for three years and she considers that the most difficult part of her work is protecting her crops from the pests that can affect them.  Over time, she would like to acquire new land so that she can expand her crops.

This is Mariela's second loan from MFP.  She has been very punctual with her payments and has never had any problems with the other members of her community bank where she is in charge of injecting the happiness quota that keeps the other members very happy.  Mariela plans to use the 1,200 Peruvian soles she has requested to buy a quantity of manure and insecticides to improve her plantations.  In this way, she hopes to improve her profits.

loans.use: To buy manure and insecticides for her crops

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es: Marleny, de 27 años, es una mujer muy alegre y amable, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Cecilio (38)  y sus cinco pequeños  hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida.Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas, ella cultiva, café y maíz, productos que posteriormente lleva a vender hasta el mercado de Pichanaki, donde las vende al por mayor. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, ya lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta Pichanaki, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. Para más adelante, tiene planeado  comprar nuevas tierras para ampliar sus plantaciones.Este es el segundo préstamo de Marleny con MFP y desea ser muy puntual en sus pagos. En su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa y siempre esta al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en su grupo.Con los mil soles solicitados, invertirá en  limpiar su chacra y contratará peones, para que la ayuden en el cultivo, de esta manera espera alcanzar el progreso.
texts.en:
Marleny is 27 years old.  She is a very happy and kind woman who lives in her own home together with her husband Cecilio (38) and her five young children for whom she would like to provide a better quality of life.

Through a lot of hard work, Marleny has managed to work her land and make it very productive.  She grows coffee and corn which she then takes to the market in Pichanaki to sell wholesale.  What she most likes about her work is taking care of her crops.  She has been in this business for 5 years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be transporting her products to Pichanaki since the sacks that are very heavy and make her very tired.  In the future, she plans to buy new land to expand her plantations.

This is Marleny's second loan with MFP and she would like to be punctual in making her repayments.  She takes part in her community bank's activities and is always up to date on the agreements that the group has reached.  She will invest the 1,000 Peruvian soles she has requested in weeding her farm and hiring laborers so that they can help her with her crops.  In this way, she hopes to make progress.

loans.use: To pay laborers to help improve her crops

loans.name: Angélica Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Angélica Patricia R. tiene ya más de cuatro años dedicándose a la venta de ropa nueva y usada.
El negocio es la fuente de ingresos para su familia ya que es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos los cuales les quiere dar el estudio necesario.
 Pero en este momento a su negocio le esta haciendo falta mas variedad de mercancía, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión.
Es por eso que esta solicitando un préstamo y así invertir en el negocio y tener más ingresos para su familia. 
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtiene de las ventas de ropa.
texts.en: Angélica Patricia R. has been selling new and used clothes for more than four years.  Her business is her family's sole source of income since she is a single mother and has two children for whom she wants to provide an education.  Right now her business merchandise is lacking variety but she doesn't have the necessary money to invest in it.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan which she will invest in her business to make more income for her family.  She plans to pay back her loan with the profits that she makes from her clothes sales.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es: Matilde, de 31 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Nilson (30)  y sus tres pequeños hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida.Trabajando arduamente Matilde ha logrado sacar adelante sus sembríos, todas las mañanas se levanta muy temprano para regar y brindarle el cuidado respectivo a su café y plátanos los cuales posteriormente venderá en la ciudad de Pichanaki, ya que es en ese lugar  donde obtiene los mejores precios por sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede disfrutar de la libertad de laborar en sus campos, ya lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar la tierra. Con el tiempo tiene planeado adecuar sus tierras para plantar mucho más café, de esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias.Es el  segundo préstamo de Matilde con MFP, sabe que este préstamo le ayudará bastante en el progreso y desarrollo de su negocio, es por eso que esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, y en su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy querida.Matilde tiene planeado invertir  los quinientos soles solicitados, en la compra de cantidad de  abono y fertilizantes, que necesita  para mejorar la calidad de sus tierras.
texts.en:
Matilde is 31 years old.  She is a very humble and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her husband Nilson (30) and her three small children, for whom she would like to provide a better quality of life.

Through hard work, Matilde has managed to make progress with her crops.  Every morning she gets up very early to irrigate and care for her coffee and bananas which she will later sell in the city of Pichanaki since this is where she receives the best prices for her products.  What she most likes about her work is being able to enjoy the freedom of working in her fields.  She has been in this business for 10 years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be working her land.  Over time, she plans to get her land ready to plant a lot more coffee.  In this way, she hopes to improve her profits.

This is Matilde's second loan with MFP and she knows that this loan will help her in making progress and developing her business.  For this reason, she is prepared to make all her repayments on time.  She is a very responsible member of her community bank and, for this reason, she is a very well-liked member.  Matilde plans to invest the 500 Peruvian soles she has requested in buying a quantity of manure and fertilizers that she needs to improve the quality of her land.

loans.use: To buy manure and fertilizers to improve her crops

loans.name: Napoleon

texts.es: Napoleón, de 42 años, es un hombre muy amable y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Abelina (41)  y sus tres pequeños  hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida.Todos los días muy temprano, Napoleón sale a trabajar sus campos, para él no existen los días de descanso, ya que tiene que trabajar continuamente su chacra, para tener una buena producción. Sus principales productos de siembra son: el café y plátanos, los cuales vende al por mayor en la ciudad de Pichanaki. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene laborando  en sus cultivos, ya que puede disfrutar libremente de sus verdes campos, lleva 35 años en  esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que pueden aquejarlas. Para el futuro tiene planeado  comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar su producción.Es el tercer préstamo que tiene  Napoleón con MFP  y  ha sido muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas y espera serlo esta vez. En su banco comunal es una persona muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras, ya que es muy alegre.Napoleón tiene planeado invertir los  mil setecientos soles solicitados en la compra de  abono e insecticidas que necesita  para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Napoleón is 42 years old.  He is a very kind and hard-working man who lives in his own home together with his wife Abelina (41) and his three young children for whom he would like to provide a better quality of life.

Very early every day, Napoleón goes out to work in his fields.  He does not have rest days since he has to work on his farm continually in order to produce good crops.  His main crops are coffee and bananas which he sells wholesale in the city of Pichanaki.  What he most likes about his work is the freedom that he has working on his crops since he can freely enjoy his green fields.  He has been in this business for 35 years and he considers the most difficult part of his work to be protecting his crops from the pests that can ravage them.  In the future, he plans to buy new land so that he can increase his production.

This is Napoleón's third loan with MFP.  He has always been very punctual in making his repayments and he hopes to continue this.  Napoleón is a very well-liked member of his community bank because he is very happy.  He plans to invest the 1,700 Peruvian soles he has requested in buying the manure and insecticides he needs to improve his crops.

loans.use: To buy manure and insecticides to improve his land

loans.name: Nueva Era Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Nueva Era, inicia su ciclo 35 con 14 socias, las cuales tiene diversos negocios como es el caso D. Rosa María, que es Presidenta del Banco Comunal, tiene 42 años, es casada y tiene 8 hijos. Se dedica a la venta D. animales menores como: cuyes y gallinas y tambien venD. cereales.

Rosa Maria es natural D. Cayara, sus hijos vinieron a estudiar a Ayacucho, así que cada vez que venia a ver a sus hijos aprovechaba en traer animales menores y venderlos para sustentar algunos gastos en Ayacucho. Le va bien, ahora viaja a la feria D. Cayara, Pampas los viernes y regresa los domingos, venD. sus animales a sus caseras del mercado 12 D. Abril. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra D. más animales y cereales. 

A Rosa María le gusta las reuniones D. su Banco Comunal en Finca por la capacitaciones que recibe, pueD. ahorrar y le dan créditos. El sueño D. Rosa María es que sus hijos lleguen a ser profesionales, poder tener un capital y poder abrir su propio negocio.
texts.en:
The "Nueva Era" ["New Era"] Communal bank is starting its 35th cycle and has 14 members who work in various business.  One member is Rosa María, president of the communal bank, who is 42 years old, married, and has eight children.  She sells young animals like guinea pigs and chickens, and she also sells grains.

Rosa María is a native of Cayara.  Her children came to Ayacucho to study, so each time she has come to see them she has taken advantage of the opportunity to bring young animals with her to sell in Ayacucho in order to cover her expenses. Her business is doing well and now she also travels to the market in Cayara, Pampas on Fridays.  She sells her animals at the 12th of April market and returns on Sundays.  The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase more animals and grains.

Rosa María enjoys her communal bank's meetings at Finca because she appreciates the trainings they receive, and also because she is able to save and borrow money.  Rosa María's dream is for her children to become professionals and to have enough capital to open her own business.

loans.use: To buy young animals and grains to sell

loans.name: Fernando Andres

texts.es:
Fernando de 29 años, trabaja como chofer y vive en una zona periurbana llamada Perimetral. Desde los 14 años comenzó aprender a manejar en un carro que le prestaban. Cuando creció decidió que esa iba a ser su profesión y le prestó un carro a un amigo para poder transita en las calles y conseguir dinero. 

En la actualidad trabaja desde las 11h00am hasta las 12h00pm todos  los días recorriendo las calles de Guayaquil. Tiene muchas aspiraciones para seguir trabajando por eso está trabajando todos los días. 

En el futuro tiene muchas aspiraciones de superación pero por ahora quiere arreglar su casa comprando bloques, cemento. Tiene pensado en un tiempo no muy lejano comprar un bus para ingresarlo a una cooperativa.
texts.en:
Fernando is 29 years old.  He works as a driver and lives in a peri-urban area called Perimetral.  He started out at the age of 14, learning to drive a car that he was lent.  When he grew up he decided that this was going to be his profession and he borrowed a friend's car so that he could drive the streets and make money.

Fernando currently works from 11.00am to 12.00am every day in the streets of Guayaquil.  He has a lot of aspirations to keep working and, for this reason, he works every day.  In the future, he has aspirations to improve himself but, for now, he would like to fix up his house, buying blocks and cement.  He is thinking, in the not-too-distant future, of buying a bus and becoming a member of a drivers' cooperative.

loans.use: To buy cement and blocks

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mi Progreso De San José Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal Mi Progreso D. san José, inicia su ciclo 6 con 21 socias. Roberta es L. Presidenta del Banco Comunal, tiene 42 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos. Se dedica a L. venta D. comida. Roberta venD. alimentos todos lo domingos en L. feria D. animales, paradero D. L. ruta No “6”, los demás días D. L. semana se dedica a bordar correas, tapices y bolsos. El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en L. compra D. insumos para L. preparación D. alimentos. A Roberta le gusta las reuniones D. su Banco Comunal porque le dan capacitaciones que le sirven para progresar, le dan créditos y pueD. ahorrar. Su sueño es que sus hijos puedan estudiar y que crezca su negocio.
texts.en:
The 'Mi Progreso D. San José' community bank is beginning its 6th loan cycle with 21 members.  Roberta is the president of this community bank.  She is 42 years old, married, and has 4 children.  Her business is selling meals.

Roberta sells food every Sunday on the 'feria D. animales' (animal market) stop on the "No. 6" bus route.  The other days of the week, she embroiders belts, tapestries and bags.

Roberta will invest the loan she is requesting in buying supplies for preparing her meals.  Roberta likes her community bank meetings because they receive training which helps them to make progress, they receive loans and they are able to save.  Her dream is for her children to be able to study and for her business to grow.

loans.use: To buy rice, oil and sugar

loans.name: La Alternativa 1 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Ruth is a middle-aged woman that lives in Samaná, Dominican Republic. As a mother of 5 children, her small vending business allows her to support her family's income, by adding to the income from her long term partner. With this particular loan, Ruth is looking forward to the possibility of acquiring more inventory such as cosmetics and beauty products. The earnings from her business will allow her to continue to support her children and put her one step closer to her dream, which is to run an ice cream store.

Ruth is just one member of the 10 person group, La Alternativa 1 & 3. Together, these Dominican entrepreneurs are able to unite in solidarity, allowing them access to funding that they would otherwise never be able to receive on their own. The concept of this group bank paying their loan together is to reduce the risk of one person defaulting, as the other members gladly help cover one another’s payments in order to receive their next loan together.

Ruth has been an Esperanza associate for 5 years. This is her 11th loan. All her previous loans have been paid and invested in her business. Her story is representative of this group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in Samaná, a lush rugged peninsula with a nascent tourism industry. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy cosmetic products

loans.name: Raul

texts.es: Raúl, de 50 años, es un hombre muy trabajador y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Ofelia (35)  y sus dos  pequeños  hijos, a quienes desea brindar una buena  calidad de vida.Trabajando arduamente este trabajador hombre  a logrado sacar adelante sus sembríos, todas las mañanas se levanta muy temprano para regar y brindarle el cuidado respectivo a sus plantas de plátanos y café, los cuales posteriormente venderá en la ciudad de Pichanaki, ya que es ahí donde obtiene los mejores precios por sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede disfrutar de la libertad de laborar en sus verdes campos, ya lleva 24 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es trabajar la tierra durante  todo el día, sin que le quede mucho tiempo para realizar otras actividades. Para más adelante, espera adecuar sus tierras para el sembrado de cítricos, ya que por estas fechas es lo que mejor se vende.Este es el cuarto préstamo de Raúl con MFP, sabe que este préstamo le ayudara bastante en el progreso y desarrollo de su negocio, es por eso que esta dispuesto a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, en su banco comunal es un socio muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy respetado.Raúl tiene planeado invertir  los mil soles solicitados en la compra de  abono e insecticidas que necesita para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en: Raúl, age 50, is a jovial and hard-working man. He lives in his own home with his wife, Ofelia (age 35), and their two young children, whom he wants to give a good quality of life. Working arduously, this diligent man has managed to make his crop fields thrive. Every morning he wakes up very early in order to irrigate and care for his plantain and coffee plants, which he will then sell in the city of Pichanaki as this is where he obtains the best prices for his products. What he likes most about his job is that he can enjoy the freedom of working in his green fields, which he has been doing for 24 years. He considers the most difficult aspect to be working the land all day long, leaving him little time to do any other activity. In the future, he hopes to adapt his fields for citrus production during the time when citrus sells the most. This is Raul's fourth loan with MFP. He knows that this loan will help him considerably with the progress and development of his business, which is why he is ready to make his payments punctually. In his microfinance group, he is a very responsible member, which is why he is very respected. Raul plans on investing the 1,000.00 PEN that he is requesting in purchasing the fertilizer and pesticides he needs in order to improve his crops.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and pesticides for crop improvement

loans.name: Las Cumplidas Group

texts.es:
La presidenta del grupo "Las Cumplidas", se llama Ana María U. S..  Tiene 41 años y es madre soltera.  Tiene dos hijos que tienen 7 y 17 años de edad.  
(En la foto Ana María esta vestida con pantalón color negro, un polo morado y lleva un bolso; ella está de pie y es la tercera de la derecha).

Ana María tiene planes de invertir parte de este préstamo en la siembra.  Ella cultiva papas, maíz, zanahorias y cebollas.  Para comprar todas las semillas para la siembra, ha pedido este préstamo.  Después de la cosecha, vende las hortalizas en el mercado.  
Para el futuro, Ana María quiere que sus hijos asistan a la universidad para llegar a ser profesionales.
texts.en:
The president of the "Las Cumplidas" group is called Ana María U. S..  She is 41 years old and a single mother.  She has two children aged 7 and 17.  (In the photo, Ana María is wearing black pants, a purple top and is carrying a bag; she is the woman standing up, third from the right)

Ana María plans to invest part of this loan in sowing her crops.  She grows potatoes, corn, carrots and onions.  She has requested this loan to buy all the seeds that she needs for this.  After she has harvested her crops, she sells her vegetables in the market.

In the future, Ana María would like her children to go to university and become professionals.

loans.use: To buy vegetable seeds

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es: La señora Carmen se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno para la producción de leche, se dedica a esta actividad hace un año desde que se caso, cuenta con cuatro vacas, la leche entrega a su suegra quien posteriormente lo vende como yogurt, solicita el crédito para la compra de una vaca en producción lo que ayudara en los ingresos familiares, su familia esta compuesta por su persona, su esposo y su hijo de cuatro meses de edad.  Actualmente viven en domicilio de propiedad de sus suegros, pero su sueño es el de comprarse un terreno y hacer construir su casita, es una persona joven y trabajadora, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Carmen raises cattle for milk production.  She has been in this business for one year, since she got married.  She has four cows and she delivers their milk to her mother-in-law who then sells it as yoghurt.  Carmen is requesting this loan to buy a dairy cow which will help her family income.  Her family consists of herself, her husband and her four-month old son.  They currently live with her in-laws but her dream is to buy a plot of land and have a small house of her own built.  Carmen is a young and hard-working person.  She is grateful to the institution for the support they have offered her.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Silvana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Silvana de 29 años, es una joven emprendedora que desde que falleció su padre se ha dedicado a trabajar en una copiadora que el compro para que su hija trabaje. 

Poco a poco ella ha estado trabajando en la copiadora que le dejo su papa y ha invertido las ganancias que ha tenido en algunos artículos de papelería como cuadernos, plumas y otros en ropa para tener ingresos adicionales. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 19h00pm. Tiene muchas aspiraciones para el futuro por eso quiere seguir trabajando en su pequeño negocio y comprar con el préstamo blusas, camisetas y papelería. 

En el futuro quiere tener su familia bien constituida y poder alquilar su casa para tener un ingreso adicional.
texts.en:
Silvana is 29 years old.  She is an enterprising young woman who, since her father died, has worked in a stationery store that he bought so that his daughter could work.

She has been working in the store that her dad left her and has invested the profits that she has made in buying stationery products such as exercise books and pens, and clothes to make additional income.

Silvana currently works from 7.00am to 7.00pm.  She has a lot of aspirations for the future.  For this reason, she would like to continue working in her small business and use her loan money to buy blouses, t-shirts and stationery products.  In the future, she would like to have her family united and be able to rent her house out to make additional income.

loans.use: To buy blouses, t-shirts and stationery products

loans.name: Reynilda

texts.es: Reynilda, de 27 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Américo (31)  y sus tres pequeños  hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida.Con mucho esfuerzo Reynilda ha logrado trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas, ella cultiva, café y plátano, productos que posteriormente lleva a comercializar hasta el mercado de Pichanaki, donde las vende al por mayor. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, lleva 12 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta la ciudad, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. Para más adelante tiene planeado comprar nuevas tierras para ampliar sus plantaciones, de esta manera espera alcanzar el progreso.Este es el segundo préstamo de Reynilda con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos y espera serlo también ahora. En su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa y siempre esta al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en su grupo.Reynilda tiene planeado invertir  los mil  soles solicitados, en contratar peones para que  limpien  sus chacras, para que la ayuden en el cultivo de sus tierras, de esta manera espera alcanzar el progreso.
texts.en:
Reynilda is 27 years old.  She is a very kind and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her husband Américo (31) and her three small children for whom she would like to provide a better quality of life.

Through a lot of hard work, Reynilda has managed to work her land and make it very productive.  She grows coffee and bananas which she later takes to sell wholesale in Pichanaki market.  What she most likes about her work is caring for her crops.  She has been in this business for 12 years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be transporting her products to the city since the sacks that she carries are very heavy and they make her very tired.  In the future, Reynilda plans to buy new land to expand her plantations.  In this way, she hopes to make progress.

This is Reynilda's second loan with MFP.  She has always been very punctual in making her previous loan repayments and she hopes to continue this.  She takes an active part in her community bank and is always up to date with the agreements that have been reached in her group.  Reynilda plans to invest the 1,000 Peruvian soles she has requested in hiring laborers to weed her plantations to help her cultivate her land.  In this way, she hopes to make progress.

loans.use: To pay laborers to cultivate her land

loans.name: Wilmer Omar

texts.es: El señor Wilmer se dedica a la producción de escarchadores ( escobillones ) ya se dedica a esta actividad hace siete años ya cuenta con clientela propia a quienes entrega sus productos semanalmente el trabajo lo realiza de lunes a viernes y entrega los escarchadores los días sábados (a ferreterías de Cochabamba y Quillacollo),  Wilmer es soltero y aun vive en domicilio de propiedad de sus padres, a quienes colabora con los gastos familiares, solicita el crédito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de escobillones, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Wilmer's business is making cleaning brushes.  He has been in this business for seven years and he already has customers to whom he delivers his products on a weekly basis.  He works making his products from Monday to Friday and delivers them on Saturdays (to hardware stores in Cochabamba and Quillacollo).  Wilmer is single and still lives with his parents who he helps with family expenses.  He is requesting this loan to buy raw materials for making his brushes.  He is grateful to the institution for the support they have offered him.

loans.use: Working capital to buy raw materials

loans.name: La Alternativa 4 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Alina is a divorced mother of 3 children. She is running a sales business, where she sells different products like cosmetics, shoes, accessories, and clothing. This activity allows her to support her family. With this particular loan, she will invest in her business by buying more of those products. Her future plans are to have a wholesale store and to have enough money to give her children all their needs and to pay for their degree studies.

Alina is just one member of the 10 person group, La Alternativa 4 & 5. Together, these Dominican entrepreneurs are able unite in solidarity, allowing them access to funding that they would otherwise never be able to receive on their own. Alina decided to make business with Esperanza because she needed to bring extra income to her house. Alina started her business with her first loan from Esperanza.

This Esperanza associate began with us around 5 years ago, and this is her 11th loan. All previous loans have been paid and invested in her business. Her story is representative of this group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in Samana, a lush rugged peninsula with a nascent tourism industry. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy a variety of products to sell

loans.name: Rober

texts.es: Rober, de 20 años, es un joven muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa que es propia y lo que más desea es sobresalir en la vida.Desde muy pequeño Rober aprendió a trabajar en la chacra junto a sus padres, quienes le enseñaron todo lo que se tiene que hacer, para lograr un buen cultivo, ahora tiene sus propias tierras, las cuales cultiva y cuida con mucho amor y paciencia. Él siembra café y plátanos, productos que posteriormente lleva a vender al mercado de la ciudad de Pichanaki. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus cultivos, pues  siente que su arduo trabajo esta dando sus frutos, ya lleva dos  años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que pueden afectarlos. Su mayor deseo es comprarse un carro, con el cual pueda trasladar sus productos hasta el mercado.Este es el primer préstamo de Rober con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y esta dispuesto a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es un socio muy alegre y siempre pone  la cuota de humor en el grupo.Con los mil soles solicitados, comprará más abono e insecticidas para mejorar la calidad de sus cultivos así espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Rober is 20 years old.  He is a very humble and hard-working young man who lives in his own home.  What he most wants is to do well in life.  Rober's parents taught him to be a farmer from a very young age.  They taught him everything that he needed to do in order to achieve good crops.

Now Rober has his own land which he farms and cares for with a lot of love and patience.  He grows coffee and bananas which he then takes to sell in the market in Pichanaki.  What he most likes about his work is harvesting his crops since he feels that his hard work is bearing fruit.  He has been in this business for two years and he considers the most difficult part of his work to be protecting his crops from the pests that can affect them.  His biggest desire is to buy a car which he can use to take his products to market.

This is Rober's first loan with MFP.  He knows that he must make his loan repayments on time and he is ready to do this.  He is a very happy member of his community bank and he always injects a quota of humor into the group.  He will use the 1,000 Peruvian soles he has requested to buy more manure and insecticides to improve the quality of his crops.  In this way, he hopes to improve his profits.

loans.use: To buy manure and insecticides to improve his crops

loans.name: Robert

texts.es: Robert, de 21 años, es un joven muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es forjarse un buen futuro.Los largos días de trabajo que Robert realiza en su chacra, le han servido para obtener los ingresos económicos que necesita para mantenerse, y  todas las mañanas sale en dirección a sus cultivos, para cuidarlos y trabajarlos, ya que sabe que así obtendrá una cosecha de plátanos y café de buena calidad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya lleva 6 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus tierras. Con el tiempo, desea mejorar la calidad de sus productos, fertilizando mejor sus tierras.Este es el segundo préstamo de Robert con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, si quiere acceder a otro en el futuro. En su banco comunal, es un socio muy querido, ya que es el más joven del grupo.Con los mil soles solicitados, contratara peones, para que limpien y trabajen sus tierras, de esta manera espera seguir progresando.
texts.en:
Robert is 21 years old.  He is a very modest and hard-working young man who lives in his own home.  What he most wants is to make a good future for himself.

Robert's long workdays on his farm have helped him to make the income he needs to support himself.  Every morning he goes out in the direction of his crops to care for them and work on them since he knows that this is how he will obtain a good quality banana and coffee harvest.  What Robert most likes about his work is harvesting his land.  He has been in this business for 6 years and he considers the most difficult part of his work to be spraying his land.  Over time, he would like to improve the quality of his products, better fertilizing his land.

This is Robert's second loan with MFP and he knows that he must make his repayments on time if he wants to be able to access another loan in the future.  Robert is a very well-liked member of his community bank since he is the youngest in the group.  He will use the 1,000 Peruvian soles he has requested to hire laborers to weed and work on his land.  In this way, he hopes to continue making progress.

loans.use: To pay laborers to help him with his crops

loans.name: Elvis Ruperto

texts.es:
Elvis es un padre de familia de 31 años de edad que reside junto a su familia en uno de los caseríos que conforman el distrito agrícola de Pítipo, perteneciente a la región Lambayeque y se encuentra situada a menos de1 hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar en actividades relacionadas con la agricultura. El tiene un terreno propio que cultiva con la finalidad obtener productos de buena calidad para su posterior comercialización al público en general y a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Esta actividad le permite ayudar el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia. 

Elvis desea adquirir materiales e insumos para el cultivo de maiz amarillo duro. Con ello logrará percibir mayores ingresos por sus ventas, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Elvis is a 31 year-old father who lives together with his family in one of the villages that make up the agricultural district of Pítipo, in Lambayeque region, less than one hour from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

Elvis works in farming.  He owns his own plot of land where he grows crops with the aim of obtaining good-quality products that he can then sell to the general public and the traders who usually visit his area.  This activity allows him to financially support his family.

Elvis would like to acquire materials and supplies for his yellow corn crop.  This will enable him to make bigger profits on his sales.  He is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa so that he can achieve his goal.

loans.use: To acquire materials and supplies for growing yellow corn

loans.name: Maurent Ilosva

texts.es: La señorita Maurent dedicada a la venta de ropa y bisutería frente a un colegio, esta venta lo realiza de lunes a viernes durante todo el día esta actividad le permite alimentarse y ayudar a su familia pues solo cuenta con su madre y tres hermanos menores a ella y a los que tiene  que apoyar moral y económicamente, la señorita requiere el crédito para incrementar su capital comprando mercadería como ropa y trabas y así tener ingresos mas considerables. Y opto nuevamente al crédito ya que su anterior crédito con kiva le fue muy bien, es una joven muy responsable y trabajadora, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Maurent sells clothes and costume jewelry opposite a school.  She makes her sales all day, from Monday to Friday.  This business allows her to feed herself and help her family: her mother and her three younger siblings who she has to support both morally and financially.

This young lady requires a loan to increase her capital, buying merchandise such as clothes and hair accessories so that she can make more income.  She has chosen to take a new loan because her last Kiva loan was very helpful.  She is a very responsible and hard-working young woman and she is grateful to the institution for the help she has been offered.

loans.use: To buy clothes in bulk

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: Roberto, de 44 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Felicia (44)  y su pequeño hijo, a quien desea brindar un mejor futuro.Los arduos días de trabajo que tiene Roberto en su chacra, le han ayudado a mejorar su economía, es por eso que trabaja todo lo que puede, sembrando plátano y café, productos que posteriormente llevara a vender al mercado de la ciudad de Pichanaki. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus plantaciones, ya que sabe que unos productos sanos se venden a mejor precio, ya lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que subir los empinados cerros de su poblado, ya que es ahí donde tiene sus sembríos. Para el futuro, espera mejorar sus chacras y sembrar en totalidad todas sus tierras.Este es el primer préstamo de Roberto con MFP y esta dispuesto a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que no desea entrar en mora y perjudicar a su banco comunal, en donde es muy querido por el orden que pone en las reuniones.Con los quinientos soles solicitados, comprará pesticidas y herbicidas, para cuidar sus sembríos, de esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Roberto is 44 years old.  He is a very modest and happy man who lives in his own home together with his wife Felicia (44) and his young son for whom he would like to provide a better future.

Roberto's hard workdays on his farm have helped him to improve his finances.  For this reason, he works as hard as he can, growing bananas and coffee, products that he then takes to sell in the market in Pichanaki.  What Roberto most likes about his work is caring for his plantations since he knows that healthy products fetch a better price.  He has been in this business for 5 years and he considers the most difficult part of his work to be having to climb the steep hills of his village since that is where his crops are.  In the future, he hopes to improve his plantations and sow all of his land.

This is Roberto's first loan with MFP and he is ready to make his repayments on time since he doesn't want to default and cause trouble for his community bank where he is a very well-liked member for the order that he brings to the meetings.  Roberto will use the 500 Peruvian soles that he has requested to buy pesticides and herbicides to care for his crops.  In this way, he hopes to improve his profits.

loans.use: To buy pesticides to care for his crops

loans.name: Teodosia

texts.es: Teodosia, de 47 años, siempre ha trabajado muy duro por sobresalir en la vida, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Pedro (42), quien trabaja como albañil, y sus tres pequeños  hijos, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.En la comunidad de Yurinaki, se encuentra el negocio de Teodosia, su puesto esta ubicado en la plaza de la comunidad, en donde vende gallinas, patos y gansos, los cuales están bien alimentados y cuidados, es por eso que tiene muchos clientes y sus ingresos económicos son buenos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es alimentar a sus aves, ya que los cría con mucho cariño, lleva seis  años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil, es tener que permanecer en su puesto todo el día en espera de clientes. Para el futuro, planea alquilar una tienda donde pueda brindar a sus clientes una mejor comodidad a la hora de atenderlos.Este es el sétimo préstamo de Teodosia con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar puntualmente sus cuotas y está dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y responsable.Con los quinientos soles solicitados, comprará más alimento para sus aves, ya que tienen que estar grandes y sanos para comercializarlos a mejores precios.
texts.en:
Teodosia is 47 years old and has always worked very hard to get ahead in life.  She lives in her own home together with her husband Pedro (42), who works as a construction worker, and her three young children who are the motivation behind all her hard work.

Teodosia's business is located in the community of Yurinaki.  Her sales stall is located in the community square where she sells chickens, ducks and geese which are well fed and cared for.  For this reason, she has a lot of customers and her income is good.  What she most likes about her work is feeding her birds since she raises them with a lot of care.  She has been in this business for six years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be having to remain on her stall all day waiting for customers.  In the future, she plans to hire a store where she can serve her customers more comfortably.

This is Teodosia's seventh loan with MFP.  She knows that she must make her repayments on time and she is ready to do so.  She is a very happy and responsible member of her community bank.  She will use the 500 Peruvian soles she has requested to buy more feed for her birds since they have to grow big and healthy if she is to sell them for a better price.

loans.use: To buy feed to fatten her animals

loans.name: Mehemmed

texts.en:
Mehemmed M. has been working in the construction business since graduating from high school. He was born and raised in Libya and originally started out in the oil and gas construction business. Mehemmed, accompanied by his wife, came to the United States in 2008 on a scholarship from the Libyan government. He finally found a job with a small construction firm owned by a friend. He really loved his new job and decided to take it a step further, starting his own construction company in June 2010. In addition to starting his own business, Mehemmed has been pursuing his Masters degree in Civil Engineering, which he plans to complete this year. He also has a 9-week-old child.

This loan helped Mehemmed pay membership fees required to be on five websites that connect companies like his to clients who need services his company provides.  Being listed on these websites will help him extend his network and help him get more business. He hopes to build a good credit record with this loan so that he can apply for a bigger loan in the future.

Mehemmed believes that despite risks of failure, there are unlimited opportunities available to entrepreneurs. He is both a believer in and a testimony of the significant change microcredit makes in the lives of people around the world.

loans.use: Membership fees to be listed on five websites

loans.name: Toribio

texts.es: Toribio, de 42 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a sus tres pequeños hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida.Con mucho esfuerzo ha  logrado sacar adelante sus cultivos, ya que con la ayuda de sus hijos a trabajado muy duro y ha logrado que sus productos tengan una muy buena calidad, por este motivo cuando lleva a vender su café a la ciudad de Pichanaki los compradores no dudan en ofrecerle muy buenos precios, por sus productos de calidad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus plantaciones, ya  lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, pero para el futuro desea comprarse un auto, para transportar él mismo sus cultivos.Este es el segundo préstamo de Toribio con MFP, y manifiesta que el dinero del crédito le ayudara mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su banco comunal, es un socio muy responsable y respetuoso.Toribio tiene planeado invertir  los quinientos soles solicitados en la compra de  abono, para plantar plátano, de esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Toribio is 42 years old.  He is a very modest and hard-working man who lives in his own home together with his three young children for whom he would like to provide a better quality of life.

Through a lot of hard work, Toribio has managed to make progress with his crops since, with the help of his children, he has worked very hard and managed to produce very good-quality products.  For this reason, when he takes his coffee to sell in Pichanaki, his buyers don't hesitate in offering him very good prices for his good-quality products.  What Toribio most likes about his work is caring for his plantations.  He has been in this business for 5 years and he considers the most difficult part of his work to be transporting his products.  However, in the future, he would like to buy a car so that he can transport his crops himself.

This is Toribio's second loan with MFP and he says that the money from his loan will help him a lot in making progress in his work.  Toribio is a very responsible and respectful member of his community bank.  He plans to invest the 500 Peruvian soles he has requested in buying manure for his banana crop.  In this way, he hopes to improve his profits.

loans.use: To buy manure to improve his plantations

loans.name: Hermano Miguel (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Hermano Miguel esta formado por 8 mujeres que en su mayoría son familiares, se dedican a diferentes trabajos que les han permitido ayudar en la economía de sus hogares, viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca que es la tercera ciudad  más importante del país. A esta ciudad le hace grande su gente, su gastronomía, su cultura y la belleza de su naturaleza.

La Señora. Narcisa Sigüenza es socia del banco comunal Hermano Miguel, vive por el sector del Salado en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 43 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 23, 20 y 18 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos son casados y viven independientes, su ultima hija le ayuda en su trabajo. Su esposo vive en el extranjero en busca de un mejor trabajo para mejorar la economía de su hogar, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
Doña Narcisa se dedica a la elaboración y venta de helados, actividad que la realiza hace 18 años, vende recorriendo toda la ciudad y también tiene entregas, labora de domingo a domingo desde las 7 de la mañana hasta la 1 de la tarde. 
Se encuentra en su cuarto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue invitada por una amiga, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más producto para la elaboración de sus helados. Su sueño es comprarse un terreno para construir su casa.

La Señora. Nancy C. es socia del banco comunal Hermano Miguel vive por el sector de Las Orquídeas en la ciudad de Cuenca. Nuestra socia se encuentra en su séptimo crédito que realiza en la fundación y fue invitada por su mamá a formar parte del banco comunal.
Se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de ropa, esta actividad la realiza hace 2 años, labora  tres días a la semana desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde, por las noches  estudia en un colegio de la ciudad y se encuentra en cuarto año. 
La Señora Nancy tiene 22 años de edad, vive en unión libre y tiene un hijo de un año de edad, su esposo también es comerciante de ropa, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa para surtir más su mercadería. Su meta es tener un vehiculo para poder trasladarse con su mercadería.
texts.en:
The 'Hermano Miguel' community bank is made up of 8 women, most of whom are family members.  They work in different businesses which have allowed them to help their households financially.  They live in different parts of the city of Cuenca which is the third most important city in the country.  This city's people, gastronomy, culture and the beauty of its nature make it great.

Narcisa Sigüenza is a member of the 'Hermano Miguel' community bank.  She lives in El Salado sector, in the city of Cuenca.  She is 43 years old, married, and has three children aged 23, 20 and 18.  Her eldest two children are married and live independently.  Her youngest daughter helps her in her work.  Narcisa's husband lives abroad, looking for a better job to improve their household finances.  Narcisa does not own her own home but rents instead. 

Narcisa makes and sells ice cream.  She has been in this business for 18 years.  She sells her products all over the city and also makes deliveries.  She works from Sunday to Sunday, from 7.00am to 1.00pm.  This is her fourth loan through her community bank.  She was invited to join the community bank by a friend and she will use her loan money to invest in buying more products with which to make her ice cream.  Narcisa's dream is to buy a plot of land on which to build her own house.

Nancy C. is a member of the 'Hermano Miguel' community bank.  She lives in Las Orquídeas sector, in the city of Cuenca.  This is Nancy's seventh loan through our foundation and she was invited by her mom to join the community bank.

Nancy sells all kinds of clothes.  She has been in this business for 2 years.  She works three days a week, from 7.00am to 5.00pm.  In the evenings, she studies at a school in the city where she is in her fourth year.

Nancy is 22 years old.  She lives with her partner and has a one year-old child.  Her husband also sells clothes.  They don't have their own home but rent instead.
