Nancy will invest her money in buying clothes to better stock her business.  Her goal is to own a vehicle so that she can transport her merchandise.

loans.use: To buy products for making ice cream and to buy clothes

loans.name: Yuly

texts.es: Yuly, de 26 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Rolando (26)  y sus tres pequeños hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida.Trabajando arduamente esta emprendedora mujer ha logrado sacar adelante sus sembríos, todas las mañana se levanta muy temprano para regar y brindarle el cuidado respectivo a sus cultivos de  café y plátanos  los cuales posteriormente venderá en la ciudad de Pichanaki, ya que es ahí donde obtiene los mejores precios por sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede disfrutar de la libertad de laborar en sus campos, ya lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar la tierra. Para el futuro  espera poder adecuar sus tierras para plantar mucho más café.Es  el tercer préstamo de Yuly con MFP, sabe que este préstamo le ayudara bastante en el progreso y desarrollo de su negocio, es por eso que esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, en su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy querida.Con los ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono y fertilizantes, para mejorar la productividad  de sus tierras.
texts.en:
Yuly is 26 years old.  She is a very kind and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her husband Rolando (26) and her three young children for whom she would like to provide a better quality of life.

Through her hard work, this enterprising woman has managed to make progress with her crops.  Every morning she gets up very early to irrigate and care for her coffee and banana crops which she will later sell in the city of Pichanaki since this is where she obtains the best prices for her products.  What she most likes about her work is enjoying the freedom of working in her fields.  She has been in this business for 8 years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be having to work her land.  In the future, she hopes to be able to prepare her land for planting a lot more coffee.

This is Yuly's third loan with MFP.  She knows that this loan will help her in making progress and developing her business and, for this reason, she is prepared to make her loan repayments on time.  Yuly is a very responsible member of her community bank which means that she is very well liked.  She will use the 800 Peruvian soles she has requested to buy more manure and fertilizers, to improve the productivity of her land.

loans.use: To buy manure and fertilizers to improve her crops

loans.name: Zayda

texts.es: Zayda, de 23 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Juan (24) y sus dos pequeños  hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida.Con mucho esfuerzo Zayda a logrado trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas, ella cultiva, plátanos, maíz y café, los cuales luego lleva a vender hasta la ciudad de Pichanaki, donde los comercializa al por mayor. Sus cultivos le han brindado los ingresos necesarios para mantenerse, es por eso que desea poner todas sus ganas en sacar adelante este negocio. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, ya lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta Pichanaki, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. Para más adelante tiene planeado  comprar nuevas tierras, para ampliar su producción.Este es el segundo préstamo de Zayda con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos y espera serlo también ahora. En su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa y siempre esta al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en su grupo.Zaida tiene planeado invertir  los mil soles solicitados en la compra de  abono e insecticidas, con lo cual espera mejorar sus cultivos, de esta manera espera seguir progresando.
texts.en:
Zayda is 23 years old.  She is a very humble and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her husband Juan (24) and her two young children for whom she would like to provide a better quality of life.

Through her hard work, Zayda has managed to work her land and make it productive.  She grows bananas, corn and coffee which she later takes to sell wholesale in the city of Pichanaki.  Her crops have provided her with the income she needs to support herself and, for this reason, she would like to get ahead in this business.  What she most likes about her work is caring for her crops.  She has been in this business for 8 years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be transporting her products to Pichanaki since the sacks that she carries are very heavy and they make her very tired.  In the future, Zayda plans to buy new land, to expand her production.

This is Zayda's second loan with MFP and she has been very punctual in repaying her previous loan.  She hopes to continue this.  Zayda takes an active part in her community bank and she is always up to date with the agreements that her group reaches.  Zayda plans to invest the 1,000 Peruvian soles that she has requested in buying manure and insecticides with which she hopes to improve her crops.  In this way, she hopes to continue making progress.

loans.use: To buy manure and insecticides for her crops

loans.name: Las Pauteñitas (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Pauteñita esta formado por 8 socias y 2 socios quienes en sus  trabajos luchan día a día para mejorar la economía de sus hogares, son personas muy alegres y siempre ven la vida con optimismo. Viven por el cantón Paute, este cantón se caracteriza por su clima templado, su gente en su mayoría se dedica a la agricultura y cría de animales.

La Señorita Ana L. es socia del banco comunal Pauteñitas, vive en el cantón  Paute en el sector Jardines de Paute, es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue invitada por su mamá a formar parte de este grupo.
Tiene 23 años de edad, es soltera y vive con sus padres quienes tienen una casa propia. 
La Señorita Ana es una profesional y se dedica a la docencia hace un año y dos meses, labora dictando clases en una escuelita, trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 7 y media de la mañana hasta las 12 y media del medio día. 
El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una computadora que le hace falta para su trabajo. Su meta es obtener su titulo de licenciatura.
 
La Señora Blanca C. es socia del banco comunal Pauteñitas, vive por el sector de Uzhuputh que  pertenece al cantón Paute, tiene 41 años, es casada y tiene 6 hijos de 20, 17, 15, 12, 5 años de edad y su ultimo hijo de apenas un mes de nacido, sus tres primeros hijos se dedican a trabajar para sus gastos y estudian en un colegio a distancia, su cuarto hijo  estudia en el colegio y su quinto hijo está en un jardín de infantes del sector. Su esposo labora en la agricultura, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven cuidando una quinta. 
Doña Blanca se dedica al cuidado de una quinta hace 20 años en donde trabaja en la agricultura y arreglo de los jardines, también se dedica a elaborar helados y venta frutas  en un colegio del sector, esta actividad la realiza hace 18 años, vende de lunes a sábados.
Este su primer crédito y fue  invitada por una amiga a formar parte del banco comunal,  el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de frutas y mas productos para la elaboración de sus helados. Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The Pauteñita communal bank has 10 members, 8 women and 2 men, who struggle daily in their work to improve their home economies.  They are very cheerful people who always look at life with optimism.  They live in Paute canton which is notable for its mild weather.  Most of its residents raise animals and are farmers.

Ana L. is a member of the Pauteñitas communal bank.  She lives in Paute canton in the Jardines de Paute neighborhood.  This is the first loan she’s negotiated with the communal bank and she was invited to become part of the group by her mother.  She is 23 years old, single and lives with her parents who own their house.

Ana is a professional.  She’s been a teacher for a year and two months.  She teaches in a little school Monday through Friday from 7:30am until noon.

She will use the money from her loan to buy a computer she needs for her work.  Her goal is to get her Bachelor’s Degree.

Blanca C. is a member of the Pauteñitas communal bank.  She lives in the Uzhuputh neighborhood of Paute canton.  She’s 41 years old, married and has 6 children who are 20, 17, 15, 12 and 5 years of age; her youngest child is barely a month old.  The oldest three work to meet their personal expenses and got to high school at a distance.  Her fourth son is in school and her fifth child is in a local kindergarten.  Her husband works in farming. They do not own a house of their own; they live as caretakers on a ranch.

Blanca has cared for this ranch for the last 20 years.  She works farming and tending to the gardens.  She also manufactures ice-cream and sells fruit at a local school.  She’s been in this activity for 18 years and sells from Monday through Saturday.

This is her first loan.  She was invited to join the communal bank by a girl friend.  She will use the money from the loan to buy fruit and other ice-cream making ingredients.  Her dream is to have a house of her own.

loans.use: To buy fruit, ice-cream making ingredients and a computer.

loans.name: Crisóstomo

texts.es:
El señor Crisóstomo D. L. C.  tiene un negocio D. venta D. abarrotes y papelería, el cual es L. fuente D. ingresos D. su familia.
Al negocio le esta haciendo falta mercancía D. abarrotes y ampliar el local para L. mercancía D. L. papelería, pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para L. inversión y no quiere descapitalizar el negocio.
Es por eso que solicita su cooperación para este préstamo y poder invertir en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mr. Crisóstomo D. L. C. has a grocery and stationery shop which is his family’s source of income.

The business is lacking groceries and it needs to be expanded to accommodate stationery items but he currently lacks funds to invest and he doesn’t want to decapitalize the business.  This is why he’s asking for cooperation in the loan to be able to invest in the business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise and expand the business.

loans.name: Ernesto Alonso

texts.es:
El joven Ernesto Alonso L. esta estudiando la carrera de administración de empresas, pero tiene los gastos de la inscripción y pagos de los exámenes, en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder cubrir este gastos y terminar su correrá profesional. 
Es por eso que esta solicitando un préstamo y así pagar en la universidad y terminar de estudiar. 
Planea pagar el crédito  con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo en una agencia de seguros, en el puesto de repartidor. Ya que es soltero y solo vive con su mama
texts.en:
Ernesto Alonso L. is a young man who is studying for a degree in business administration.  However, he has to pay registration and exam fees.  Right now he does not have the money he needs to cover these expenses and to complete his course.

For this reason, he is requesting a loan to pay his university fees and to finish his studies.

Ernesto plans to pay back his loan with the money that he makes from his work in an insurance company, working as a assessor.  Ernesto is single and lives with his mom.

loans.use: To cover his university registration fees

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Khim

texts.en:
Khim O. has been spending her life cultivating crops. She has gained experience in the farming business since 2000. She typically earns an average revenue of $2.50 per day. Growing crops is an annual action with which she has had great success.

Khim O. is married and has two school-aged children. Her husband works in the farm fields frequently alongside her. Recently, she and her family have been uncomfortable because their old house needs repair. Therefore, Khim O. would like a loan to purchase wood to repair the house. Khim O. and her young child appear in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase wood to repair her old house

loans.name: Flavio

texts.es:
El señor Flavio M. ya ha tenido dos créditos con Kiva, y esta muy agradecido por su cooperación en estos prestamos los cuales a mejorar mucho su vivienda. 
Esta nuevamente solicitando un crédito para terminara la losa de concreto al frente de su casa ya que actual mente es de madera y quiere que su familia este mas cómoda y segura. 
Planea pagar el préstamo con una parte del ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo que tiene como chofer de  camión de carga.
La persona que aparece en la foto es su hija, ya que el Don Flavio M. se encontraba en su trabaja y su esposa la señora Maria Esther Castañeda no se encontraba en es momento en la casa.
texts.en:
Flavio M. has already had two loans through Kiva and he is very grateful for Kiva's cooperation in these loans which have helped him to make many improvements to his home.

He is requesting a new loan to finish building the concrete slab in front of his home since it is currently made from wood and he would like his family to be more comfortable and safe.

Flavio plans to pay back his loan with a part of the money he makes from his work as a truck driver.

The person who appears in this photo is his daughter since Flavio was out working and his wife, Maria Esther Castañeda was not home at the time the photo was taken.

loans.use: To finish building the concrete slab in front of his home

loans.name: Oeurn

texts.en: Oeurn N. is 54 years old, married, and has seven adult children, one of whom is a vegetable seller in the local market. She currently lives in the province of Kompong Cham. She and her husband are local farmers, and they always help each other plant different crops on their farmland, which they inherited many years ago from their grandparents. Oeurn N. has been in the farming business for years, and she always gets good results. Planting beans can help Oeurn N. and her family improve their lifestyle.  She is applying for a loan to rent a piece of her neighbor’s farmland to plant more bean crops in order to make additional profit.

loans.use: To rent a piece of her neighbor’s farmland to plant more bean crops

loans.name: Ry

texts.en: Mrs. Ry P. is 28 years old and her husband, Mr. Samet Heng, is 28 years old and a construction worker.  They live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have three children.  Ry has been a weaver since she was 17 years old, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middleman in the village who then sells them in the Phnom Penh market. She is asking for her first loan of $300 to purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials

loans.name: Khat

texts.en: Khat N. is divorced and lives with her two children, one of whom is a young child and one of whom is married and earning an income of approximately $ 1.25 each day. She earn her income by farming. She would like to try planting a dry-season rice field, but does not have capital to do so yet. To solve this problem, Khat N. would like a loan to buy fertilizers, insecticides, and seeds for planting.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, insecticides, and seeds for planting

loans.name: Man

texts.en: Man H. is 52 years old, widowed, and has eight adult children, two of whom are married and six of whom are single.  She lives in Phnom Penh City. Man H. has been earning her living by selling fish in her community since 2005. She sells fish that she buys from her supplier. She also rents her house to make additional income. Presently, Man H. hires motor taxis to pick up her fish for sale in her village, which costs her a lot of money.  Therefore, she hopes to reduce the amount she spends on transportation by using her loan to purchase a motorbike.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to transport her fish to sale

loans.name: Yet

texts.en: Yet S., 43, is a divorced father blessed with three kids who all attend school. Yet S. is currently a professional language teacher in a private school. He started his job in 2000 and is able to generate a daily income of $9 to help manage his family's financial problems. S. is taking out this loan to buy furniture for his house.

loans.use: To buy furniture for his house.

loans.name: Man

texts.en: Man R. is an older woman, 62 years old, and is a mother blessed with a daughter and a son. Her children are employed: her son works in a hotel in Phnom Penh City and her daughter is a coffee seller. They also provide their income to contribute to their family’s living expenses. Man R. was married, but her husband died of many years ago. To earn a living, Man R. sells Khmer noodles to her neighbors who live in the village as well as managing the housework. Man R. will be using her loan to help improve her daughter's business. She will use the funds to buy coffee and other soft drinks for selling.

loans.use: To buy coffee and other soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en:
Rodolfo N. is from the village of Mangga. He is 43 years old. Rodolfo is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Rodolfo owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Rodolfo has been engaged in his business for over 23 years and earns approximately 30000 PHP per harvest.

In 2010, Rodolfo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Rodolfo is requesting a new loan of 25000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Rodolfo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Florentina L. is from the village of Mangga. She is 49 years old. Florentina is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Florentina owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Florentina has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 25000 PHP every harvest season.

In 2010, Florentina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Florentina is requesting a new loan of 21000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Florentina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for services to increase crop yield.

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.en:
Jacinto V. Jr. is from the village of Mangga, Quezon, Isabela. He is 54 years old. Jacinto is single. To make a living, Jacinto owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Jacinto has been engaged in his business for over 30 years and earns approximately 30000 PHP every harvest season.

In 2010, Jacinto joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Jacinto is requesting a new loan of 22000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Jacinto from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.

loans.name: Uch

texts.en:
Uch R. is a 54-year-old single woman, and she earns her living by cultivating rice crops. She was married, but she has been divorced from her husband for years. Currently, she lives with her three children, two of whom are single, and one is married. She has two children who work in various jobs and they share their salary with Uch R. every month. 

In the past, Uch R. has always hired the neighbor’s cow in order to alleviate the chore of plowing the farmland. Right now, Uch R. hopes to buy her own cow and that is why she is applying for a loan from Kiva. With the rest of her loan, she will buy seeds, and fertilizers.

loans.use: To buy two cows for plowing the farmland.

loans.name: Lesvia Vicente

texts.es:
Lesvia es una mujer trabajadora que con ayuda y experiencia de su hijo ahora tiene un gimnasio con maquinas especiales para la gente que quiere estar bien ejercitada y tener una buena salud. 

Viviendo en una zona periurbana y con unos ahorros pudo conseguir hace algún tiempo atrás un negocio que le rindiera dinero para poder mantener a su familia y poder estar cerca de su hijo.  En la actualidad ella aprendió del negocio con ayuda de su hijo trabajando en todo el dia atendiendo a los clientes que requieren del servicio del gimnasio. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones con el negocio y quiere seguir trabajando a lado de su hijo por eso quiere darle un mejor servicio a los clientes comprando con el préstamo maquinas para el gimnasio y cemento para construirlo mejor. En el futuro quiere adecuar mejor el local para que sus clientes estén a gusto.
texts.en:
Lesvia is a hard working woman who with her son’s help and experience has a gym with special machines for people who want to do exercise and have good health.

Living in a periurban zone she was able to use a few savings a while ago to get a business that would generate funds to support her family and be near her son.  She learned the business with help from her son working all day tending to customers who require gym services.

She has many hopes for the business and wants to continue working alongside her son.  This is why she wants to provide better customer service using the loan to buy machines for the gym and cement to improve its construction.  In the future she’d like to better equip the site so that her customers will be more comfortable.

loans.use: For machines and cement.

loans.name: Yin

texts.en:
The woman in the photograph is Yin A., age 46, who lives in the province of Kompong Cham province, which is the best territory for farming. Yin A. is a married woman who is devoted to her four children, and all of them are single. Three of her children are employed in different jobs. 

Yin A. has a big farm thA. she inherited from her grandmother. Yin A. grows various rice crops, and she has never had a bad result from her farming business. Yin A. has another farm thA. she owns, but she is still not plowing yet. She hopes to use her Kiva loan to rent a plowing machine for plowing her farmland and to pay for farmland which she bought before.

loans.use: To rent a plowing machine for plowing her farmland and to pay for farmland which she previously bought.

loans.name: Khishigbayar

texts.en:
Mr. Khishigbayar, 35 years old, lives with his wife and four children in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. Khishigbayar’s family used to live in Khovd, the most remote western province of Mongolia, and in 2006 they moved to Darkhan in search of a better life. When they settled down in Darkhan, they bought a small family house, but it was burnt down accidentally, bringing a big loss to the family. Mr. Khishigbayar has managed to build a new house, thanks to his business and hard work.

In 2000, Khishigbayar and his wife started a shoemaking business and have since accumulated huge experience in making traditional Mongolian handmade shoes. These shoes are very popular in Mongolia and they are very comfortable and warm in winter time. Currently, they use their family house as a workshop. Since the business is expanding and the children are growing, this is becoming a big problem for them. Therefore, they are planning to add an extension to the house and use it as a workshop in the future. Mr. Khishigbayar and his wife are very hardworking people with much motivation and set goals to expand their business and to provide their children with a good education. At the moment, they want to buy a dust remover for the workshop and another sewing machine which will help them increase the varieties of shoes they make.

loans.use: to buy a dust remover for the workshop and another sewing machine

loans.name: Cecilia Alexandra

texts.es:
Cecilia de 48 años,  vive en una zona urbana llamada Suburbio, es madre soltera. Tiene dos hijas que han sido su inspiración para trabajar y así darles una buena vida. Inicio la actividad comercial vendiendo perfumes a sus conocidos y vecinos poco a poco mejoro sus ingresos y con las ganancias que tenía comenzó a invertir su dinero en artículos para papelería. 

En la actualidad tiene su negocio una papelería en la parte delantera de su casa, trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 23h00pm todos los días. Vende papelería como cuadernos, plumas, papeles, laminas etc. Tiene muchas aspiraciones para su negocio por eso quiere continuar con su negocio aunque tiene una complicación en su casa.

 En estas épocas de lluvia quiere continuar con su negocio pero también quiere arreglar su casa con algunas modificaciones y que la lluvia no le afecte su trabajo por eso quiere el préstamo para comprar cemento, bloques y techo para mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Cecilia is 48 years old and is a single mother.  She lives in an urban area called Suburbio.  She has two daughters who have been her inspiration to work so she can provide them with a good life.  When she began doing business she sold perfume to acquaintances and neighbors.  However, little by little her earnings began to increase allowing her to begin investing her money in stationary shop items.
 
She currently runs a stationary shop from a front room of her house.  She works daily from 6am to 11pm and sells items such as notebooks, pens, paper and educational materials.  She has many aspirations for her shop and therefore she would like to continue doing business, though there is a complication with her house.
 
She would like to keep her shop open during this rainy season, but she also wants to make some repairs to the home to prevent the rain from affecting her business.  For that reason, Cecilia is requesting a loan to purchase cement, cinder blocks and roofing.

loans.use: To purchase cement, cinder blocks and roofing materials.

loans.name: Chy

texts.en: Chy S., age 35, is married to Hang Va, age 37, and they have been living in Kompong Cham province. Chy S. has five children, four of whom are single, while the other one is married. Chy S. has two daughters who work as sewing workers at the garment industry, and has a formal salary monthly. Chy S.’s husband has been earning a living for years by climbing the palm trees behind his house. Palm-tree-climbing, as an occupation, is very common for poor people who live in the community. Chy S. will use her loan to assist her husband’s business toward buying ladders and containers for collecting palm juice.

loans.use: To buy ladders and containers for collecting palm juice.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
María de 41 años,  es una mujer trabajadora que desde pequeña le gusto el comercio y la venta de mercadería de persona a persona.   

Poco a poco a surtido su mercadería pero sigue vendiendo puerta a puerta y a sus vecinos y amigos que le compran a menudo y le ayudan a generar más ingresos. Ella vende ropa de hombres y mujeres también perfumes para variar un poco en sus ventas. Una de las cosas que le favorece es que aunque la tiene 41 años ella está estudiando en la universidad y los compañeros le comprar varia mercadería. 

Quiere continuar con su negocio por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo mercadería como pantalones, camisas, zapatos y asi tener variedad en su mercadería.
texts.en:
41 year old María is a hard working woman who has liked being in business and selling door to door since she was a little girl.

Little by little she has varied her merchandise, but continues to sell door to door.  Her friends and neighbors, who enthusiastically buy from her, also help her earn a greater income.  She sells men’s and women’s clothing and perfumes in order to vary her merchandise a bit.  One thing that sets her apart is that, even though she is 41 years old, she is studying at university and her classmates also buy some items from her.

She wants to continue in her business, and wants to use the money from this loan to buy pants, shirts, and shoes.  This was she will be able to offer a variety of merchandise.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Thoeng

texts.en: Thoeng S. is 40 years old and a married woman. She is currently a recycling seller, and she always purchases used goods to sell to a wholesaler, who then sells the goods in bulk to other countries. The used goods which she buys are mostly leftover electrical wires and plastic products. She has a life partner in her husband who works as a construction worker as well as being a local farmer. She has four children; two are single and the remaining two are married. She has two children who assist her in contributing their profit by working in different jobs. Presently, Thoeng S. uses her old bicycle as a vehicle to pick up her items in and around her community. Because her old bicycle is hard to move, she could not ride very far. So, she is looking for a loan to buy a used motorcycle in order to make her transportation easier.

loans.use: To buy a used motorcycle in order to make her transportation easier.

loans.name: Shahtykan's Group

texts.en:
Shahtykan M. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Tahskomur, a small mining town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is 32 and married. Her husband earns money by mining coal. Together they bring up four daughters. Three older daughters are at school and the youngest is preschool age (under seven). 

Two years ago, with the initial investment of 2000 soms, Shahtykan purchased two goats for breeding in order to make additional money to cover family expenses. Now she earns about 6000 soms reselling livestock at a higher price after fattening. She hopes to obtain the loan because she needs money to improve the family’s living conditions. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase a washing machine.  

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase a washing machine.

loans.name: Hin

texts.en: Hin S. has been in a farming business for many years. She is a widow woman who lives with her four children. Three of the children are single and one is married. Some sources of her profit come from her three kids who are employed in different occupations. She has no life partner because her husband passed away a long time ago. In addition, Hin S. raises a few pigs behind her house. She requests a loan of $1,100 to purchase small pigs to feed and then sell. By using this loan, she will get more profit and be able to support her family effectively.

loans.use: To purchase small pigs to feed and then sell

loans.name: Minura's Group

texts.en:
Minura D. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Tashkomur, a small mining town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is 23 years old and married. Her husband earns money by mining coal; sometimes he resells wool to make additional income. They have two children, both of whom are preschool age (under seven). Three years ago, with the initial investment of 4000 soms, Minura started to breed cattle. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase a cow in order to increase the number of cattle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Din

texts.en: Din N. is divorced and lives with her three children. One of her children is married and two are single and earn an average income of $1.70 a day. Din N. earns her income by farming. Din N. would like to try growing a dry-season rice field, but she does not have capital to do so yet. To solve this problem, Din N. would like a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for planting.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Karamatkan's Group

texts.en:
Karamatkan M. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Tashkomur, a small mining town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is 48 and married. Her husband is a pensioner. They have two sons, both of whom are at school. Four years ago with the initial investment of 8,000 soms, the family started to breed cattle. By reselling cattle after fattening, they earn 7,800 soms per month. That profit made it possible for them to repair the house. With money received from the loan, Karamatkan wants to purchase cattle for breeding. In the future, she dreams of purchasing a new vehicle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Gulbarchyn's Group

texts.en:
Gulbarchyn A. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Tashkomur, a small mining town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is 34 years old and divorced. She brings up a son, 14, who studies at school. Three years ago with the initial investment of 2,000 soms, Gulbarchyn started to sell Kyrgyz national cloth and dressmaking supplies. She earns 10,000 soms per month. That profit made it possible for her to save 200,000 soms to purchase a flat. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase fabrics and materials for sewing. Gulbarchyn also wants to try selling coal to make additional money. In the future, she dreams of purchasing a vehicle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and materials

loans.name: Sumbersari Permai Group

texts.en: Sumbersari Permai is located in Melaya, Bali, where most people work as farmers. The group was formed after they got information from a neighboring village who had already formed groups of pig farmers. The group is chaired by Ni Kadek J. and has 10 members. Ni Kadek J. is married and has one child, age 6. To support the family, Ni Kadek runs a pig farming business. Currently, she is raising two pigs. The loan she got was used to buy a pig and feed. She hopes that with the extra pig, she will make more profit.

loans.use: To buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana does sewing for her neighboring clients to help her family financially. She started this business a few years ago because her husband’s earning was not enough to fulfill the basic needs of the family.

Her husband is a tailor master. He is an expert in sewing men’s clothes and operates his tailoring shop in the nearby market.

Rukhsana is the mother of two sons and two daughters. Her elder son works in a factory for a low income while her elder daughter operates her beauty parlor at home. Her remaining children are getting their education.

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help her husband in expanding his tailoring business. With the loan, he will buy a new sewing machine and will hire a worker, which will help him completing his orders on time and earn extra income. She is a new loan user of Asasah. She is hopeful that an investment will make her husband’s business more profitable.

She is the resident of a city named Gujranwala which is a mid-sized city of Punjab, Pakistan and known for its rice industry. She has been living there in a two-room brick house with her family for more than 24 years.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for tailoring business

loans.name: Guljan's Group

texts.en:
Guljan R. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Tashkomur, a small mining town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is 21 and married. She has a 3-year-,old daughter. Three years ago with the initial investment of 1000 soms, Guljan and her husband started to resell coal. And now in this way, they earn 9000 soms per month. Guljan applied for the loan because she needs money to cover their family expenses.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: For personal needs

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael N. is from the village of Mangga. He is 33 years old. Michael is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Michael owns and operates a business raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Michael has been engaged in his business for more than nine years and earns approximately 30,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Michael joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Michael is requesting a new loan of 24,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Michael from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Virgo Jay's Group

texts.en:
Virgo Jay D. is from the village of De Vera, Cauayan City. Isabela. He is 33 years old. Virgo Jay is the group leader of a seven-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Virgo Jay is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Virgo Jay owns and operates a business running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Virgo Jay has been engaged in his business for more than four years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Virgo Jay joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virgo Jay has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Virgo Jay is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Virgo Jay from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Keo K. is 38 years old and has been selling a few fresh fish and vegetables in her community for more than 10 years. She sells fish that she buys from other fishermen in bulk for reasonable prices and sells it out to gain profit. She is married to Chein Tin, 44, who works at a construction field as a building worker, as well as being a local chef. Due to the fact that the rice-harvesting season is coming, Keo K. has decided to seek a loan on Kiva for capital to buy more rice while it is commanding its lowest price. Then she will sell it later when the price is increasing.

loans.use: To buy rice to stock while prices are low for future sales

loans.name: Alex Kiprotich

texts.en:
Alex Kiprotich C., a young man of 26, is married to Joylne Rutto and they live in Kapcherop in Kitale. Alex operates a butcher shop as a primary business and he also sells cereals just beside the butcher shop. He has been involved in these businesses for four years now and earns a monthly income of 10,000 KES.

He has never borrowed from any other MFI and this will be Alex's first loan from KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire 30,000 KES loan to buy maize. With the income he is going to get, he plans to diversify to farming the maize. In the future, he wants to educate his wife and take her to college and to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy maize

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: Jean D. is from the village of Pigsaan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 41 years old. Jean is widowed and has six adult children. To make a living, Jean runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, snack foods and toothpaste. Jean has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities. In 2008, Jean joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jean has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Jean is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like canned goods and snack foods. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Jean from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell, like canned goods and snack foods

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Sasine Ole

texts.en:
Sasine Ole Y., 25 years old, is married to Jackline Y. and he is a father of three children. Sasine has been farming on his own piece of land for the last five years. 
  

Sasine learned about KADET LTD from a member of a group that is registered with KADET. This will be his second loan, which he is planning to use to buy maize seeds and fertilizer. Maize has proved to do well in his area due to good climatic conditions. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, Sasine plans to enlarge his farming. His hope and dream is to export maize overseas. Sasine is a conscientious man who focuses on his set objectives.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 46 years old, married, and supports her family by operating two ventures, a furniture-making enterprise and a food vending business. She lives in Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental.

Elizabeth has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard at her furniture-making and food vending businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP).

For this loan, Elizabeth is borrowing 15,000 PHP so she can purchase more materials and inventory. This will be her ninth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 15,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom.  Elizabeth aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). Through the poverty alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to perhaps achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To buy more materials and inventory for furniture-making and food vending businesses

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: David Ruto

texts.en:
David Ruto K., 52 years old, is married to Margaret Ruto and he is a father of three children. David has been farming on his own piece of land for the last fifteen years. 
  
David learned about KADET LTD from a member of a group that is registered with KADET. This will be his first loan, which he is planning to use to buy maize seeds and fertilizer. Maize has proved to do well in his area due to good climatic conditions. David plans to use the anticipated profits from the proceeds of this loan to reinvest in the farm and plant more acres of maize. His hope and dream is to export maize overseas. David is an industrious man who focuses on his set objectives.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Turambane Group

texts.fr:
Zacharie N. est un commerçant âgé de 40 ans qui habite la localité de Kibimba de la Province de Gitega. Il fait le commerce de haricot depuis 8ans. Il a fait ses études jusqu’au niveau de l’école primaire en 6e année. Il est marie a Crescence N. qui elle-même est commerçante et membre du groupe. Ils ont 4enfants qui étudient tous. Il arrive au 10e cycle dans le crédit Communautaire avec Turame. 

Il demande le crédit Kiva pour  accroitre son capital  en achetant de grandes quantités de de haricot pour accroitre son stock à vendre et ainsi pouvoir accroitre ses économies. Il espère qu’avec les économies réalisées avec ce credit, il sera un grand commerçant en étant à mesure de subvenir aux besoins familiaux.

Il est membre  du groupe  Communautaire« Turambane».
texts.en:
Zacharie N. is a 40-year old merchant who lives in the city of Kibimba in the province of Gitega. He has had a business selling green beans for 8 years. He has a grade 6 education. He is married to Crescenece N. who is also a merchant and part of the same group. They have 4 children together and they are all in school. They are on their 10th loan cycle with the communal bank Turame (Kiva Field Partner). 

He requests a Kiva loan to supplement his capital funds with the goal of purchasing large quantities of green beans.  He will increase his supply for sale and it will increase his earnings. He hopes that with the profits earned with the help of this loan he will be able to develop his business enough to provide for his family's needs. 

He is a member of the group named "Turambane".

loans.use: To purchase large quantities for food products for resale.

loans.name: Ulfat's Group

texts.en:
Ulfat makes artificial flowers as a business. She collects orders from different gift shops and earns a regular income. The income she earns helps her with paying utility bills and the school fees of her children. 
 
She has three children, all of whom are young. Two are getting their education while her youngest daughter is only 3 years old and has not started attending school yet. 

Ulfat’s husband works abroad; she lives with her brothers and a sister. They are also involved in different works and one of her brothers runs an academy in the community, where he has a good number of students.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her brother’s academy. With the loan, he will buy furniture, like chairs and tables, for his academy. The additional furniture will help him in facilitating more students.  

Ulfat is hopeful that the investment will bring good outcomes for her brother's business. She is a new loan user of Asasah. She lives in Gujranwala, which is a mid-size city of Punjab, Pakistan, known for its rice industry. She has been living there for over nine years.

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (an Asasah Passbook) is Ulfat.

loans.use: To buy furniture for her brother's academy

loans.name: Eng

texts.en:
Eng T. is a 60-year-old farmer who lives in Kompong Cham Province. Eng T. earns a daily income about $1 per day.  She is an older woman and a widow. She has no life partner because her husband died of senility years ago. 

Eng T. has three children, one is single and two are married. One of her children is currently a recycling seller.  He buys used goods to sell to a wholesaler, who then sells them in bulk in other provinces. The used goods which he deals in are mostly leftover electrical wires and plastic. Eng T. is requesting a loan to support her son in buying a secondhand motorcycle to transport used goods for his business.

loans.use: To buy motorcycle to transport goods for business

loans.name: Kisakwa

texts.en:
Kisakwa S. is 27 years old. He is married and supporting ten people in the family. Kisakwa is a farmer and he has been doing this for the last seven years. His farm is in a productive area which has proved to be good for wheat farming.

He learned about KADET LTD through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his second loan which he is planning to buy ten bags of Kenya wheat seeds and ten bags of fertilizers. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming to increase his wheat production and educate his children.

His hope and dream is to become a large scale farmer and buy a bigger piece of land and build a permanent home. Kisakwa is a diligent man who can do more if supported financially

loans.use: to buy ten bags of Kenya wheat seeds and ten bags of fertilizers.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch P., age 58, sells new clothes next to a garment factory. In addition to selling clothes, she also plants rice crop on her own farmland. She has a life partner in her husband, who works as a teacher in the village. They are blessed with six children, two are single, and the other four are married and employed in different careers.  

Touch P. has recently sold nearly all her inventory.  She wants to replenish her stock but lacks capital. She is therefore asking for a loan in order to buy more clothes to resell. She hopes to use the remainder of the loan to buy a motor vehicle (Tuk Tuk) for one of her children, who still has no job. 

Touch P. is pictured with her husband in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to resell

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie H. is from the village of Pigsag-an, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 37 years old. Josie is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Josie owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing & shoe products in the local community. She also buys and sells gold dust. Josie has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 8000, Josie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jean Bosco N. est un commerçant âgé de 28 ans qui habite la localité de Kibimba de la Province de Gitega. Il fait le commerce de produits alimentaires comme le haricot, le riz et autres denrées depuis 13ans. Elle a fait ses études jusqu’au niveau de l’école primaire en 6e année. Il est marié et père de 1enfant de 3mois. Il arrive au 10e cycle dans le crédit Communautaire avec Turame. 

Il demande le crédit Kiva pour  accroitre son capital  en achetant de grandes quantités de produits alimentaires afin d’ouvrir une boutique et ainsi pouvoir accroitre ses économies. Il espère qu’avec les économies réalisées avec ce credit, il sera un grand commercant dans le futur. 

Il est  un des membres  du groupe  Communautaire« Fashamwenewanyu»
texts.en:
Jean Bosco N. is a 28-year old merchant who lives in the city of Kibimba, in the province of Gitega. He has sold food products such as green beans, rice, and other items for the past 13 years. He has a grade 6 education. He is married and he is the father of a 3-month old baby. He is on his 10th loan cycle with the Turame communal bank (Kiva Field Partner). 

He requests a loan to supplement his capital funds with the goal of purchasing large quantities of food products. His goal is to set up a store and to increase his earnings. He hopes that with the profits earned with the help of this loan he will be able to develop his business

He is a member of the group named "Fashamwenewanyu".

loans.use: To purchase food products to open a store.

loans.name: Farhat's Group

texts.en:
Farhat lives in Gujranwala, in Punjab, Pakistan, an area known for its rice industry. She lives there with her family in the Majeed colony area in a 2 room brick house. She came here after her marriage. Farhat is the mother of 2 daughters, both are very young and have not yet started school.  

Her husband is a very talented man. He is involved in the embroidery business and runs an embroidery shop in the market. He crafts beautiful embroidery designs on clothes, and attracts many customers. Farhat is also involved in the embroidery business, but she makes hand-made embroideries on clothes while her husband uses a machine to embroider dresses. He uses an embroidery machine because he must finish his orders on time to satisfy his customers.  
 
Farhat has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s embroidery business. With the loan, he will buy another embroidery machine and hire a worker. This will help him complete larger orders on time as well as reach more customers. He has been in this business for past 5 years and Farhat is very confident about the future growth of her husband’s business.  

Farhat is a new loan user of Asasah's.  This is her first loan application.   

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Farhat.

loans.use: To buy embroidery machine and hire worker to expand business

loans.name: Oyungerel

texts.en: Mrs. Oyungerel is 46 years old widow, lives with her three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her eldest daughter just graduated a University and works in small company and her youngest daughter is student in local University. Her son is currently unemployed and temporary lives with her grandmother and looks after her. Mrs.Oyungerel rents a space inside the small grocery store and sells a fruits and vegetables. She is running this business since 2005 and has had steady growth over the years. Her store is located close to her house and her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She is working hard to be able pay her daughters education fees and other necessary expenses and she also believes that a University diploma is the best legacy parents can give to their children. This time she is requesting a loan to increase her working capital and stock up more products to sell before the Mongolian Lunar new years celebration.

loans.use: to increase working capital and stock up more products to sell

texts.en:

She went to primary school but left in sixth grade. She is a widow and mother to four children, who are 20, 18, 16 and 14 years old respectively. She also has in her care an orphan whom she met. All of the children are studying. She is on her tenth community loan from Turame. 

She is reqesting the Kiva loan to increase her capital by buying large quantities of food products and thereby being able to increase her savings. She is hoping to be able to cover her family's needs with the savings she makes from this loan. 

She is one of the members of the "Girumwete" community group.

texts.fr:
Henry M. est un commerçant âgé de 30 ans qui habite la Commune  urbaine de Buyenzi en Mairie de Bujumbura. Il fait le commerce des produits de boutique depuis 10ans. Il a fréquenté l’école jusqu’en 2e année de L’Université. Il est marié à Linda Nzorubara qui étudie à L’Université. Ils ont 1 enfant âgé d’une année. Il arrive au 7e cycle dans le crédit Communautaire avec Turame. 

Il demande le crédit Kiva pour  accroitre son capital  en achetant de grandes quantités de  boutique notamment des haricots, savons et divers autres articles à revendre aux clients et ainsi pouvoir accroitre ses économies. Il espère qu’avec les économies réalisées avec ce credit, il pourra acheter une parcelle pour construire sa propre maison et  assurer les besoins élémentaires familiaux. 

Il  est membre  du groupe  communautaire« Baraka» qui signifie benedictions.
texts.en:
Henry M. is a 30-year old businessman, who lives in the urban district of Buyenzi in the municipality of Bujumbura. He has been selling products in his shop for ten years. He attended school up until his second year at university. He is married to Linda Nzorubara, who is studying at university. They have one child who is one year old. Henry is on his seventh community loan from Turame.

He is requesting the Kiva loan to increase his capital by buying large quantities of goods for his shop, notably beans, soaps and various other items, in order to resell them to his customers and be able to increase his savings. With the savings he makes with this loan, he hopes that he will be able to buy a piece of land to build his own house on and also provide for his family's basic needs. 

He is a member of the "Baraka" community group (Baraka means blessing or benediction).

loans.use: Increase his capital by buying large quantities of goods for his shop, notably beans, soaps and other goods to resell
